review_body: Even though the Corona virus made things challenging, our experience at this hotel was not great - not enough towels in the room, only 1 tea bag for 4 people, members of our group being checked into the wrong room, members of our group not having access to a room 'till after 7pm, being charged $20 a day for incidentals without being told. Additionally, the restaurant closed down without notice, even after we had paid in advance for breakfast.Also, to get to our hotel wing, we had to walk through clouds of cigarette smoke right past the designated smoking area.

The hotel appears clean but has a horribly musty smell. It’s humid and not well ventilated. We had a roach in our room called the front desk to let them know and they said they would change rooms for us but never did. Then when we went to go to sleep we found bedbugs in our bed we called down and were offered another room again but refused to sleep at the hotel over concern of bedbugs so we sat in the lobby till 5:30 AM when our Shuttle came. The front desk agent assured us we wouldn’t be charged since we hadn’t even slept in the room but they did charge us and when I called to dispute it they refused to reimburse the charge.

The central location in Honolulu made this a prime selection. It was an easily available spot for tour pickup buses. The rooms were always cleaned and the staff was friendly and helpful all t he time.

The room is old, small, incredibly cramped, bugs, filth, cheap furniture, and cheap facilities. Terrible pool and not all that convienent.Seriously, after 35 years of being a Marriott devoted fan, this is without a doubt the worst Marriott property I have ever stayed at. I would stay at a day's in, before this place
user_name:
OpenSky99
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My Wife and I recently stayed at The Courtyard Marriott for a 2 night stopover in Honolulu prior to returning to Australia and found the hotel a real disappointment. When we checked in we were advised we had been allocated a high floor room on the pool side of hotel but what we were not told is renovations were being carried out so our view was of the painters working on a swinging stage right outside our room. We had to keep our curtains closed at all times and the only ones to enjoy our balcony were the painters who used it for their lunch venue. The room was old and outdated with the smallest shower we have ever seen. What really surprised us was we were on the elite level of the hotel but anyone who has ever stayed at a Marriott property would realise there is nothing elite about what is provided here. My advice is if you are thinking of booking for your honeymoon or first trip to Hawaii stay somewhere else. We paid around 300 aud per night but for what we got would have been disappointed paying half that.

My wife and I stayed here on the first leg of our Hawaii trip. This was our first trip to Hawaii and we came to Oahu to see Pearl Harbor and to check out Waikiki. I'll keep this review targeted to the hotel itself. Location - not bad. it sits about a 3-4 blocks from the beach, but is convenient to all of the restaurants. There's no "resort fee", which is a good thing, because this is NOT a resort. This is a hotel in a crowded city.Amenities - The hotel does have a small bar, small swimming pool that doesn't get much sun given the area buildings around it. We did get a couples massage at the onsite "spa" and both of us thought that they were very good.Staff - The front desk staff was excellent and very friendly.Rooms - This is where the review takes a turn for the worse. First of all the rooms were extremely small. I mean tiny! The shower was so tiny that I could barely even get in it. Perhaps they have other layouts with more room. We didn't have any issues with the room not being clean. Our room was on the 12th floor facing west basically looking into the hotel/condo across the street. The biggest problem was the noise. You could hear everything. They did provide ear plugs, but you could hear doors shutting/slamming all night. Both nights, we were woken up at 3:00-4:00 am to people screaming and yelling in the street below. One evening, a lady was screaming for over an hour at people passing by. My wife notified the front desk who apparently had no idea. They did call the police and the lady was asked to leave.Unfortunately, if ever in the area again, I would not stay here. It was too noisy and there was no way to get a good nights rest.

In a business/ personal trip to Honolulu, we had two great weeks at the Courtyard...it is a great location, within walking distance of the beach, shopping, restaurants and shopping...Honolulu was an awesome experience and the hotel was an important part of the visit...on-site spa was appreciated by my wife and staff was friendly and supportive...

I've been lucky enough to travel to Honolulu many times, and this hotel sticks out as the worst to date. You can generally expect a certain level of quality from standard hotel brands such as Courtyard, but this felt a lot more like staying in your uncle's old beach condo that desperately needs repairs and updating. When I was younger, I stayed in some real dumps in Waikiki, but at least those places didn't have the audacity to charge resort-like rates like the Courtyard. I stayed in the tower further back on the property, and like a lot of beachy hotels here, the doors to the rooms led directly outside. While this is not unique to the Courtyard, that doesn't make this "feature" any less annoying. It means you hear the street noise, and there is a LOT of it--trucks and buses going up and down the side streets, garbage trucks coming by at 4:30 in the morning, late night revelers, etc. My room looked out onto a abandoned lot surrounding by chain link fence and filled with overgrown grass and weeds. The room itself was run down and outdated, with a wall-mounted a/c unit that didn't take the moisture out of the air. The bathroom had a stained tub and no fan, just a window that would open a crack, adding to the humidity in the room. The sink and countertop in the bathroom were comically small. The taps in both sinks were installed so close to the edge of the sink that it was impossible to wash your hands without creating a lake on the bathroom or kitchenette counter. On the service side, they failed to make up our room two days in a row. Had to call down to get them to bring us fresh towels and ask them to service the room. When they did clean the rooms, they didn't do a very good job, often failing to replace amenities and wipe down parts of the bathroom. When I tried to call for late checkout on my last morning, I called the front desk 3 times with no answer. The only positive was the pool and hot tub area. It was relatively secluded and a nice amenity. The lobby is nice, but who spends time in a hotel lobby in Hawaii? The location also was pretty good, but you can walk to everywhere from everywhere in Waikiki, so you don't really get any points for that. Book elsewhere.
user_name:
Alanwk85
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: A recent 5-day stay at this property was rife with problems despite really solid front desk staff & great bartenders. Online booking & check/in went smoothly as expected for a 2 room booking. It went downhill from there. I moved to 3 different rooms to escape a cat litter-like reek throughout the Kuhio side of the hotel. Both rooms’ bathrooms had old stains, hair, small insects and mold. The hallway outside my room was mostly blocked with cleaning carts, equipment and stacks of garbage every night when I returned to my room. Given the prominence of the Coronavirus outbreak and the huge Asian tourism traffic, the absence of basic hygiene practices inspired very little confidence.My room also was noisy and was clearly not updated with proper outlets etc needed for working in the room. Connectivity issues forced me to work in the very small lobby area throughout my stay. The valet parking staff was shockingly reckless & flippant. One one occasion despite short warning honks, we only avoided being hit by quickly reversing out of a Valet’s path. When speaking to the valet, 4 young valets were dismissive and laughing as we explained the dangerous behavior. When we tried to speak to the hotel manager, he was off and after a long wait, the acting manager finally showed up & said he’d “speak” to the valets. In my view, reckless speeding in a small parking lot should be taken seriously - even if you’re a young man who is intent on being cool to your peers.The front desk staff was very nice & tried to be helpful throughout the terrible stay, but time and time again we got conflicting information about what the platinum food & beverage credit covered & didn’t cover which was frustrating and stressful every single day. When I checked out, they finally resolved all of the various daily food credit issues which was ultimately a relief but the confusion and constantly changing criteria was unnecessary and an unpleasant daily adventure.The bartenders were wonderful and friendly - consistently. The pool area was small with very minimal direct sunlight and the smallest threadbare towels I’ve ever seen. The location is walkable to almost everywhere but do not expect to have access to any beach front facilities other than those for the general public. I may have to stay here again for business & I really hope they take this review seriously and up their game because the totality of the experience was very negative.

Stayed here years ago but did not see any real updates. An executive room was small (as my picture will verify) with a tiny bathroom and shower. There was only a desk chair to sit it. If you don’t care about being by the beach and only want to sleep and shower then it is ok. I did not really hear noise in the hotel but you get street noise and it is windy higher up. There are 2 towers here. I prefer the main tower. You can walk to many shops and restaurants from here. Not sure I would stay again.

The location is amazing. We were a block away from the shops and 10 minutes from the beach. There was so much to do. The pool is fantastic and warm. The service is great.I would not recommend staying in the tower. and I strongly suggest corporate go take a look and renovate it, I mean gut the whole thing. We originally got a room in the " tower". It was musty, mouldy and warm even with the A/C. It also had no bathtub and with 2 toddlers, a bathtub is a must for us. The suite also had a sofa bed and my husband slept on it for one night, he said it was so uncomfortable. The next morning we immediately asked for another room. We got another room in another building and although it wasn't great, at least it wasn't mouldy. Don't get me wrong, it was barely a step up from a motel. With the amount of $$ they charged us .. they should be able to renovate/gut the tower. Will I stay here again? Yes but I would insist on a room in the main building.

We have stayed here 3 times over the years and it is now a very tired looking hotel. There are signs of a lack of maintenance in many places e.g broken loungers, broken mortar around the pool area (cheap glue repair in spa), tape holding a dispenser in the bathroom (the list goes on). This is a real shame as this could be so much better.Note to management - your exterior painters aren’t doing a great job. There were sections missed on our balcony which looks very poor.The staff are very friendly and the rooms are clean, but this is now a very noisy hotel. There are a few reasons for this I could see. 1. The lift has a pointless tone as it goes up each floor and you hear this ALL night. 2. People seem to come and go all hours in the corridors and the rooms aren’t well insulated.On a side note - the room we had booked had a kitchenette - but no cutlery or plates which isn’t good.I haven’t written this hotel off yet but I won’t stay here again until I saw an effort to address maintenance and noise.If you book here, ask for a quiet room away from the lift (main hotel building), that may give you a night’s sleep.

This place is my "Go To" Hotel in Honolulu. Clean comfortable rooms, good location, and fairly priced drinks at the bar.Pro Tip: Ask for a room on the poolside, or the Tower for a quieter experience from the noise of downtown. Theres also a saltwater pool there thats hidden/not well known.A few recommendations: Rivals is across the street and has a good whiskey selection.Siam Square is next door and has amazing Thai Food.Ramen Nakamura has the best ramen anywhere outside of Japan.Dukes market is down the road, and has all your tourist trinkets.The International Market is a nice stroll.

I was here for a week on a vacation trip, and I was very pleased with this property. Front and back house are not only very efficient but super friendly and accommodating. Special shout out to Leila in housekeeping and the front desk/concierge team as a whole. I will be staying here again on my next visit to Waikiki.

I'm a business traveler and work in aviation, everytime my colleagues and I come to Honolulu, the office books us rooms here. EVERYTIME I NEVER get sleep at this hotel, its loud, even at 4 in the morning! You'll either hear people screaming down the hallways, doors are slamming and walls are paper thin. The hotel is on active street and the sounds of cars, buses, drunk people or crazy homeless people screaming at the top of their lungs are nonstop and the worse part, the hotel wont do anything about the disrespectful people staying here or the crazy homeless people! The air conditioning machine is super outdated, your room is either hot or frigid cold. The rooms are super tiny unless you're in a suite, its like staying in a dormitory!! Paint and the tub is chipped everywhere, it feels so dirty, I don't want to touch anything! I made a call to our office, spoke with our Vice President and were checking out tomorrow and going to a better hotel. Its important for flight crew to get rest to have a safe flight for our passengers, so our office will never book us or the 120 flight crew members we have at the company with this hotel. Good riddance Courtyard Marriott Wakiki!!! You will NOT be missed!

Quite an unpleasant stay - dirty room, very small shower, and the staff wasn’t very courteous. The pool wand location are convenient, but the value is poor. Overall fairly disappointed, so we would recommend staying elsewhere.

We booked a last minute stay due to us not liking a vacation rental we had. First, this hotel is in a downtown area. So its going to be noisy. Not sure why some other reviewers seem surprised. No views outside of basic city views. Good location, just a few blocks from the beach. ALL beaches in Oahu are public access. Plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. Rooms are SMALL. Showers are TINY. As a longtime Marriott member even I was a bit surprised. But functional. I was here during the Christmas holidays. (Note: I will NEVER return during the Christmas holidays....CROWDED). Staff is great. But it was very busy here. Rooms were pretty clean, and somewhat updated. Pool is pretty small, but heated and pleasant. Gym is also small but functional. WiFi was relatively slow. Overall, for value, not bad.

This is a decent mid-city property that's just a few minutes' walk to all the major attractions in Waikiki. While we never felt unsafe during our stay, it should be noted that there is a high homeless population in Waikiki, and there were a dozen or so individuals who took up residence each night on some old furniture and mattresses that had been discarded on the sidewalk across the street from the hotel.The hotel itself is composed of two separate buildings that are on the same block but not otherwise connected. Our group found ourselves in the "secondary" building, where I found the rooms to be dated but adequate. The "main" building has the check-in area, bar, and pool area which was very nice. There's a restaurant on site as well but we found it mediocre and it's best skipped.Upsides - nice, affordable lodging close to the action. No exorbitant resort fees like what Marriott charges at their other properties.Downsides - more of a city scene and not on the beach, but Waikiki is a very diverse destination with lots to do, so this is not really a downside as long as you're aware in advance.

This is not a luxury vacation hotel. It is several blocks from the beach... you aren’t going to float out of your suite in your gauzy cover-up over your bikini and immediately sink into your beach chair, reaching for your mai-tai. Nope. You’re gonna hoof it for ten minutes and stomp through that ritzy hotel you’re NOT staying in to try to find somewhere to sit where the beach bunnies aren’t smugly sitting, served by their beach boys.But those bunnies are paying the big bucks. You’re not. It’s a trade off, right?My suggestion: if you’re staying here, you’re almost certainly looking to save some cash. That said, DO NOT RENT A CAR.Or if you do, rent it for a day or two, from an agency in Waikiki. Do not rent it at the airport, where you’ll pay taxes out the wazoo. If you wanna spend a day exploring the island, great! Get the car, drive around, then turn the damn thing in. Parking at any hotel is $45+/night.Yeah, yeah, there’s free parking along Ala Wai Blvd. You’re as likely to find that as you are to hit the lottery. Not gonna happen. Trust me. I’ve been traveling to HNL for work for 20 years now. Nope.The Bus (AKA “Da Bus”) is fabulous and will get you anywhere you want to go. Download the app, it will give you all kinds of updates. If you’re there for more than a week, get a pass. WORTH IT.Back to the hotel. Read the other reviews. They’re really accurate. Don’t accept a room on a low floor facing Kuhio Ave, it’s noisy, wait for another.If you’re offered an upgrade to a room next to the elevator in the main building, TAKE IT. It’s a one-bed and you won’t hear the dinging. Seriously, I’m super-sensitive and its okay.The washing machines are reasonable but BRING SOAP AND DRYER SHEETS.The Food Pantry is a grocery store a few blocks away - not cheap but walkable. Safeway is Uber-able.

If you read other reviews both the good and bad of this hotel are pointed out. I lean toward good. I found the staff to be friendly and professional and it has a great but can be loud location. If you dream of traveling to Hawaii one day this will not be the hotel of your dreams. It may have been in 1969 but not now. However if you just want to be in Hawaii and are looking for a bed to sleep on this is a good option. I booked the cozy room but as Gold was put in a Deluxe corner room. More than enough room for me. Bathroom was small but manageable. Shower was coffin sized and it took me a few minutes to figure our how to get water temp correct. My biggest issue was the mattress. I woke up with a sore back every morning. In the end based on other reviews here I was not surprised by anything at this hotel. It was as I expected and honestly probably a bit better than I thought it would be. That said if I was a high level Bonvoy member I would not save my suite upgrades for this hotel. Would I book to this place as a first choice for my next trip? No. However, would consider it as I would other similar properties in the area. If I was not looking to book a dream vacation.

Loved that this hotel has not joined the "Waikiki resort fee" train. Room was clean and very basic. We were given a room with two double beds on the fifth floor, garden balcony: it was a bit cramped. Be aware that even though there is no resort fee, the parking is valet only and the charges are quite steep. I still thought it was better than other hotels that charged the ridiculous resort fee and a steep parking fee.

You have been warned from a Marriott Lifetime Titanium Member, who has stayed in Marriott's all over the world. This is the single worst property I have ever stayed at. It is not only not worthy of the courtyard designation, but should not be a Marriott period. Its not even a Motel 6 caliber hotel. Rooms are old and musty. AC did not work, mold in the showers, outside entry, and the smallest bathroom Ive ever seen in a hotel, period. It was smaller than a cruise ship and I had a corner "suite". Dont be fooled by the online pictures. Service was nice, but unable to solve any probelms. My experience was so bad, that i refused to pay and was granted a comp night. It was the first time in over 1000+ lifetime nights that i had asked for a comp. The only positive of this hotel is that its located in Waikiki. That is it! Spend 50.00 more and go somewhere else. I would have added pictures, but i had to recently remove them for space. I also dont want to embarrass Marriott, as in general they are a consistently well run operation.

As a Marriott Gold Member, my prize was getting accommodations across the way in their “Royal Hawaiian tower” it’s like I paid for a Marriott and got a motel 6 in the middle of Compton. The building looks like Marriott acquired an old 1 star hotel and painted it to look like a Marriott. The shower is the tiniest I’ve ever been in and they just painted the rooms to make them look updated how ever you look around and it’s not even a good cosmetic job. Its noisy and smells weird. Probably should have stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn as they treat their gold members better than putting them in a roach motel.

Convenient location with no resort fee and no frills. Room itself was clean, comfortable and large (was in a deluxe king room) but there was little stale odor when you enter the room. Side street view with balcony, 2 chairs and table was nice. The mini fridge did not have a freezer section (which I really need for ice packs). Also, the bathroom, although it was large had a small shower (no tub) and sink area (had no storage area for your toiletries) and I had to hunt around for the hairdryer (which was in the closet). The hotels is in a good location on Kūhiō and it was very easy to get around the city on foot. Also, TheBus stop (towards ala Moana) is right outside the front door. Only one ice machine located on the second floor but was happy to see a water dispenser in the lobby by the registration desk. If you’re looking for cheaper stay option without having to pay an extra resort fee, this is a good option.

We arrived the night of the Pearl Harbor attack anniversary parade. The traffic was crazy and we had a rental car. Didn’t know we had the valet park, enter on the west side of the block at back of hotel. Beware! They charge $45 per night to park! I couldn’t believe it! The pool area out back was nicely sheltered by creative landscaping. The hotel somehow did not have our room reserved and we arrived at 7:30 pm. They gave us the only room left, luckily it was an upgrade to a suite on 15th floor. On the night table was complementary set of earplugs. I thought that was curious and humorous. As it turned out by 5:30 in the morning there was no doubt why they provided them. Between motorcycles going down the road and sirens it was impossible to get a thorough nights sleep.The hotel showed signs of having been renovated from a very old hotel. Don’t get me wrong, it was nice but it revealed by things like hooks on the back of the bathroom door that were from a bygone era. Everything else was acceptable.With the congestion, the traffic, the people, the noise, this better be the Hawaii you’re counting on. I like the slower side of Hawaii on all its islands.

Being a Marriott Bonvoy Gold member, I have stayed in countless Marriott hotels - this is the worst, poorly kept property ever. It’s great location doesn’t make up for all that it’s lacking including:1. Strong mildew stench in my room which could be a health hazard. I could hear sounds of dripping water in my room, not sure where that came from..... could be the cause of mildew2. Outdated and flawed room interiors - the wooden toilet door has cracks/spilts, balcony was filthy and looked rusty, shower was extremely small (I hit my head a few times when I tried to pick up stuff from the floor. I am a 5’3 size 2 female), extremely small sink3. Amenities - no complimentary bottled water provided. And they provide tiny bottles of shampoo and conditioner, plus tiny bar of soap for body (no shower gel)4. Lighting - there was no lighting in the doorway and shower. Other in-room lighting (3 table lamps and 2 reading lights) were white lights, not warm lights which were very odd. Don’t expect dimmers as well.5. Extremely unprofessional housekeeping staff - I was pressured by its housekeeping staff to vacate the room for cleaning at 11am because she had a lot of checkouts today. 5. Poor housekeeping - shower was not cleaned at all, I could see soap suds and leftover conditioner on the floor.6. Tiny outdated pool, which looked like a flashback to the 80s7. No detergent dispenser / vending machine in its laundry room. You are required to bring your own. Although the washer/dryer machines are supposed to accept credit card payment, it doesn’t work.8. Poor sound proofing - I could hear people walking up and down the walkway and people hanging out in the pool even at 10pm.Pls don’t spend your money on this property! There are lots of options in the Waikiki area.

We eagerly anticipated our first ever visit to Hawaii and as a long time loyal Marriot customer I confidently booked us into the Waikiki Courtyard, thinking it would be similar to the dozens of other Courtyards I have experienced around the globe as far away as Moscow and Taiwan.Disappointment number one came when upon arrival we were “upgraded” (their word not mine) to a room without the King bed I had booked. I was told no kings were available but my “upgrade” would give us a larger room. After I agreed (key word here is “after”) I was told the “upgraded” room was in another building off the back of the hotel. We proceeded to walk to the other building to find what was obviously an old hotel building, likely built as another low end hotel before being aquired by the Courtyard and hastily painted over to resemble a Courtyard brand. The out building was 12 stories with a single elevator (more on that later), 1 ice machine, and a dime sized pool. We were treated to a lovely view of an empty lot littered with mounds of trash and garbage. The walls were paper thin and we enjoyed hearing every word of every conversation from every room above us, belowus, and next to us. We heard every shower, every toilet flush, and every footstep rang through our room as if intentional. We were treated to a massive f-bomb laden argument in the room above us, and of course other “night sounds” if you catch my drift. Appropriate for the no-tell motel, not a Marriot Courtyard.The keys did not work after our first night and We had to have them reprogrammed, a 20 minute round trip “commute” to the main building where folks actually seemed to have a more Marriot like experience unlike us second rate people “out back.”On night 2 the elevator went out of service. We trudged up 7 floors to get to our rooms on an injured foot for the next two days. Welcome to Hawaii, we hope you enjoy your stay?The final fiasco was walking out of the on site italian restaurant after being ignored by the waitstaff for 25 minutes when we had a tour departure scheduled. WORST MARRIOT EXPERIENCE IN 40+ YEARS OF MARRIOT LOYALTY. Shame on the management of this hotel. SHAME!!!

The rooms were large if sparsely furnished. The common areas are small and need an update. This feels like a tourist hotel for a quite pass through, not a longer stay. Pool is small. We actually changed our plans to avoid a second stay at this hotel.

I’m a Marriott rewards member so I try to always stay in a Marriott. Picked this one as it was close to the cruise port and this suited our needs for a one night stay. The room we were given was on an upper floor and was an end unit. The room was spacious with a wrap around balcony. However, the view was of the other hotels and street but since we were just using as a place to sleep it wasn’t that big of a deal. The bathroom was probably the smallest bathroom I’ve ever had in any hotel. I guess they were trying to get me used to the small bathroom on the cruise. The hotel was also in walking distance to all the expensive shopping and nice restaurants. I don’t think I would select this hotel if I was staying in Honolulu for any longer.

Nothing wrong with this hotel - it was alright. Originally, placed in a junior suite in the annex building. Rooms were very small, offered view of parking lot. My other half negotiated that we were moved to the main tower as he has elite status. The room was much more spacious, had a balcony, offered an ocean view - the experience was night and day. It does have an alright pool with hot tub - never went in either. The best thing about this hotel is that it is a five to ten minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Please note both rooms were noisy with the outside noise, though they do provide white noise machines.

Stayed 1 night. I was given a room right in front of the elevator, even though my profile is notated away from elevator as preference. I am a Gold member and booked directly. Room had a musty smell that wouldn't go away even when I blasted the AC to get rid of the humidity. OK that's fine, it's Hawaii. Hot water takes at least 5 minutes of running to finally come on. Whatever, I can deal with all of that especially for the relatively cheap rates this property charges.I was lying in bed shirtless at 3 AM on my laptop with the lights off. I felt an itch on my shoulder, went to scratch it, and it was a cockroach! Scared the daylights outta me. I flicked it off out of reaction and it flew somewhere near the corner of the room. Gross. I called the front desk, no answer. I spoke to the manager on duty the next morning. Her response was "This is Hawaii." Cookie cutter apology with a 5,000 point compensation. Is that a joke? That's not compensation. This property is 50k points per night. Manager told me she would "investigate" and email me later. I haven't heard from them since.Lastly, I paid for the room rate with a different credit card from the one I handed over for incidentals at check in. However I was charged twice for the room rate, once on each credit card. Even my final bill shows it as charged twice for one night. I was told that the authorization would fall off, but instead it has posted on both credit cards. I was charged double! I still have to give them a call to deal with this.What a disaster this place was. I was so grossed out, I couldn't sleep that night.

What ever could be wrong is wrong right now when staying at the courtyard Marriott.18 floors with only one working elevator. Lines long and people crowded to get to their roomsHot water was hit or miss. When you call the front desk they ask you to turn the water off and try again in 30 minutes.The cost is too high to have a mediocre hotel and fall under the Marriott name.Room was large. Beds were broken in and super soft. TV is a nice size, refrig in the room and decent size bathroom.No view at all unless you like looking at a parking lot or a busy street with homeless people.

I travel frequently to Oahu for work and while this might not be a deluxe resort the staff here is exemplifies the "Aloha Spirit" In particular Ms. Heidy Vicente. She has gone above and beyond the call of duty to accommodate me in my travels. It is the people who make the difference and this property has amazing staff!

The best General Manager Jim Paulon along with Area Sales Manager Heidy Vicente keep this place beautiful and keeps you feeling like Ohana (Family). We come for our anniversary every year (15 now) and we hope to continue our streak! Great bar too, Sean rocks! All the Housekeepers are friendly and that has to be because of their great leaders! The beach is a short walk and the bus stop is right in front for all your shopping needs. If you have any questions, the front desk is super friendly. There is always towels available for the beach too. When you return, there is cold water available to hydrate. Nice touch. The waterfall by the pool area is relaxing. I will add a photo of it.

Front of house were not very helpful. Carpet in room was horrible and sticky. Shower took an age to warm up. Left our bags in storage. Some taken to another location rest were just left against the wall outside reception.

No Resort fee, fantastic location. After much research this seemed like the best value for money with and I was not disappointed. Standard courtyard Marriott rooms with a ‘hawaiian resort feel’ I only spend one night on an extended layover. Nice hotel. Room was nice, bathroom cleanliness wasn’t 5 stars but it was fine. I had a room on level 2 facing the road, the noise wasn’t bad at all. Pool area looked nice. Staff were friendly and the little bar downstairs looked good.I’d recommend this if you’re looking to spend $200 a night. Anything less seemed a bit on the grim side.

First of all, the hotel is nice. The rooms are good and have comfortable beds and pillows. The location is not on the beach, but is only a couple of blocks away, so it's a super easy walk. It is also only one block away from one of the main roads where we watched a parade pass by when we were there. It's a few blocks from shopping malls and the upscale shops such as Chanel and Louis Vuitton. It's an excellent location for wandering around Waikiki. Now the negatives: the showers are so tiny they seemed to me quite claustrophobic. There was no bathtub in our rooms, only cubicles like you see in campers or some dorm rooms. I never felt comfortable having to shower in them. Also, unlike most Courtyards by Marriott, breakfast was not included, so be prepared to pay around $20 for an omlette and coffee. Overall, I enjoyed the stay, as the location is really good. It was primarily the size of the showers that made me rate this as only average. It would have been higher for me if the showers had included regular bathtubs. Everything else was very good. I would recommend this place as long as you understand that your showers are going to be small stalls.

The hotel service was amazing and Shane Duhon is your guy if you need help with tours and great places to eat around the island. I would recommend this hotel for the service, location, and room rates. Everything is within walking distance to shops or food or you can jump on the pink line trolley for $2.

This hotel was a total disappointment. When I say the rooms are small, I’m totally underestimating it. We were originally assigned a room with a single king sized bed, my husband and I could barely turn around. We asked to upgrade and were quickly accommodated. This room was little better. Still quite small, no elevator access and in desperate need of updating. The bathroom shower head was falling out of the wall. The rooms open to the outside and are very noisy. I would not recommend this hotel.

We had a week in Waikiki and we couldn’t check into our rental property for 24hrs after we arrived from NYC. The hotel is located in the heart of Waikiki. The check in staff was great and everyone all around was very nice and friendly.The concierge was very helpful to help plan activities and how to get around Waikiki. The pool and the bar are very close to the lobby so you don’t have to go far.As a Plat Elite, we are given comp upgrades but not in this case which was fine because we were only here for one night.The room itself was TINY. It felt very cramped for 2 people and the bathroom was even smaller. If I was staying more than one night I would def ask for a different room.Overall, location and staff were great!!
user_name:
vkb1009
New York City, New York

review_body: I am sure you have heard of resort fees when you book the hotel, especially vacationing in Hawaii. This hotel does not have a resort fee, a rare gem. To me, resort fee is one of the biggest scams provided by hotels in my opinion. I try to stay away from it if possible. Even my company pays for it, I still will not stay at any hotels that have a resort fee. It is not about saving money, but it is such a waste of money. Imagine you stay for 5 nights and resort fee costs $35((average). It does add up. So I stayed at this hotel a few times. It is still a walking distance from anywhere. Close to restaurants and shops, especially ABC stores. The room is small but it is okay. They gave me a room on the member floor and the shower room was so small I barely fit in. It was so ridiculous. Lucky I only stayed for 2 nights. Please upgrade the room if possible. I will stay here again when I come back here again in Nov. the hotel has a nice small pool. No free bottle of water for anyone even I am a platinum member. I guess water bottles are precious here. You can buy cheap water bottles at ABC stores for a buck. See, you can buy 35 water bottles with money you saved from not paying for the stupid resort fees.

Stayed one night after cruise, arrived hotel around 9:30 am, check in was quick but room was not available, headed down to Chinatown for dim sum and back at 1:30 pm, the agent, Marisa, who checked us in earlier spotted us and addressed us by our last name and assigned a room to us right the way, she also checked us out the next day, very efficient, good manner and always has a big smile. Other staffs are very friendly as well. The room was ordinary, but the wall was thin and loud noise when flushing the toilet. The internet signal in our room 903 was very strong by the doorway, but was very weak at bed side, it kept connecting and disconnecting, call technical support but no avail. All in all, still a good stay, however, without the excellent staff, it will only worth 2.5 or 3 stars at the most.

I love this hotel. I was fortunate enough to be in Hawaii for six weeks for work. I stayed in this hotel my last week. Everything is walking distance and easy to get anywhere. Hawaii has a great public transportation system, and most everything is 1.5 away. If you stay near I suggest walking across the river, this where the locals mostly eat. The prices will be cheaper and portions larger. If you never had spam, well it is everywhere, even Mc Donald's has a spam burger. Oh and there's chicken katsu. It is also on every menu, it's good stuff you'll like it. There is a great bar right across street, it's small and kinda a dife bar but great staff and cheaper prices than closer to beach.

We stayed at this hotel after a 10 day cruise. We showed up early as the ship arrived early at the cruise port. We were immediately met 2 very friendly and courteous guest service associates,Kayla and Marisa (they were amazing). I had asked if it were possible to get into a room early and they were very accommodating. Our luggage was put away by a porter and within 15 minutes were told they had a room for us. The room was very clean and spacious. There was a safe and small fridge in the room. The room was up to date. The balcony looking over the pool was a great bonus. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and always greeted us with a smile and Aloha. The room was cleaned everyday. One night we were awoken to the sound of gurgling water. It stopped after about 10 minutes. We reported the next morning and a service person was immediately dispatched and did not have a reoccurrence. The hotel is located approximately 1km from famous Waikiki Beach. Very nice walk. Lots of activity, shopping and restaurants.(The Cheese Cake Factory). There is a restaurant and bar onsite. Bus routes are very close by. $5.50 gets you a day pass. Download app Dabus2 to get real time bus arrivals and routes. Great vacation at a great location!!

We stayed at this property a decade ago when it looked more like a Day's Inn than a Marriott, but a recent refresh has improved the look of the rooms quite a bit, although there are still some fundamental problems that they haven't overcome, e.g., two guest elevators for a 17 story hotel makes for some long waits for an elevator and then slow rides as it stops on six or seven floors to pickup or dropoff riders. Internet in the rooms is also very slow with no option for faster service for gold or higher elite members.As one might expect in a city hotel, rooms are small as are the bathrooms. The tiny showers have doors that don't seal around the edges (most likely to avoid mold getting a foothold), but this means quite a lot of mopping up is needed after a shower. We got to laying down a full size bath towel in addition to the shower mat to soak up all the water. Noise from other guests - particularly slamming doors at all hours - is a problem as well. All parking here is valet only and costs $45/day, but service is not commensurate with these charges. One morning we came out for our vehicle and waited for the better part of half an hour as they'd misplaced it amongst the various lots and garages that they squirrel away vehicles at night. Once they found it, there was an additional delay as the valet had to come back had to get the keys to move several other vehicles that were parked in front of it before he could extricate it. However, our real problems came after we left. Even though we'd presented the credit card that we wanted our room billed to upon our arrival, we discovered that they'd only billed that card for about 20% of our bill. The rest of the bill went on the card we keep on file with Marriott to guarantee reservations. No where on there website when one books a room here, nor when we checked, etc. were we told that they had charged a "deposit" for this non-prepaid reservation. We had to call credit card companies, Marriott's Platinum Elite line, and the hotel to get the problem looked into - we even had to fill out and fax a form to the hotel. A form by the way that authorized whoever got it to make third party charges to our card which seemed very strange - we were looking for a refund, not more charges on the wrong card! It took several days to finally get things straightened out at our expense (calls and faxes to Hawaii aren't cheap and our time is valuable). Marriott and the hotel should explicitly explain this hidden deposit charge business to avoid inconveniencing their guests.

Booked 11 nights holiday at the Courtyard by Marriott Waikiki. Older style hotel but the fittings and inside decor have been redone. The outside is still half painted blue and half apricot. The staff were helpful and the cleaning staff were pleasant and very professional. The hotel is close to the Main Street in Waikiki (one street back) and also close to the main Waikiki Trolley depot. We were on the 12th floor which is pretty high up with a partial view of the water. Rooms were big enough for the two of us, the bathroom big enough for only one at a time. Pretty handy and central to everything in Waikiki.

Our XC Team stayed 3 nights and we had a wonderful experience. Brent and Courtney helped us booked 9 rooms four our team. They gave us 4 juniors suites to give spaces for our 15 athletes room and also there’s kitchenette. It helped with night snacks with the microwave and put our drinks in refrigerator. The Front Desk staffs are very helpful from the time we checked in and checked out. They were very patient to accomodate our needs as we requested separate receipts for the rooms. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. The showers were kinda tight but for 2 person in the room was okay. I like that all rooms had sofa beds too.The front lobby was nice, clean and its nice to have the water machine to refill water bottles. There’s a nice quaint bar to get drinks and very comfortable chairs to seat outside close to the pool. THe Valet Parking was very convenient too. The location was the best. We are so closed to everything and the beach. We also ate breakfast at the Spada and it was good reasonable. Lots of choices. We bought the vouchesr directly from the hotel.

My wife and I have stayed at this hotel a few times now and it never fails. The location is perfect, it is walking distance to pretty much everything. The hotel rooms can be a little small but they are comfortable and well maintained. The hotel has recently been painted and they have also made some security upgrades which I like. You now have to have an active key to use the elevator to get up to your floor. The staff is friendly and attentive and always aim to please. I'd also like to give praise to the valet staff, I'm sure they rarely get any recognition on here. They do an excellent job and they are surprisingly efficient. As a small token of our appreciation to their efforts, my wife and I always get the crew a box of malasadas from Leonards. This hotel does have some draw backs as any place does. It tends to be a little noisy, but its in the middle of Waikiki on a busy street...what do you expect? For me its not a complaint as I have seen from other reviews, rather a heads up to anyone reading this and is curious. Another draw back is the parking price, I think $45 a day is insane to be honest...that is a compaint! I suppose since this hotel does not have a resort fee, the parking is sort of a wash. All in all this hotel is a great place to stay and I will continue to stay here because of the staff first and foremost, and of course as the title states...location location location!

This hotel was in a nice central location and not a far walk from the beach. The rooms were clean and spacious. The staff was very polite and attentive. At one point are door would not lock as we were trying to leave. A maintenance staff arrived super quick and was fixed within minutes. The huge negative to this place is the noise. Being downtown it was extremely loud, and due to the placement of rooms, seemed to enhance all the outside sounds. I found myself been awoken earl every morning leading to unpleasantly long days. For this fact alone if within you budget look elsewhere.

We were surprised at how nice this property was during our 3 day visit. The three different rooms we looked at were tastefully renovated with new carpet and amenities. Our room in the tower on Royal Hawaiian Blvd. was quite and peaceful with a little ocean view. Very nice lagoon like pool. Excellent staff and exceptional rates the days we visited. Close to everything in Waikiki with the International Marketplace less than a 5 minute walk. Great for Marriott Rewards members too, as this property does give upgrades unlike some others on Oahu.

I stayed here for 29 nights and booked through a third party. The 'third party' website had the same appearance as Courtyard by Marriott. Since I didn't book directly with Marriott they refused to allow me any loyalty points for my very expensive stay. I understand that they have that rule, however, it does not show this rule on their third party booking conditions.In any case third party bookings are approved by Marriott. Very creative business this Marriott company. Just like their Vacation Package. Let the buyer beware!

The hotel itself was great. The rooms are modernized and upgraded, and they include a patio in most rooms in the main towers. The price is unbeatable for the amenities and cleanliness this hotel affords. There is an amazing pool, a 24/7 gym, a bar, restaurant, concierge, and gift shop all on the property. The hotel staff at the bar and front desk were great. Very hospitable and accommodating. We were recommended a Thai restaurant across the street (separate review) which was an amazing recommendation. The staff was so polite and pleasant despite being clearly busy with all of the guests each time we were near the front desk and in the bar. They really deserve a shout out for exemplary customer service and living up to the Marriott name. A few side notes for additional information:Parking- ~$45 USD PER NIGHT. They only have valet. With the price of a rental car, plus gas, plus tip, plus the parking- that’s an expense I’m glad I skipped. My wife and I chose to Lyft everywhere because we were planning on sticking near Waikiki, only venturing off to the Pearl Harbor Memorial, the Ala Moana Center, and of course the airport. It was well worth it, and I guarantee we spend less than the parking fees alone for 5 nights. Happy hour in the bar- 3-6 and 9-12. The best part about the bar (besides the great service) was the operating hours and happy hour. It was refreshing to see a pool side bar open until midnight in a hotel. It was great. (The pool hours ended at 10pm, however). Hospitality- late check out was not a problem at all, and the front desk will hold your bags for you after checkout if you have a later flight, so that you can enjoy your last day on the island sans carrying a bunch of items. They also offer a hospitality room from ~2-5 pm to shower and get cleaned up if needed before your flight on the day you check out. They were so friendly and accommodating, that I would stay again for just that reason - 5 star customer service. Concierge- we did not book anything through the concierge. We did have a chat and visit, yet the value didn’t seem to be there. ($400 for a luau?)It was not a hard-sale and the gentlemen were very nice, but there are cheaper options if you do some research on local activities and events. However, if you want to utilize them they are always there which is great. Pool- just fantastic. Nothing more needs said. Distance- everyone’s biggest concern. Easy walking distance from all of the Waikiki shops, restaurants, beaches. Seriously, a short 5-10 minute walk which gives you the opportunity to see many options. Overall, if I travel to Waikiki again, the Courtyard Marriott will be my hotel of choice. I highly recommend it.

We stayed her for 3 days. The property is nice with a smaller pool area. Staff were outstanding and quickly resolved a problem with our first room. We had a great dinner in the onsite restaurant siting outside enjoying the Hawaiian summer. The food was delicious.The location is close to many restaurants, stores and transportation to attractions.

I stayed here with my girlfriend for five nights from 28JUL-02AUG2019 and am surprised that this hotel is allowed to be a branded "Courtyard by Marriott." First, I understand that everything in Hawaii is very expensive and there is a need to cut costs. Our room was reasonably priced for what we got, so that's why I'm giving an "average" rating to this property. But this property does not offer standard amenities Marriott loyalists expect from Courtyard properties.The lack of free lobby coffee is absurd. And only providing one coffee pod per day in the room is ludicrous for a business hotel where people need to wake up jet-lagged for work. I was really surprised that there was no breakfast at the hotel and the $20 daily credit provided to us as Marriott Platinum Elites didn't buy much in the hotel pantry or affiliated restaurant located in the same building as the main hotel.The rooms are very small, but I understand this is a densely-populated area so that's understandable. But I still don't think this should be branded as a "Courtyard by Marriott." The internet in our corner room was very spotty. I would be able to stream baseball for about 45 minutes just fine, then it would be 45 minutes of little to no bandwidth for 45 minutes and that constantly went back and forth.The gym was on par or better than the bare minimum you would expect from a Courtyard. The valet parking system was as efficient as it could be in that dense area. The two elevators (and sometimes one) were not really enough to keep up with 18 floors of guests. If you need to be on time to meetings, consider staying on a low floor.The balcony was very enjoyable. The room had a pretty good number of plugs. The air conditioning was extremely powerful. The staff were all exceedingly professional and pleasant, which I know isn't easy in a full hotel during peak season. The location was convenient to Waikiki, the highway, and downtown. Housekeeping staff were diligent and kept the room very clean.It wasn't a bad stay, but this property doesn't deserve to be a Courtyard by Marriott and should be branded something lower. All the staff were professional and polite, but still, I would not stay here again in the future.

I have been traveling regularly for the last 24 years and have had many amazing experiences in Marriott properties, unfortunately this is not one of them. Although I am a Titanium member of the Bonvoy program I was changed from the room I booked to two rooms that are connected. In the thousands of nights that I have spent in hotels I can’t recall having a smaller, more outdated room than the one I am in. The location is decent but this is a really old hotel with tiny rooms so if you just need a place to crash and you are by yourself this courtyard is plausible. If you think that you will be getting a room bigger than a closet I would search elsewhere. For the record I really like Bonvoy, Marriott, Westin but this hotel is a major disappointment

I stayed for 12 nights. I had a high floor room on the NW end of the Kuhio Ave Tower ocean side. The view was actually decent. I hadn’t expected any view. The location is good, not too far to walk to the beach, lots of good food and shopping nearby. There’s a credit card operated laundry.The downside was the cleanliness. The carpet was so dirty it left my feet blackened, the maid didn’t always remember to take out the trash. Once she didn’t come at all. The sheets felt a little sandy the first night.I got a good price, but not the Marriott experience.

I stay at all the Marriott properties and this one is very well located, close to all the attractions on the west end of Waikiki and the middle shops including the international market. They don’t have a restaurant for breakfast but ihop is right outside the front door!

My patronage of Marriott is so great that I've got Lifetime Platinum Elite- frequently get upgraded to a suite. My reservation here got me a dingy room slightly larger than a closet. But my biggest gripe is that when I had to check out and catch a plane to the Philippines and later Shanghai, where glorious Marriott properties awaited, I couldn't leave. They woiuld not permit me to check oiut- I had to wait 20 minutes- while a housekeeper checked to see if I stole anything from the horrible room! (To tell the truth, 12 years ago I took a leftover soap from a different property). Beware!

Always stay here first few days before checking into a condo. Rooms are neat and clean and staff very friendly. Lovely “meeting bar” downstairs with open doors looking over pool area, a really friendly little bar with great staff, such a good spot to meet up with people. Close to Lewers Street, restaurants and the “Pink line” bus stops out front. Highly recommend.

I stayed at this hotel 2 nights in July 2019. Overall, the location is good, only a few blocks from Waikiki beach and other attractions. The staff was friendly and helpful. During the days I stayed there they were allowing customers to do their laundry for free, which was great. However, the room smelled like mold and the smell was pretty bad at night so I had trouble sleeping. Also, for the 2 nights I stayed in the carpet and shower was not cleaned.

Hard to beat this location. Centrally located. Friendly staff. Clean property and loved the salt water pool. Rooms are small and bathrooms even smaller. Don’t you dare stay street-side at this hotel...loud people and loud cars til way too late. But they moved us with no hassle so that was appreciated. 3 rating because it’s not what you’d expect from the Marriott brand.

The Courtyard is a great place to stay if you're looking for reasonable rates near food and the beach. Waikiki beach is only a 8 minute walk down one street. All the restaurants and bars are on Kuhio street so you don't have to venture far. The hotel offers a nice cozy bar in the lobby that plays any major game on TV. It also has a secluded pool with a jacuzzi tub away from the hustle of the street. They also offer free mini putting on the property for hotel guests which is great to kill time with. The parking is all valet at $45 a night, but other options are always available. The service is great, and welcoming. I will definitely come back!

I stayed six nights at this property. Staff was extremely helpful, property is very clean. Initially was in a 1-bed room that was too small for both me and my spouse- double bed and tiny closet. I was able to leverage my Gold Marriott status to an available double bed studio room for the same rate. No breakfast on site but there is a coffee shop in the lobby and IHOP directly across the street. Great pool, within walking of Waikiki favorites. I’d stay here again.

This is not your typical Marriott Courtyard like you would find in any city on the mainland. This one has small rooms and tiny bathrooms. It is located on a busy street with emergency vehicles and other street noise going all night. Do not accept a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor outside balcony because the street noise is awful. Business Center has six stations, each for 1 hour at a time. Also,mandatory and expensive valet parking. Valets have a annoying habit of changing radio settings, something previously mentioned in reviews. While the staff was friendly, when I checked out I was not greeted, asked about my stay or told "thank you," even though I just spent a lot of money. I've never had this happen in all of the years of stayingin Marriott's. My first negative review of a Marriott property.

This is definitely a last resort hotel, if you can't get into any other Marriott poperties in the area. I normally stay across the street at the Lay Low, but couldn't get in on governement rate. I was there for a few nights, and had to make sure I kept my flip flops on at all times. The carpet hadn't been clean in decades.The shower was so tight, I didn't bother after the first try and just washed up!I've taken numerous cruises, and never had a shower that damn tight.It more of a RV shower than a hotel shower.Luckily, my family showed up after a few days, and could move to a better hotel, where I could take a nice long shower, with room enough to completely wash my arms.

The hotel is close to everything. Bus stop just outside the hotel. You can go to the outlet mall or USS Arizona memorial easy. Within 10 minutes, you got endless of choices for food and shopping. And of course to beach. The hotel is a bit dated but I think it’s priced fairly. It is in the central of everything so city noise is part of the deal. Staff is friendly. The place is clean enough. Shower is small.

Stay basically anywhere but here and you’ll have a better experience. Didn’t get the room type we booked. Waited 30 minutes at check in at 6pm and the woman working the computer didn’t actually communicate what the hold up was. All-in-all pretty crap experience. Low ceilings. Loud people. Staff hate their customers and their jobs.

Rooms are not at Marriott Standards. Old building that should be demolished. Barley fit into the shower stall. Marriott should de-flag this property. It is a disgrace to the Brand. You would think you were staying at an Econ Lodge property that is 50 years old.

I wish I had read reviews here before I stayed. The room was cramped, shower was tiny, but most of all the room was extremely noisy. I was on the third floor. Buses, loud motorcycles and vehicle traffic until midnight and then resuming at 5:30 AM led to no sleep. Staff didn't seem to care either. I am a Marriott Gold member. This hotel is not worthy of the brand name.

This hotel definitely isn’t what I’ve grown to expect from a courtyard Marriott. The lobby smelled lovely but in a sea of hotels I wouldn’t come here again. Our room was absolutely tiny, outdated and very humid. I woke up feeling dirty. Valet parking was an unbelievable cost of 45 a night. The location isn’t bad but not directly in the preferred area of diamond head. After one night we left and repositioned ourselves at the Hyatt where the location was ideal.

I see Marriott, I know I’m good. Waking in I knew we chose the right place. Nice lobby and super friendly folks at the check in counter. Less than 5 mins and I was in my way.  Got to my room and it was tiny but clean. The beds were super comfortable and that’s all we needed was a place to sleep because we were getting up at 430 am and didn’t get to the hotel till around 11pm. About 10 mins in I was out but was woken by the partying next door. They were banging on the walls slamming doors and sounded like they were vomiting on the balcony. It went on for an hour before I finally called downstairs. Security was there within 5 mins and it kind of shut down but 10 mins later they started up again. I just turned my tv up and went to sleep. Large bathroom with a tiny shower.

This may not be the best hotel but you get what you paid for. It's a little bit rundown and needs major upgrade. Room quite small for 2 beds. Bathroom definitely needs improvement. Counter too small to accommodate toiletries, shower very tight. Our room had weird smell upon entering and after reporting it, the housekeeping staff came with an air freshener and said they just shampoo the carpet but it doesn't look like it. Parking is $45 per night but valet is available for your convenience. If you are looking for a place at the center of Waikiki without draining your wallet, this maybe the perfect place. No resort fee and customer service was good.

We stayed for one night at the Courtyard Waikiki beach. The place is good because it was very close to the shopping district on Kalākaua Avenue. It is also about a 10 to 15 minute walk to the beach. The rooms are larger than the ones we stayed in Holiday Inn express and the decor is newer and cleaner. The bathrooms are really small though with the shower room just being enough for a tall guy to stand in. The front desk is friendly and accommodating. There is a pool and Jacuzzi close to the entrance near the lobby.I did not park there. So, I don’t know the parking fee per night. There may be on-site parking. Even though our room is facing the ocean, there is another hotel building that is blocking the view. So, don’t expect to see an ocean view from your balcony.

The Courtyard in Waikiki isn't a luxury or upscale Courtyard but the location is tops and what the property is missing being a little older, the staff more than makes up for with a caring and helpful attitude. They were more than willing to offer an early check in and everyone greeted us as we passed through each time.

My wife and I booked months in advance,two nights at this hotel.Our initial arrival went well.But when we were barely in our room,the next door people started banging around and swearing.Our room had a adjoining door to their room and because of this the noise was more noticeable.I phoned down to the front desk and informed them of the noise and asked for a new room.Instead of giving us a room which was new looking and quiet ,they gave us a room from hell! Second floor, noisy street,and a whole boatload of young party people staying at this hotel! After an hour in our room,we couldn't stand it any longer so we went to the front desk and informed them of our situation.All they did was say that if we find another hotel around the area,there would be no charge for the two nights.We did find a quiet, comfortable and clean hotel which ironically was across the street ! Would I recommend this hotel.... Definitely not!!

This hotel is in a great location to walk to shops, restaurants and the beach. We had a queen bed room which was pretty small. We some plumbing issues, as did a few other people I ran into. The staff was very nice and helpful, but sometimes we had to wait quite awhile to talk with someone. The pool was small but nice, with a waterfall on one side. The beds were comfortable and there was coffee and a small refrigerator in the room.

The staff is great, customer service is great, close walk to the beach. Has a cute bar, teo pools, jacuzzi, gym and Italian restaurantEasy access to Waikiki trolley, City bus and Taxi service. Laundry mat on location.

I’m pretty sure this property was another hotel chain before Marriott bought it. I stayed here because I had a gift card to offset the prices. Now I know why there isn’t a resort fee. They have a tiny pool and fitness room. The bathroom was old and almost dirty feeling. I was afraid to walk around barefoot, so we just slept and left st 6:30am the next am. The parking was $45- and it’s valet only.

After a series of long flights from Eastern Pennsylvania to Honolulu, we arrived at the Courtyard Waikiki Beach. The young woman at the registration desk smiled and told us they had upgraded our standard room for a “Corner Junior Suite.” That sounded pretty good. We went through the check-in process then she told us we’d have to walk across the parking lot in the rain to a building in another area. We schlepped all our luggage and with a little difficulty found our junior suite on the second floor of that building. As we entered, we immediately noticed a musty odor. Not a good beginning! The suite was basically the size of an average room, it just had more walls so there was a sitting area. The bathroom and bedroom were very small. The sitting area modest in size. The furniture, carpet and bedding were stained. Right below our bedroom window was a small pool with lots of activity going on. (Our body clocks said it was 2am. Honolulu was 8pm.) The following morning there appeared to be garbage pickup somewhere in the parking lot around 6am. A little later, on the street side, there was a large truck that continued to back up causing the beeping sound, then finally picked up a dumpster of junk…All the while making an extraordinary amount of loud noises. We went downstairs to the coffee shop for breakfast and when we returned to our “suite” there was some kind of construction going on just outside…drilling, sawing, banging. On the brighter side, the woman who checked us in was very friendly and easy to work with. The bartender at the lobby bar was delightful. The waitress at the coffee shop couldn’t have been nicer.Conclusion: We will never return to the Courtyard Waikiki Beach. We probably will never go to another Courtyard anywhere. Marriott should be ashamed of themselves for including this property as a part of their group.

We brought a college softball team and the hotel staff could not have been more accommodating in every way. Location is great, environment is soothing (which can be a challenge in Waikiki) and Sio & Shane's friendliness at the Guest Services desk seals the deal!

Centrally located with walking distance to the beach. Plenty of restaurants, bars, shoppinh and entertainment in the area. The service staff are professional and courteous. Just recently renovated, very modern furnishings. Rooms and bathrooms are on the small side, however its still very comfortable. No Resort Fee but its $40 parking/day.

Unless you are REALLY on a budget you should stay elsewhere. We are Marriott members and this is NOT up to their standards of a Marriott. All the furniture was stained. Only queen beds no king. Shower stall so small my husband could not turn around in it. No counter space in the bathroom. No hot water in the sink. Three wall outlets did not work. The shades were so thin the sun light came in at first sunlight and at night you felt like everyone could see in. Basically felt like a truck stop. Ick!!!!

From the moment we checked in to the moment we left what a disappointment. The lady a check in was like I have given you a room where there is noise but you will be out all day so its fine, here a piece of paper explaining why we charge you 40bux for a resort fee. The concierge was so unhelpful like we were wasting his time. The room what a dump smelled like mould noisy from people next door, all we heard was talking and toilet flushing. We were stayed for 2 night on our way home after 7 nights in Kona. I know they are renovating but still go to the outrigger or the Hilton or Sheraton what a waste of money. We travel quite a bit and I flip between the Hilton or marriots from now on will be Hilton all the way

Central to walk to golden sand beach and modernized avenues of beautiful places, to eat and/or drink, and shop (outlet stores). There are 2 pools at Courtyard by Marriott Waikiki Beach. Nature decor for swimming and hot tub, OR heavenly salt water pool, that floats you(!)--left alone, perhaps because it appears to be tiny and pointless. Bike rental racks nearby--not for children as bike routes diminish and vanish in places, and tour buses try to negotiate pull-ins that one needs to accept and wait to clear. NO helmet laws, bikes or motorcycles, shocking, but note that drivers here seem to "get-it" as far as safety, aloha-and-mahalo. Walking distance, "not to miss," modern and tasteful, 1) on Lewers St, south of Kalakaua Ave, are entertainment courtyards and outlet shops; 2) International Market Place "IMP", either almost across street from Royal Hawaiian Center Court Stage (for by-chance evening entertainment) AND/OR directly up footpath (bordered by hundreds of privately owned surf boards) to/from Royal Hawaiian Beach, Waikiki; and, at IMP find "The Street Food Hall," for food like food trucks of Vancouver, i.e. better than mall food court-type food, with good prices and relaxed workers. I am set to take a $2 "pink bus" from Courtyard by Marriott street front (hop on hop off shopper's bus) to Ala Moana Mall (said to be mega), and then public transit north to YWCA Kaneohe Bay. A tour coach driver dis'ed Courtyard by Marriott (as compared other Marriott closer to the beach) as "2 star," but that was after he suggested local rapid transit (rail) promised at $3 billion, coming in at $10 billion, would be a waste of money--and I observed out loud, every car and truck at a standstill in oncoming traffic had a single occupant! "Go public transit, go!" and this area will be even more conveniently accessible! "People won't give up their cars," he said. Still happy, sitting, while rail rushes by you? Build it and they will come.

The Service at this hotel was excellent! The staff are very professional, friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit on the small side (especially the bathrooms) so if you have more than 3 people I'd recommend getting a junior suite. The hotel is very clean, beds are comfortable, and my kids loved the pool and the mini golf. Would stay again.

I recently spent 4 nights here with my wife and 2 kids. We booked through a 3rd party site, had some issues on check-in as the room they reserved for 4 of us was a junior suite with only a king bed. Not Courtyard's fault, but annoying. They did "upgrade" us to a 2 queen bed room, but it was a 3rd floor room with no elevator access.The room was ok, the cleaning staff did a great job and even though we were directly on the pool the noise wasn't too bad. The pool area was really nice, and our kids enjoyed the mini golf. The location was central to shopping and dining, but it was also a bit of hike to get to Waikiki beach.They don't have a resort fee, but I thought the $40+ per day parking fees were a bit high even for Waikiki beach. The bar staff was great and mixed a mean drink, which is a point in their favor.All in all, we had a decent time at the Courtyard, we'd consider it again but we'd also look at better located properties for our next stay in Waikiki.

This is one of the few hotels in Waikiki that doesn't add a deceptive resort fee to your rate. You have to admire them for their honesty in that regard. Even more impressive are the staff here at all levels. While Hawaii is famous for the "aloha spirit" and you notice it everywhere you go, the staff here take it up one notch. They're extremely friendly and go out of their way to help guests. This is especially impressive given the facility they have to work with. The Courtyard consists of two substandard buildings constructed in the 1960s and operated for many years as the budget Ohana Waikiki Surf and its even cheaper Waikiki Surf East. The latter is now the Courtyard's Royal Hawaiian Tower and, despite its majestic name, is a 14 story building with one elevator and catwalk access to rooms! The main building has two good elevators and most of the rooms have narrow interior corridor access. The rooms themselves range from dismal tiny chambers smelling of mold and mildew to more spacious options. While there are opaque draperies over the main window, corner rooms have side windows covered by semi-translucent shades that late-sleepers may find problematic. And while the hotel has been renovated many times over the years, the lack of double-glazed windows is most unfortunate given that this hotel is on one of the noisiest corners in Waikiki. The microwave and refrigerator are very handy, but other amenities are limited to soap, shampoo and conditioner. Every day your ration is one single-serve packet of regular coffee and one decaf. Should two guests stay in the room and both prefer regular coffee, you'll have to request that, I suppose. So, all in all, if you're looking for a hotel with a great location, fantastic staff and no resort fee, this Courtyard is the answer. If you're looking for a quiet relaxing experience, stay elsewhere.

I stayed at the Courtyard Waikiki for 3 nights recently. I had a minor concern while there that I asked for assistance. I was blown away by the level of professionalism and accommodation provided by the front desk staff and Manager Larissa Candida. Anna and several of the other fine women working the front desk always were welcoming and caring. They quickly responded to my questions and did so with a smile. Manager Larissa took it to another level with personal attention, a surprise care gift, and personally introduced herself. She quickly dissolved my concerns and has been a true ambassador of service ever since with ongoing communication and stellar care. Thank you, CY Waikiki staff and Larissa for a pleasant and memorable experience. I look forward to my next stay with you. Mahalo

As others have said, check-in was efficient, no upgrade available for elite as a franchise hotel, no welcome drink or snack.Liked the little pineapple candies. The room was small but comfortable. The view from my room on a high floor was nice. Centrally located and about a 10 minute walk to the beach. Problem with door no closing/locking was fixed immediately with no problems.

We had to find a hotel last minute and were lucky to get an amazing deal on this hotel. We could not be happier with the location, so close to everything, yet away from main loud street! I had to do some work while traveling, and their lobby had a great semi private section with large desks that were perfect for some computer work in the morning. Room was comfortable and clean. Our housekeeper Zoraida was amazing, she made our stay special!

Chose this hotel as it was Marriott/SPG hotel, and all others were well over budget.Disappointing but comfortable.No lounge, so no free meals or drinks.Check-in efficient.Upgrade was poor room very smallNo actual restaurant, had to use the restaurant next doorBar was pleasant and friendlyRoom small and shower could hardly move in, very noisy, the hotel provides ear plugs.Suggest looking at the Marriott Or Sheraton unless on a budget, below par for a Platinum member.Check-in - 7/10Room - 4/10Food - 7/10Service - 8/10Atmosphere - 7/10Overall - 6.75/10

This hotel is, unkept, OLD, loud, dirty!! They should loose their ability to keep the Marriott branding. If you have any other choice, take it. If this place has ANYTHING about it that I would give it credit for, is that it's close to good shopping. But the walls are thin and you hear EVERYTHING that your neighbors are doing and the outside noise is horrible too!

We stayed there for 5 nights with the car rental and valet parking package. We had a corner room. The stay met our expectations and the value of the package exceeded expectations. The property is in a superb location. The Team is very customer focused. The bar has great food and service. The fitness room met our needs. We highly recommend this property. Will definitely stay there again.Mahalo!
user_name:
Dreama P
San Antonio, Texas, United States

review_body: I stayed here just one night for business. It is a good location and walkable to a lot of places in Waikiki Beach. The staff were generally friendly, if not always completely competent. My room wasn't ready when I arrived. I went out for an hour and came back. The guy that told me he would call me when my room was ready was no longer at the front desk. Upon asking, my room was ready. Good thing I didn't actually wait for a call. I was recognized for my Marriott Titanium Elite status, but there was really no upgraded rooms. There is apparently no view from any room. The corner suite I booked was already the largest room. The hotel was clearly something else before it was a Courtyard. It has none of the standard Courtyard look and feel. I stayed in the tower across the parking lot from the main building. There is only one elevator for the whole building (12 floors). I noticed a lot of people using the stairs. I wasn't too inconvenienced by the issue, but I could see if being a problem if that tower was fully occupied. The room desperately needed a renovation. Lots of worn and peeling paint, dated furniture and decor. And the shower was a weird dark cave of a nook in the bathroom. The room didn't seem dirty, but it was old enough to make you wonder. The view I had from the 4th floor was a trash strewn lot across the street in one direction, and an apartment building with balconies in the other direction. It was inexpensive, but it should be under these conditions. So if you are just looking for a place to stay and aren't around the hotel much, this is a good fit.

We stayed here for 6 nights. We were assigned to the older building which is more motel style, outdoor entry. The room itself was spacious enough for 2 people but any more than that would be a challenge. The bathroom was tiny. The shower was microscopic, only one average size person could fit and very dark . The vent in the bathroom needs major cleaning. Our housekeeper was wonderful (7th floor) . The room was not insulated at all, very loud at all hours, we didn't need a alarm because trash trucks seemed to come by around 430-5 am every day .The pools were great however, minimal sunlight hours , its mostly shaded and breezy. Valet parking is Mandatory! The cost is 45$ per day, so keep that in mind . There is trolley service in front of hotel for 2$ each way to get you anywhere in city. Overall, if you are looking to stay in the heart of the action, and don't mind outside noise, then this is a good choice. If you want peace and quiet and relaxation I would suggest another off beat location. The employees here are what made my stay here great !

We stayed for 7 nights and loved it. A Special shout out to the front desk staff! They were VERY friendly and courteous! Customer service at its best. Even the front office manger (sorry can’t remember her name - young lady) was very kind and accommodating. Loved the location. Possibly the fitness room could improve - adding few more machines. As Marriott Platinum Elite members, we felt that we were treated right!

Returned to this Marriott property after my convention was postponed from last August due to Hurricane Lane. The main reason for choosing this again was the same: Easy access to the Hawaii Convention Center via TheBus in front of the hotel, and short walking distance to Kalakaua Ave / Waikiki Beach.
