I had selected a Guest Room with a King Bed this time, because I wanted more amenities, namely a larger mini-refrigerator and a microwave oven. Arrived early, and the polite & courteous staff had my luggage stored until official check-in time, requesting a higher floor room facing away from Kuhio Ave, due to noise issues. I was a bit surprised to learn that hotel actually has two towers, one on Kuhio Ave, and the other just a bit Northeast, on Royal Hawaiian Ave., since I was assigned a room in the latter (I had previously stayed in the main hotel tower). A short walk from the valet station, following yellow footprint markers on the driveway, took me to the correct location. I was initially disappointed with my room assignment, since it appeared to be a much older building that had undergone heavy renovation, the view out of the balcony overlooked a empty (Government Property) lot with some junk in it, and some very loud sanding / drilling construction noise coming from the condo complex across the street. Thankfully, the room was very clean, the refrigerator far larger in capacity than the "Cozy Studio" room I previously stayed in, the walk-in shower's water got hot immediately (still very claustrophobically small), and the construction noise stopped at 5 PM (did not continue for the rest of the weekend). Overall, despite the apparent age of the building, it actually was a better room experience than my previous stay.The ice machine was located on the 2nd floor (just outside the elevator), and apart from the one time where there was a bit of a traffic jam with several of cleaning staff (their station is right next to the machine), it was a lot easier to get to than the main tower one. However, for the 1st floor room whose patio area is overlooked by ice machine balcony, there might be a lot of noise and lack of privacy issues because of it.Did not eat at the on-site restaurant nor coffee shop, and the gift shop was about the same as those on Lewers St. Did not use the small pool near the tower elevator as well. Availability of the hotel computers in the lobby business center was very helpful.All in all, if there is another future convention in town that I'll be attending, I'm sure I'll be back, because this property was a good balance between an affordable clean stay, and location

Had a Corner Queen Suite, very quite, bed super comfortable, large screen T.V. 2 air cons, very comfortable suite, staff warm and friendly, spotlessly clean,no kitchen utensils supplied, not a worry, ABC store 5 mins away, looking forward to staying again. This is not a 5 star Marriott,its a lovely comfortable Hotel,5 star service, without the 5 star pricing! arrived at 10am, room not ready, they called us at 1pm, early check in great! Thanks Marriott

Great location in Honolulu. Few minutes from Waikiki Beach. Shopping. Restaurants. Pool. Laundry. Perfectly comfortable. Very nice front desk. No breakfast but no big deal because IHOP is right across the street. Good stay.

An overall very decent hotel in Oahu. Front desk staff very helpful, housekeeping outstanding. And no complaints as each hotel is very similar. I enjoyed the location and proximity to everything. It is on par for the $. If you want a higher end hotel you will pay highly in Waikiki. I would stay here again!

Visited W/C The Marriott chain of hotels Offer a very good standard of accommodation especially in the USACourtyard Marriotts are the “budget end” of the Marriott chain In relation to this hotel for the UK visitor the standard rooms offer accommodation on a par with the newest UK premier inns ,the executive rooms offer a in room kitchenette

My family booked 3 rooms at this hotel - a suite, a guest room and a studio. Throughout our stay, the staff have been exceptionally professional, friendly and accommodating. The hotel location is central in Waikiki. It is very close to Duty-Free, Duke's Lane, Royal Hawaiian, International Market, etc. In addition, we booked our rooms well in advance to avail of reasonably good rates.We were fortunate that the studio we booked was upgraded to a deluxe room. In general, the rooms were small compared to staying at a regular Marriott, JW Marriott or Marriott Residence Inn. It could be that the building is older even though it looked like it was cosmetically refreshed with updated finishes and fixtures. The shower in the bathrooms were all tight - like a sarcophagus. My husband and I stayed in a corner guest room which faced Kuhio on the 15th floor. We had an awesome ocean view and could hear the street sounds. The rest of my family stayed at the next tower facing the pool on the 9th floor. The deluxe room was a good size but with a small shower. Also, the rooms facing the pool area were shielded from the street sounds.Overall, our stay at this Marriott property was good and we loved its location. In the future, my family would prefer larger guest rooms and bathrooms which means I will probably have to book them at a pricier hotel.

TA AWT2019 MWT#4 day003 Waikiki Courtyard On day003 of our 194day Marriott World Trip #4 we were delighted to stay at the Waikiki Courtyard by Marriott. Even before we arrived I had spoken with Kayla on the phone and she was such a delight. That set the stage what was going to be a very wonderful stay!As it turned out Kayla was even better in person than on the phone, as she cheerfully and professionally checked us in. After check in Maverick did a great job of bringing our bags to the room. Our room seemed a little small for our 6 months of luggage and us too. That was corrected the next day by Heidi.Later on we had a chance to meet Heidi the Front Office Manager. She was outstanding in every way. We felt at home, loved and cared for and all the stress of our flight over from the mainland fell off my shoulders. She moved us into room 211 and said it might be a little noisy since it was on a low floor. It was NOT noisy and was had ample room. THANK YOU Heidi! Heidi is a Future GM! Marilyn at the Front Desk was always ready willing and able to help us!The GM Jim was VERY engaging and he really made our stay extra extra special.We look forward to returning soon! There are NO resort fees here and that was a big plus!
user_name:
Byron C
Nassau, New Providence Island

review_body: I recently made a trip to Honolulu for a family emergency. I was in town for just two nights. I selected the Courtyard Waikiki Beach for several reasons: 1) Great location, 2) Competitive Price, 3) Marriott Rewards, and 4) Courtyard quality. I like Courtyard properties for their standard amenities, convenient locations, clean properties, and ease of getting in and out. Unfortunately, this visit to the Courtyard Waikiki Beach fell short of those expectations.I arrived late (11:30P) on a Saturday night from the mainland. I had checked in on my Mobile App and stopped by the Front Desk to pick up my keys. It took the associate a few minutes to find my keys before I was headed to my room (907). When I opened the door, I noticed a strong musty/moldy odor. Given the late hour, I decided to increase the A/C and try to ignore it because I was exhausted. Unfortunately, the odor didn't subside, and it made for a restless night and scratchy eyes.The next morning, I stopped by the Front Desk before I left for the day. I asked them to have Housekeeping address the odor and do whatever they needed to "refresh" the room. I returned that evening at about 9:30P to discover the odor was as strong as ever. I went back down to the Front Desk and asked them to send Housekeeping to my room. When the Housekeeping associate arrived with a bottle of Febreeze, he quickly assessed the situation and told me there was nothing he could do. He told me he would notify the Front Desk, and I should expect a call shortly.I stuck around my room for another hour before I called down to the Front Desk to find out what was going on. Unfortunately, the associate at the Front Desk claimed to have not heard anything from Housekeeping and was unaware of my predicament. At that time, I requested a room transfer. At first, the associate told me nothing was available in my room class, but then she was able to find a comparable room (856)in their Royal Hawaiian Tower at the rear of the property.I quickly accepted the room change, packed up my things, and headed down to the Front Desk. When I arrived at the Front Desk, it once again took a few minutes for the associate to find my new keys. Apparently, it was another communication failure between associates - a common theme for my stay.Luckily, my new room was what I expected from the start from the Courtyard. The room was clean, and much fresher and quieter than my first room. My only surprise with the new room was the size of the bathroom. Anyone larger than 6ft tall may find the shower claustrophobic.I would give the property 2.5 stars, if possible, because I ultimately got a clean room for my last 12 hours in the city. However, I don't think I should have had to go through all the trouble to "manage" the associates. Had I not stayed on top of things, nothing would have happened.Would I stay at the Courtyard Waikiki Beach for my next visit to Honolulu?Unfortunately, I must say it is highly unlikely.PROs: Location, PriceCONs: Noise, Temperamental Elevator, Lack of Attention to Detail

Booked this room for just 1-night since we had an event in town that evening. We booked the Junior Suite with 2 Double Beds. This hotel only is Valet-only and is $45 a night so keep that in mind if you have a car with you. Check-in was fast and the agent was pleasant. Our room was located in the another building separate from the Check-in area, we thought it wasn't even a part of the hotel. We walked over to the building where our room was located and it felt like a motel rather than a Marriott property. The building is very old, elevator makes noises and closes on you if you aren't fast enough. Our room itself wasn't too bad but you could hear noises from outside the room very easily. Water pressure from the sink and shower was weird and I felt like every time I washed my hands I got water all over the sink. Now this hotel was decent but for the price you pay it's ridiculous. I'm surprised not more people complain about it. They really need to make some changes or stop using that second building we were in. Will not be staying here again, there are other properties in Waikiki with the same price point but way better facilities.

We would like to thank the staff especially Heidi the lovely reception manager for looking after us. We arrived early from Australia and thought we’d check if the room was available. Heidi requested our room be cleaned as soon as possible. She recommended we have breakfast at eggs and things and return in a couple of hours. We were able to check in around 9.30am! The hotel is in a great location, close to all the shops, bus stops and eatery. Highly recommend this place!

Working in the hospitality industry I’m very keen to customer service. Upon check-in Heidi was very personable and accommodating. Being that we arrived several hours before check-in and weary from travel, Heidi was able to get us in early so we could take a quick break before we had to attend our family function. Heidi made our stay amazing. Thank you Heidi.

We booked based on pictures we had seen of the suite. Instead, placed in creepy dark suite with holes in bathroom wall. Welcomed by some insects inside, near front door. So upsetting, very little space, almost no natural light in living area, no door between living area and bedroom as promised. Obviously would never have booked this suite. After 2 nights they moved us to a room- much nicer, as originally expected. Overall, I wouldn’t repeat this experience- the trip was short and would have preferred to skip the horror. I’ve never stayed at a Marriott - but tried since my SPG points from the Westin and Sheraton switched over. Probably won’t risk it again.

There are LOTS of hotels in Waikiki, and I’ve stayed in a few. Many of those hotels were older than this one, but I’ve never stayed at such a noisy location in my life. I can literally see daylight on all four edges of my door. I might as well have it open. Although it was fascinating to hear about Brenda’s day as she walked down the hall, I must say I’d prefer the peace and quiet I expected from a Marriott. Although they offered to move us to another room (tomorrow) I think maybe I’ll take my business elsewhere and dispute the non-refundable charges with my credit card company and a lawyer since that would be cheaper than paying to stay here.

I checked in here after cutting short an awful Airbnb experience. My room was huge, beautiful and clean. The coffee provided in room was good. The pool was really nice as well with a good mix of sun and shade. The staff were wonderful, checking me in, checking my baggage upon leaving when my flight was 12 hours after check out time, and they were friendly when I needed to hang out around the resort after check out. They anticipated my needs and were great to accommodate me. My experience was amazing and I would recommend this hotel to my friends/family.

Wasn’t my first choice anyway, if not because my sister insists on low budget. Booked 3 one bedroom suites, was only able to receive one. Check in staff make up his own notes in system says we said want 2beds so he give us a 2 double bed normal room...ridiculous! You can fake other case but not this group...because 2 beds doesn’t make sense for our arrangement, it is not possible we would say that. Fight really hard later to change to the right room, failed. Can’t get what we booked. Give us a king room only—-not the suite we booked. We travel with young kids which is not easy. And this hotel definitely trying hard to add more weight on our shoulders:-)Not mention how noisy the street is. We were all put on lower floor, even the corner 1 bedroom suites... we were treated like they wish we didn’t book their rooms lol.I understand there are quite a bit elite Marriott members staying there...so I guess as gold level member, we deserve this treatment as we are one level lower:-)The pictures on the booking site is so deceptive, high floor, blue sky, nothing block you except city views. We were put in lower floors, all we see is buildings right in front of our nose or a junk yard that hands can reach and of cause noise. No sky at all.Anyway, it was not my first choice if my sister didn’t ask for a low budget room. Will never come back unless I bankrupt one day:-) the hotel is overall is outdated, the building itself looks like a motel 6. I said this is the worst Marriott I have stayed, my husband joked: oh you haven’t stayed at the San Francisco one lol:-)Coming from Honua Kai 2 bedroom ocean view villa to here...is like riding an express from heaven to hell...it was fun to talk about it now we are back home:-)Interesting experience overall:-) Waikiki Area is great. The location and valet parking staff of this hotel is great.

We stayed for two nights as we jumped over from Maui for a couple of days. When you have been in Maui the value here seems pretty darn good. We were in the smaller tower and the room was clean and updated. As others have said the bathroom is very small and the shower super small. I really don't have any complaints. The service, aside from the front desk check in, was fantastic. The valets, housekeepers, and maintenance were all super friendly. Check in was great although I never did receive my emailed receipt. The bed and pillows were comfy, the drapes were dark enough and I thought the noise would bother me but it didn't. Zero view to speak of but the grounds of the hotel is really nice. Everything was within walking distance - restaurants, shops, beach.HOWEVER, if I were to stay in Waikiki again I would pay $50-60/night more for a beachfront resort.

We had a great time on our short visit at the courtyard. At check-in Anna was absolutely fabulous. She took care of everything that we needed and was always very happy and friendly. I think Anna created the best experience that we have ever had checking in at a hotel. Thank you Anna.

Great location. Clean rooms, Great valet staff. Great staff overall. Great location, right in the heart of everything. It did get a little noisy near the pool, but hey folks are enjoying their vacation, no complaints from me.

Perfection from start to finish! The sales team was amazing from the start. The hotel is beautiful. Management is very accommodating. I researched and did site visits to many hotels before choosing a space to host my guest. No hotel in Waikiki came close to the value of courtyard by Marriott. Don’t waste your time looking anywhere else!

The one bedroom suite we had was lovely and tastefully decorated, with a good sized living area with a kitchenette which included cupboards, sink, microwave, coffee maker and bar fridge.The bedroom was able to be closed off completely from the living area. The bathroom was ample with a shower over a low bath and a good sized sink area but it could do with an extra towel rail or two and possibly even a small clothes line to hang wet things like swimming costumes, and a shelf underneath the vanity. The air conditioning was quiet and effective, both in the living area and the bedroom. The bed was very comfortable, not too hard, not too soft. Being in the heart of Waikiki, traffic and people noise is to be expected. Consideration could be given to mitigating this by installing double glazing in the living area and the bedroom. Also, as I like to sleep without light coming into the room, pelmets could be considered for the top of the curtains. This hotel is opposite ihop restaurant which stays open 24 hours a day. This together with the bar next to ihop, means that there is sometimes noise from people in the street very late at night. Again, double glazing would help here. The staff at this hotel are very pleasant and very responsive to requests. We were initially given a suite which was not suitable due to the bedroom not being able to be closed off, and the staff responded in a positive manner by moving us to a more suitable suite as soon as one became available. A good alternative if you do not want to pay big dollars for a good standard of accommodation and you don't mind not being on the beach. It's only minutes to walk to Waikiki Beach. There was a partial water view in the distance from our balcony which was accessible via the living area as well as the bedroom. Four chairs and a table were provided on the balcony. Televisions were provided in both the living room and the bedroom, and free WIFI was provided. Onsite parking is available but we considered it to be a little expensive at $45 a night. You can park on the street after 6.00 pm and before 7.00 am if you are able to find a spot.

I love the Marriott chain but this hotel was disappointing. We were 4 adults (parents and college kids) and they "upgraded" us to a room that had one king bed and one really uncomfortable pullout couch. Way too small accommodation for 4 adults. Our room was also overlooking a parking garage and a 24 hour IHOP so it was quite noisy at night. It's a very busy, highly touristy area but if that's where you want to be, it's in a great location and has a nice pool outside.

We wanted a hotel close to Waikiki, with sun and not overly expensive. This hotel gave us all that. Is middle of the road - you get what you pay for. Because my husband has a MARRIOTT'S card - we were given a room on the top (12th) floor. For 6 nights it did us well. Close to everything in Waikiki and bus stops outside if you want to journey further. Restaurant and cafe pretty basic - but loads of others close by. Daily cleaning was very good and efficient. Easy parking and helpful attendants when friends came to pick us up.

My stay was fine , I did expect this place to be more modern as a marriott hotel ,the room was very little ,the shower is a shoe box, I had great view of pool, I was on 3rd floor and noise became an issue, on weekends at night loud music . I found there laundry mat was always an issue always broken down ,staff always friendly and helpful.Hotel very central to beach and shops.

I am currently staying at the courtyard Marriott Waikiki. And after one night I am not happy with this place at all. Still have a week to go. Check in was fine and friendly. However the room itself isn’t what I expected. I agree with previous reviewers that this property is really outdated. Small bathrooms. Outside corridors at least in the tower we were in. View we got is of an empty lot beside us with garbage. Garbage trucks do make tonnes of noise early morning at 5am. Walls are very thin and noisy area. Valet parking is 45 usd a day and the only option for parking. I feel for the price we paid I’m not getting good value. Disappointed that it’s a Marriott as I am also a Marriott rewards member. This feels like a cheap motel and there are so many other options out there. We only booked this one due to it being a Marriott and having one bedroom suites at a “reasonable” price. The suite we got barely has a working sliding door between the bedroom and living room. No lighting in the living room and no Ac in the living room. My poor child was so warm overnight so we had to leave the door open for her to get some air. Even for the price we paid it’s not worth it. Very disappointed.

This must be the oldest Marriot on the planet and it shows every day of its age. We chose this hotel over the new year because of the configuration of the suites which seemed quite promising but other than that it was very disappointing. The staff were friendly and did a good job but I would never recommend anyone stay here, especially with the beautiful new Laylow right across the street.

I actually had booked 2 stays here. The 1st was for 3 days and was very good. We were then leaving to go to Maui for 1 night and were to return for 3 more days. I asked the desk if we could have the same room since we liked it and she said she could not confirm it because a guest was already going to be booked into it. When we returned we were told that the guest had "extended" his stay so they put us in a different room that was TINY at best. Being a silver Marriott member with > 25 stays this year I expected to get NOT the worst room in the house. On our last night I tried to call for a wake up call and the desk never answered after I was on hold for 10 minutes. I then went to sleep and they called, woke me up and asked if I had called. I relayed all this to corporate who passed it off to the hotel who had no good response. If this is the way they treat their good customers, next time, I will walk 2 blocks down the street and stay in the Holiday Inn

I have to say this hotel does not need renovation, it has to be rebuilt. Very old, everything is falling apart. Some smelly rooms. But staff are very good and they try their best to accommodate customers. The location is good but very noisy. On top of that the price also is not very cheap. Do I ever go back to this hotel, I don’t think so!

Easily the worst hotel we’ve ever stayed at. This is more like a two star motel. The room is awful. It’s so small there’s no room to open our suitcases. The bed is small and super uncomfortable. The pillows are soft and nonexistent. It’s so uncomfortable that I can’t sleep. As a matter of fact it’s past midnight and I am typing this review because I’m angry and cant fall asleep. I don’t know how I can handle one more night before we have to check out. It’s that depressing. The location is bottom tier. It is relatively far from the beach and can’t be much worse. The bathroom is tiny, probably about 6 square feet so if your body is a hair less than perfect you will feel uncomfortable in that bathroom. The shower is also super small and there’s no light. Not sure how these people thought it’s ok. There’s no way I’m coming back to this hotel even if I get to stay for free.

After a terrible stay experience at hotel down the street....we moved out early and I called this hotel. LUCKILY for me, Marissa (rooms controller) picked up and I explained the situation. I'm a Gold HHonors member and Marissa was only too happy to deliver Gold Level customer service! We got a nice, quiet room facing the mountains...and when we checked in,,,, Dave the front desk clerk was also outstanding in his customer relations. Very helpful throughout our stay. My family and I are very appreciative of their assistance.

Our trip to paradise was marred by the removal of items from our room. Unfortunately we did not set the Do Not Disturb sign out and the room was cleaned...in more ways than one. A pair of shoes was taken as well as a set of headphones. A friend in another room had a shirt missing, which was then “found” in the hotel (not guest) laundry. Attempts for an inquiry and resolution fell short of expectations. Promised follow up did not happen and speaking to the manager, Heidy, was met with rudeness and a careless attitude. We also learned that the Do Not Disturb sign means little as a housekeeper knocked and entered the room as our daughter was napping. I could continue with the tiredness of the property, but others have covered that.

This hotel is a few blocks from the beach but it has a nice swimming pool, small waterfall, and nice hot tub. Room was said to be upgraded but it was small and the shower was tiny. Bed was ok. Parking was valet only and $45/night. No resort fees!!! Marketplace inside hotel was extremely overpriced and often lacking items. Italian restaurant on the east side of hotel's ground floor will let you charge to your room with good early dinner specials. Coffee shop was the best option for light fare. Platinum members can get a $10 food credit per day (up to two persons in lieu of bonus points) for use in the restaurant, coffee shop, or marketplace - just be sure to spend it ALL at one place because the hotel will only charge off the first use of the day. Food credits also do not carry over from day to day. Not a bad location! Internet is free if you have enough status with Marriott.

Bathrooms are very small, no curtains in bedrooms, just sun screens. There is a reason there is no resort fee- it isn't a resort! I've seen larger face towels than their towels in the pool.The worst is the noise from delivery trucks and garbage trucks early in the morning (5 am). The beeping when they reverse is the worst.I tried to speak to the manager when I was there and even now they don't respond

Old beat up rooms cheaply furnished and always noisy throughout the day and night. Marriott bought some beat up motel fixed up the public spaces nicely but someone forgot to tell them to do the rooms. The main building facing the street and the noise is 7/24. There is a back building which is not as bad but poorly updated and cheaply done. Especially the bathroom with old thin windows with rust and mold inside the frame. It is amazing what they charge based on their brand but you will not find the standard quality you would expect at a Marriott Courtyard. There are much nicer hotels in the same price range along the strip.The worst rub is that this property charges $45 a night to park there and the Ritz Carlton across the street charges only $35 a night. Hard to get into the property with your car on top of it. We stayed one night and bolted for another property.

Highs:Location is centralProperty was cleanGood ACLows:Compared to other old Marriott properties like Sheraton Princess, this property doesn’t try to go above and beyond with service and soft amenities. Shower was VERY smallOld hotelVery basic decor and furnishingsSmall bathroomNoisy on lower floorsI would compare this to the Princess Sheraton. It’s another old property. But the Sheraton Princess really takes care of SPG members with free dinner, free apps, rooms past 4pm late check out. If I was picking between the two I would say the physical rooms are the same. So the soft “upgrades” push the Princess Sheraton over the top.

Excellent customer service, but very old property. Very warn out. Clean rooms, but be warned that doors aren’t everywhere. No door between sink and room...kind of odd. Everyone is very nice though. Excellent gym.

Hotel is in a great location. Hop on hop off main station across the street and city bus at the end of the block. Room clean good price front desk friendly. Shane at vacation Marriott desk very helpful.

Though it has the Marriott name, it is the worst Courtyard property I have ever experienced. Do not accept a room facing the IHOP restaurant. It is open 24 hours and the noise doesn't stop until 3:30 to 4 am. The windows are not insulated so you hear the yelling and screaming as well as the street noise. Even with earplugs, it is not possible to get to sleep. The bathroom is small, has a motel style sliding door between it and the bedroom, you cannot regulate the temperature in the room; and, because of not having enough staff, the phone is not answered at the Front Desk. Best you spend a little more and stay at a property deserving of your travel dollars.

Stayed here for 1 night in early October 2018. Nothing fancy, basic hotel room, but at least it has a small frig! It's pretty much in the middle of all the action, easy walking distance to most of Waikiki. They have parking but it's valet only, and I believe it was around $40/night.

Front desk guest service hosts Raymond and Marisa were superb at handling my last minute reservation. Especially when I arrived 30 minutes after making the reservation and I was early due to a flight change. They greeted me with a smile and a contagious happy can-do attitude. They were top-notch representatives of the Marriott brand. Had a one bedroom suite on the 16th floor which also had a view of the ocean. The suite included a living room with a pull out couch, semi kitchen area with only a microwave and a separate bedroom. It had a balcony that went the entire length of the bedroom and living room. This room was more than I was expecting and was very surprised with my accommodations. Location is central to the main beach, shopping and restaurants.

Be aware that there are things that may seem like they should be standard but are not... The showers in the rooms are quite small. Ample for 1 regular sized person to cleanse, but definitely on the smaller side. No bath tub either. The beds are not of the higher end. Not lumpy or anything but not a dream mattress that you might find at a more expensive place. One big plus: no resort fees! There is a fee for valet parking, however, most places in Waikiki charge both! The pool a definite plus! Very nice heated temperatures, very clean, only 4’ deep, but quite enjoyable! All in all, who goes to Waikiki to stay in a hotel room? For the $, not bad for the accommodations.

If you are looking for a business hotel, this should be it! I have tried a few others and pick this place for a few weeks a year for my 2 trips to Honolulu. This is my go to for a friendly team and welcome smile while on island. We love the location for it's walk able options to the beach and after work activities. There is not a calm quiet spot in a big hustling town, this place will make up for it with it's amazing team. They do their best to make your stay as easy as possible. If you make a request, they will make it happen. The staff and awesome location is what keeps us coming back! The bar and happy drinks are a bonus! Keep up the hard work everyone! Front Desk, sales team, bell men and housekeeping hustle hard to make your stay easy and productive. We also pick this hotel if we are on vacation for all the same reasons!!

This is a very average hotel. Not what we expected for a Marriott brand. Least expensive rooms are European size. Location is good for restaurants but a good hike from the beach. You may wish, as we did, that we had paid a bit more and gotten a lot better hotel.

We enjoyed our stay here We arrived approx. 8.30am after a long flight from |Australia and requested an earlier check in than 4pm . Also after reading previous reviews asked for a room on the poolside and not on lower floors because of the noise. We very much appreciated that we were able to check in at 1pm and had a room overlooking the pool on the 9th floor. The room was very clean and comfortable and we found it ideal for a 5 night stay. The staff were very accommodating and nothing seemed to be any bother. We appreciated a full breakfast daily in the adjoining Spada restaurant. The location of the hotel was great - we did lots of walking and found it to be in a very central location . All in all a great experience Thank You

We come to this hotel on our anniversary every year. Everyone one is so nice and accommodating. We love the family atmosphere. We love bringing food to the staff. Heidy V., Front Office Manager and Jim P., General Manager treat us like Ohana! Location is walk-able to many activities. They will even guide you if needed. Our room gets cleaned like we just checked in daily. Sean at the bar is Ohana too! Beach is very close. Internet speed is perfect always. Beds are super comfy. Come stay here and make some new everlasting friendships.

Stayed at the Marriott for 3 nights and really have no complaints. The location is fantastic and you can walk to the beach or catch a bus or cab to other locations. They have a person who will help you book trips or advise you on what to see. The Hotel isn't a 5 star but it is clean and the staff is friendly. A great place to stay if you on a budget and need a place to stay that will not empty your wallet.

We truly enjoyed our 5 night stay at this hotel. We were initially assigned a room in one of the other towers outside of the main building. The room was small but clean. The view from the other tower was not eye appealing to me. Therefore, I asked to be moved to the main tower. The staff were able to honor my request. We were moved to the main building the next day with a view of the pool. Much better. I must add the hotel lobby smelled wonderful daily like a spa i.e., aromatherapy. The staff were friendly and helpful. I want to send a special thank you to Kayla who works at the registration desk. She was always pleasant and eager to assist. The concierge staff were especially helpful when we had questions about driving to the North Shore. They were very knowledgable and gave us great suggestions regarding were to go on the North Shore. This hotel is located in a great location. Its blocks away from the beach, many restaurants and great shopping. If you want a quiet room, I would avoid a room on the main street because it is very busy on that side. This hotel is not beach front so if you are seeking a beach front property this is not the property for you. Otherwise, I would recommend this hotel.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Courtyard by Marriott Waikiki Beach. This was our first visit to Oahu. The location of Courtyard by Marriott was central to all resources/facilities in Waikiki. We certainly recommend the Courtyard by Marriott and would certainly stay again.

We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights Room was only average - we did have a separate bedroom which was good but this hotel is very outdated and noisy ! It is in a good location but I think there are better hotels with more to offer in this cityThe bathroom was very very small ( cruise ship small ) - the wardrobe is in the bathroom and the safe as well ( right beside the toilet) not well planned at all ! Fridge and microwave supplied but no utensils or crockery and no lights only lamps .Also free wifi which worked very well !

We had a stay over two weeks and so had one of the larger suites (separate lounge and bedroom) which was very worthwhile for having a place to relax at night. The bedroom overlooked Royal Hawaiian Ave, view not great as it was an empty lot below but was quiet for most of the day (although expect very early morning garbage truck wake up). The room had a microwave and fridge, however no cutlery or dishes provided. The decor in the rooms and hotel itself is dated and rather drab. The bathroom is tiny, and shower very small. Hotel Wi-Fi was free and worked well. Good sized balcony too. We did however like the location of the hotel, being easily accessible to Waikiki landmarks without the constant bustle. Easy five minute walk to discount shopping such as Ross dress for less and Nordstrom Rack, plenty of ABC stores for grocery supplies and less than ten minutes to the cheesecake factory and international marker place. Ala Moana was a 25 minute walk. There is also a good walking loop out the back of the hotel around the canal or up to the park.

Rooms were a decent size, air con was freezing - great on a hot day. Decent location - could walk around Waikiki easily. Bed way too hard for me, and super noisy at night so didn't get much sleep. Early check in was accommodated which was fantastic, parking is valet only and $42/night. The outside of the hotel was super dated - though so is most of Waikiki. We only had a 1 night stay before our flight out - glad we stayed out of the Waikiki hustle and bustle for most of our trip.

Arrived at the Marriott to be told they wanted £55 holding fee for the room. We booked in snd were told that we had s free upgrade and there was a microwave in it and another double bed. We said yes. Got to the room and there was a microwave but unfortunately no utensils or dishes. The room was lovely and clean but the view was disappointing waste land and side road. So a mixture really. But we agreed that for the amount of time we would spend in the room it was ok.We went down to ask about trips and we were sent to 2 gentlemen near the front desk in Hawaiian shirts. Sorry but they were not very helpful. At all. One man ripped the front off s brochure and gave us the map off the back. Later in the week we found the brochure on the street with lots of vouchers in the back. Very disappointed. Got the feeling they did not like the English very much.The pool was small but lovely And warm with a jacuzzi we met a few lovely couples in there.nuce place to socialise. The only downfall was the washing machines 3 washers snd 3 dryers hundreds of people.Be prepared to wait. While. They do have a laundry service but very expensive.oversll lovely stay clean beds very comfortable and rooms serviced everyday. Would go back but. Room with a different view maybe

I’m not sure what hotel used to be here before, but it surely didn’t start off as a Courtyard. When I hear the word “Courtyard”, I think new, I think modern. Talk about the total opposite. LOCATION:Terrific spot as they’re centrally located but more on the western half of Waikiki where all the action is, including the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, International Market Place and Waikiki Yokocho. Right across the street sits an IHOP and ABC Store too. ATMOSPHERE:Don’t look for a grand entrance as there is none, really. Instead, enter into the parking lot on one-way Royal Hawaiian Avenue with the confusing sign that states “valet only”. Pull up to the temporary desk under the tarp – that’s the valet desk. Yikes. Upon entering the low ceiling lobby, you’ll be greeted by the hotel’s sole bar, pool, Kimobean Coffee shop, business center, front desk and Pure Spa. Spada, an Italian restaurant, is located on the corner of Royal Hawaiian & Kuhio Avenues. ROOM:The hallway leading to the rooms are illuminated with super bright white lights. Entering the room, I could smell that it’s old. Nothing offensive but not refreshing either. Square footage was small compared to today’s standards, though the balcony that overlooked Kuhio Avenue was pretty large with chairs and a table. Because we were on the fifth floor along Kuhio Avenue, there was a little bit of noise from the street & sidewalk but nothing that woke us up. The ductless a/c unit was nice and cold but one of the vanes were missing which resulted in cold air blowing onto our heads in bed, forcing us to sleep upside down. Bedding and pillows were comfortable. Room amenities included a mini fridge, bar-style sink, coffee maker and bedside sound machine that sounded more annoying than soothing. BATHROOM:It was a tight squeeze, especially in the shower. If you’re big, you’ll be bumping into the walls constantly. Water pressure & drainage were good. Shampoo and conditioner were Paul Mitchell-branded. There is a hair dryer that was stored in the room’s closet. PARKING:A whopping $42/night. I try to avoid renting a car due to this reason but we needed a vehicle for luggage storage due to a late flight.POOL:They did a pretty good job with replicating a tropical setting regardless of its parking lot location. It’s a city hotel-sized pool with an attached hot tub. Seating is limited.  BUSINESS CENTER:Around five desktop computers are available for use with an access code. The sole copier/printer was out of service but I was able to forward my document to the hotel’s email address which was printed by the front desk. SERVICE:The agent who checked us out was friendly and efficient. Valet service was quick as the parking lot is right there. OVERALL:Comfortable and great location. The rooms are in need of a renovation.

I can’t believe this property can keep the Marriott name. It is very old and the rooms are minuscule, and that was after an upgrade. Most RVs havebigger showers. The pool is small and heated, which is so unnecessary in Hawaii. It felt like dirty bath water. There is only 4 washers for 18 floors of rooms. It was totally depressing to stay there. Never again.

This is a run down, poorly cleaned property with a rude manager. Noisy rooms. (They provide ear plugs) We initially were assigned to a room with a broken lock on the sliding glass door, cramped and similar to a motel 8. After complaining we were moved to a slightly nicer dump. They must have a wide variety of room types because this is nothing like the pictures others have posted. And I’m platinum elite with Marriott. Had a rude exchange with the manager over a billing issue, so maybe she moved us to the worst room.

We booked this hotel through flight centre as package Deal. Were 2 couples and 2 rooms. I noticed this hotel is a timeshare property and looks like there were given priority to get best room and view. Anyway this hotel is everything the transport is only few steps from the entrance and short walk to all shops and restaurants and to waikiki beach as well.First of all I would like to thanked the housekeeping team for their excellent service and cleanliness of the room. Fresh linen and towels were provided during our stay. Hair dryer was replaced immediately to a new one upon leaving a note that the attachment keep falling off. I was having a problem with the safe in my room housekeeping attended promptly .Reception named EJ was so helpful and very friendly and very accomodating on our request.Spada cafe staff also friendly good customer service.On our checked out day I was calling reception for luggage assistance the phone ringing forever I was so upset and frustrated so when I came down and spoken to lady at the reception she kept apologizing and I noticed that the phoned is off the hook.Although I'm not too impressed with the room I was allocated I will highly recommend this hotel as best location and I will consider this property on my next trip.

This hotel was asked to book a king bed for us, the "deluxe room". Travel agent couldn't work this out they state you will have either a king or a queen but won't confirm this untill you are at the hotel.i have no idea which other hotel in the world does this ???Advice from DM was to call my travel agent. The truth is they have "limited" King rooms one cannot request this through a travel agent only through their website even when paying more for a deluxe room... confusing much?I had to be Brenda that asks to speak to the manager today and it was awful, they stuck us in some dodgy 2nd tower in a queen bed they are just not accomadating.Also they wanted to charge 450 US for a early check in WTF? Check in is for some reason 4pm in Waikiki our flight got in at 6am. Over it I feel because we are staying for an extended time they just don't care! Go elsewhere.

We booked a Queen Suite, with separate lounge, bedroom and kitchen facilities, and free wifi so we could have a little luxury during our week long stay in Honolulu. We arrived yesterday and the location of the room is terrible, being situated next to the elevator and on the 3rd floor overlooking a very busy street with our room being above the busy bus stop! Last night the noise from the traffic and buses stopping and starting was awful. This morning we begged for another room, agreeing to a downgrade in a quieter room, which should be available tomorrow. So we have another night of sleeping at the bus stop to look forward to. And we had to spend an hour on the phone this morning with the wifi technician as the wifi reception in our room is pitiful. Hopeful tomorrow will be a better day!

After waiting 4 to 5 minutes while one of the two attendants worked at the computer while ignoring us, the only customers waiting, we asked whether it would be a while before she could help us. Marilyn told us that she was busy and that she expected customers to wait until they were called to the desk. When she did check us in, she declined to honor our request for a quiet room. While the hotel had plenty of them, she explained, they were being held for large groups and she could not put us in their midst. We observed that this was a strange way to treat long-time, loyal Marriott customers. Marilyn responded, "that's your opinion." She then put us in a room on the 3rd floor, one of a handful of rooms with exposure to both the main street and the hotel driveway. In a subsequent conversation with the manager, he allowed that Marilyn could have chosen her words more carefully, but he had no problem with the substance of what she said. He also offered another explanation for declining our request for a quiet room.

The hotel is very nice and the rooms are clean and up to date.. In the lobby they have computer stations for you with super fast internet. The staff are out to win you over with assistance for what ever they can provide. Consierge desk was extremely helpful for me in finding a "Luau".....The restaurant at the hotel offers specials from 4-7..half off of dinners. I ate the several times and it was terrific

The staff was very friendly and helpful. Convenient location on a bus route and within a couple of blocks of Enterprise car rental. Waikiki Beach is nearby and so is a lot of shopping. Clean and comfortable room.

Spent seven nights at the Marriott. I was able to check early, corner room on level 9 overlooking the pool, very happy with the room. Located a few blocks to the beach, bus stop and trolley stops at the front door you could not ask for a better location. Friendly and helpful staff, constant updates on the hurricane, lovely pool area and great little bar. All in all very happy with the Mariott.

The Studio room was pretty much an efficient size for a solo traveler (would have been a bit snug for 2 people with luggage). Bathroom was rather small, and as many have already commented, the walk-in shower even smaller (it took a long time for the water to heat up... But with humid conditions of August in Honolulu, having cold showers wasn't that bad). Bed was comfortable and clean, but with such thin sheets, the A/C nearby sometimes made sleeping a bit too cool for comfort. Noise-wise, I could hear my neighbors on both sides of my room, and while I wasn't on the Kuhio Avenue side of the building, my side had its share of street sounds for early morning wake-up calls. Did not use the pool, spa, nor the restaurant (see below). Ice machine is located on the 2nd floor (you have to take the South hallway door, and go outside to use the machine). While the Lobby level areas appeared to be quite new, and the hotel rooms quite clean, the place does have a bit of a "in need of refurbishment" feel to it, as many have said.Now, an explanation of why I gave this hotel 5 Stars, instead of 3 or 4:I originally was in Waikiki for a convention, which unfortunately ended up getting cancelled on the day the approaching Hurricane Lane was downgraded into a tropical storm. My main reasons for choosing this hotel (apart from being a Marriott property) was the easy bus access to the Hawaii Convention Center, as well as close proximity to the Waikiki shops, restaurants, and beaches, and the reasonable hotel rates (with auto club discount). Upon arrival, the check-in staff was completely up front about the hotel services that would not be available because of the approaching hurricane, mainly no housekeeping for 2 days and the on-property restaurant closed until further notice, out of concern for the safety of the employees. All pool furniture was stored away, and my room's balcony chairs and table were also moved inside (next to my bed). In the lobby, there was a bulletin board explaining the current status of the approaching storm, and until the day after the hurricane warning was lifted, printed-out storm updates were slipped under my door every morning. Watching from my balcony, I saw one of the staff doing a visual check from the ground level to see if any furniture was still out on the upper floors (which could become dangerous debris in a hurricane). I also noticed that the properties surrounding this hotel had a lot of their balcony furniture still out on the windward sides of the buildings... All in all, I was very impressed with the way the hotel staff put safety first during this storm situation, and kept us visitors informed.

The rooms that our families stayed are spacious, very clean and nicely decorated. This hotel is located near Waikiki main strip and within walking distance to the beach. Also near the shopping plazas. Our families really enjoyed staying there caused it’s the busiest area and very convenient to get to nice restaurants. All the staffs are nice and friendly.

The hotel is very well located near all the restaurants, commercial areas and the beach.Perfect for those who like to be in less crowded places than large resorts.The hotel needs renovation since it is old and can be refreshed a bit.The rooms are comfortable but old as well as the bathroom.The restaurant is small and does not look good so do not encourage me to visit.

I stayed at this location for 3 nights and today I am checking out in a couple of hours. This has to be the worst Courtyard Marriot I've ever stayed at and I've always been happy with this chain of hotels. Noise - The hotel is VERY NOISY!. It seems that there was not effort at all to make this hotel at least soundproof to a certain extent. I am on the fourth floor and I can hear each and every car, truck, bus that goes through and the traffic runs all night!. I saw ear plugs in the room and that should have been a sign but I gave them the benefit of the doubt and used them. Even with the ear plugs, you still can hear a lot of traffic noise. I had requested well in advance for higher floors but when I got here my room supposedly on the 10th floor was not going to be ready until after 6:00pm. Online when I checked in through the app, it said room will be ready at 4:00pm. It wasn't. So for those of us who cross 5 time zones to be here, you can be sleep deprived at night because of the noise level.Comfort - The hotel beds are average in comfort but the rooms and bathrooms are small and the showers are extra small. Service - I had to get the housekeeping folks to bring supplies like lotion etc. on 2 occasions. The front desk does not have a concierge and so any question you have or info I need, I had to join the line and wait with checkin customers. Also on several occasions, the staff didn't seem to know the answers, so I had to figure out myself and for a location such as this one, they should be a well staffed concierge that is familiar with the area to help tourists.Facilities - The pool is small and is next to the street and has again plenty of street noise I left other hotels for a slightly higher rate of about $50, I could have gotten a far much better hotel on Waikiki beachfront.This Marriot disappoints

Spent 5 nights at the hotel. Great location to shopping. Great location for the trolley buses. Nice pool. Great little bar. Enjoyed talking with Sean at the bar who provide great service.Our thanks to the big fella at the tour desk. Directed us to some great locations, restaurants and shops. Advised us about the trolley buses. They are a great service. We did all but the purple ride due to lack of time. Nice food pizza and pasta at the restaurant attached special thanks to Scott. Service was excellent.Reception staff were helpful and friendly. Rooms were well maintained and clean.

The Courtyard by Marriott in Waikiki is probably rated "very good" due more to location (excellent) and the kindness of their employees vs. the amenities of the room or the room itself. This is an older hotel and is showing its' age. They also tend to have above average fees for parking ($42 per day).

A nice place to stay if you like having both big city atmosphere and the beach. The night I stayed there the coffee shop did not open until until almost 8 am. I had to walk two blocks to the Starbucks. My room was nice, tiny, but nice. That being said, I do not expect luxury accomadations at a Courtyard. That is not what they are built for.

Our family of 5 visited in June 2018 and found this hotel to be located right in the center of Waikiki, easy to get to shopping malls, beach, eateries... The front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful, the lobby bar was a little cozy bar with great pupu's and spirits. The pool was heated, which made my grandson's experience a wonderful one, he had the greatest time in the pool. The bell service was very accomodating asking if everything was acceptable and if not he would check with the front desk for us.

The Courtyard Deskstaff staff are very helpful. I came in at 6am and they had me checked in by 12pm. Theyre enthusiastic and efficient. Love the Pool and HotTub after a 6 hr flight from LA The Bartender Jolly and informative this last time too

Second time here, second time disappointed...Valet folks are friendly and quick as could be, kudos to you.Check-in was fairly quick and lobby was very appealing to the eye as you walk past the hotel bar and lobby seating that opens up the pool.Sitting outside on the balcony at night with the island breeze was nice and relaxing...especially after a long day at work.Housekeeping was very friendly and detail oriented on the days I requested my room to be cleaned. That's why I left them a fridge of goodies.Now the bad news...every floor in the main hallway needs some kind of ventilation. Almost every time I had to use the elevator, I was sweating from the lack of A/C and the time it took for one of the two elevators to make it to my floor.Need to get the ice machine on the second floor working. Twice I called about it and other folks were complaining about it in the elevator too and it wasn't fixed during my 6 night stay there.The rooms themselves were sub-Marriott brand standard...old, lot of touch-ups repainted, outdated bathrooms, main closet in the bathroom (really?), and somewhat thin walls, beds felt pretty used.At least being on the pool side was MUCH QUIETER than being on the street side.

It's a comfortable place to stay but I expected more from Marriott.It's a typical 3 star budget hotel, giving it more than that would not be justified with other not so widely known hotel chains. Stayed here for 3 nights. Rooms were clean, decent in size but shower was very small and outdated. Location is central but if you are in Hawaii you would want a feeling of staying by the beach. Even though its close to the beach but while in the hotel it does not give you a feeling of a beach hotel at all. It feels you are in centre city and far away from the beach. After staying here for 3 nights, I then stayed at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel for almost same cost and I loved Aston compared to this hotel.

I’ve stayed at this hotel before and would definitely agree that it is not up to the same standard as other Marriott hotels I have stayed at in the past, but neither is the price. After reading all the reviews on this website I decided to book here once again because it offered the best deal at a great rate when compared to other hotels in the area around Kuhio and Lewers. On check in I was upgraded to the block at the rear of the hotel. My room was essentially a small apartment (which I’m positive it was at one time). I thought it was very compact, but certainly big enough for me travelling on my own. I can see how larger people might complain about the size of the shower and lack of bathroom shelf space, but compared to hotels in Europe and parts of Asia it was generous. My balcony overlooked a side street and a vacant block, but that was fine with me. All the positives... lobby staff are very pleasant. I know because I had to have my room keys reprogrammed four times while I was there. All the staff I met coming and going are delightful and greeted me every time I encountered any of them. There are two pools. One is a heated “therapy” pool that is rarely used and the second is a very pleasant pool but is totally shaded all afternoon. The pool towels are threadbare, but no one is there to monitor how many you use and whether you return them. The upside of staying in the back block is that it is much quieter than the rooms situated on Kuhio that I see lots of others complaining about on here. The wifi worked well for me and did everything I needed without resorting to contacting the tech support people. The valet parking is obviously very expensive, that is easy to work out by the number of staff working there. Why anyone feels the need to hire a car in Waikiki escapes me as the public bus system is more than adequate for transport. Traffic in Honolulu is crazy, so I feel little sympathy for anyone who then complains how expensive the valet parking is at any of these Waikiki hotels. There are no beach views. If you want a beach view I suggest you stay closer to the beach and pay for it. I like this hotel because of its proximity to the bus system which takes you pretty much anywhere most tourists want to go on Oahu and all for $5.50 per day. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel who is not expecting 5 star standard.

I checked in on May 5th and stayed until May 30th, 2018. I could not been more pleased by my room and all the staff. The whole staff made me feel right at home.I am a Marriott Platinum member, so I’ve have spent many night in Marriotts hotel all over the nation. Only negative comment is the street noise late at night, I moved to the upper floor and it got a lot better. Room size was fine, pretty normal for a Courtyard, Anna at the front desk are super attentive and took care of me. The security chief made sure I went to the best places to eat, try the Thailand Restaurant across the street.....

This place is a good place to stay beds are comfortable rooms are clean. The hotel has a swimming pool and hot tub and family friendly and is centrally located within walking distance to the beach all different shopping stores and restaurants.

Stayed here many times in the past few years and I feel the staff is very attentive and very accomodating every single visit. Rooms are clean. Room is small and that may be the problem for those who need more space, yet it still had workspace for laptop, frige and coffee station in the room

The hotel is located at very strategic location with walking distance to the busiest shopping district and beaches. Many restaurants and shops around the hotel and you will definitely will not feel bored. You can always rent a car to tour around the island. Great experience.

Nice lobby and public amenities but the room was unacceptably small. We barely had room for our suitcases. The bathroom was like being on a cruise ship. No counter space and we’d hit our elbows on the walls on the shower when trying to apply shampoo. Cleanliness was up to Marriott standards, but that was about it.
user_name:
chelscorrkenn
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Fantastic location, fancy lobby, nice pool but room was very tired. We stayed in the block across the street, and the bathroom was tiny. The shower could've been cleaner. Ridiculous parking fees, but no resort fees. Avoid the parking fee by doing day car rentals and using the bus. For the same money, I could've stayed at a fancy Airbnb.

The lobby is nice and the pools are nice. The hotel is in a great location for Waikiki. Now, the rooms look nothing like the pictures. The room is much smaller than looks and is a little dated. The bathroom was decent but a little small. The hotel corridors are outside and parking sucks around the hotel. To park at the hotel or will cost you $45 bucks a night.

I have stayed here several times over the last couple of years. The staff is amazing. Everyone is nice and tries to accommodate all of your requests. The bar is nice. It is open late and has a pretty good priced happy hour. The pool is large and heated to a refreshing temperature. It has a large hot tub. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated. But I have to admit some of them have very tiny showers and most of the rooms don’t have a tub.

The hotel was conveniently located to everything...food, shopping and sightseeing. The trolly stop was nearby. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were excellent with a coffee maker and coffee. We didn't have a car...but if you did, parking was expensive.An excellent breakfast was included...scrambled eggs, cinnamon roll and sausage or bacon and coffee. On the week-ends we could also order off a menu.

Convenient location, off of Kuhio. Parking entrance, you'll have to go around and let them valet park your car. Not free parking it was 25.00 USD per night, if you find street parking around on the side and back streets, park it! Rooms aren't the roomiest, two double beds, air con really loud. Was dated in the building we were in. Other building just finished renovations. Pool size ok. Rather be st the beach close by Trump and Modern Hotel. Fee for beach chair rental with umbrella. Must go to Eggs n Things fir their corned beef hash and plantation iced tea. Spa at the Marriott Courtyard not bad! AAA rates online less for members.Safe area , go for a stroll on Kuhio. Infamous ramen/-udon place there.

I wasn't here long, but it was perfect for what I wanted. The rooms are dated, like a lot of things in Honolulu, but it's a 10 minute walk to the beach. You can't beat the price for that kind of proximity. The staff were nice and helpful and it was easy to get around. Likely to be my go to in the future.

The hotel is located within walking distances of many spots you want to encounter in Honolulu and the staff is quite friendly. We would stay there again but be aware this is a downtown hotel with limited views and urban noises as the city wakes up. If you want a hotel in the middle of it all, this is a good choice . . . if you want peace and tranquility . . . this is not your place and do not book in downtown Honolulu. The proper is older and has some signs of age (rust, etc) but it is clean and maintained well.

Read many unpleasant reviews about this place before I booked. So wasn’t sure what to expect. Ok, sure it is not 5 star, but I found it excellent. Many of the bad reviews written by people were laughable when I saw what they were talking about, I think they were expecting the ritz-Carlton or similar lol. Long story short, the place is very clean, the rooms are a good size, the front desk staff are awesome, the pool is ok, the daily service was great, the location was fantastic, WiFi was great, the Italian restaurant downstairs was fantastic. If you are looking for 5 Star ameninities go stay somewhere else that provides that instead of staying here and complaining about it and writing bad reviews. Simple. The only things I didn’t like about it, was the bed configuration, I would of much preferred 1 queen bed and 1 single bed as opposed to 2 small double beds. And the balcony was scary,I was always scared when my kids were on it.

The rooms at this hotel are old and need updates. It can also be noisy if your room faces the street. Valet parking only, and they charge $42 per day, so consider that when booking. But they are pretty efficient and get the cars out fairly quickly when needed.The pool is nice and towels are provided. All staff that I dealt with were great. Very friendly and helpful.

I loved the friendly service and the friendly valet personnel. Easy to check in and out. We rented the Studio with a King but got a Queen. The room was rather small. There was a balcony but there is hardly any view except for other hotels. It's in the middle of Waikiki so you could walk around to visit shopping centers. Only one ice machine located in each tower on the 2nd floor. On site restaurant, not very good. There is an IHOP across the street. I don't think I will stay at this hotel again, I may choose the Marriott Resort and Spa at the end of Waikiki, much quieter.

I have a very high status with the Marriott and this property is horrible! I have traveled all over the world and stayed at different hotels including many stays at the Marriott and Ritz. By far this hotel and its management win the "I don't care about my guests and property" award. The rooms are moldy, the regular room has a bathroom that you can poop, wash your hands and take a shower at the same time. The rooms are filthy, the carpet is disgusting, their staff I will give them a zero for effort and service. I complaint enough so they moved me to a "deluxe room" I don't know why they considered the room deluxe. The ACs at all rooms are located right on top of the head of room and either you are freezing or hot at any time. Do not stay in this hotel. Between rooms you can hear and smell everything the other room is doing. Horrible experience! By the way the manager never offered or contacted me throughout my stay.

We really like the location of the hotel. It was close to shops and restaurants. It was a safe location. Our kids loved the McDonalds which was only about 5 mins walk. The staff were very helpful in giving us directions. Room was always clean. The negative side is that - bathroom towels were not always changed.

I will start off by saying that I was extremely hesitant to stay at this property. I read numerous reviews prior to my stay taking into consideration the concerns about the small restrooms and noise. Prior to my stay Dave Villanueva sent emails showing much aloha spirit. It seemed as though they would be very accommodating. When I checked in I found they had upgraded me. A gift was also provided to me. This was extremely thoughtful. I was pleasantly surprised at the upgrade I received I’ll be at the noise from facing Kuhio Street. The bathroom was just perfect for me. The bed was extremely comfortable. There were some downsides to my stay that I find it important to address. The bathtub and shower curtain have pubic cares that still had not been cleaned when it was time for me to depart on June 18th. Brought this to staff attention on several occasions but the pubic care remained. Prior to check in I was told that I would not have to check out and check back in again. However, I was locked out of my room on the third day of nice day and had to swipe another credit card. This happen again on the fifth night of my stay. I found this rather discouraging. The noise was unbearable from Kuhio Street. I called down to speak with EJay on my first night at approximately 10:00 PM. I was told a white noise machine would be placed in my room. I was also told that a manager would contact me the next day regarding my concerns. By the third night of my stay I still have not received the white noise machine nor had a manager contacted me. I found this disheartening given the friendly emails I have received prior to my stay. By the fourth night I finally spoke with Lorissa will ensure that the white noise machine was placed in my room. I did not appreciate the fact that Dave Villanueva Took time to send me an email stating that my three reservations have been combined in that I would not need to check in and out of my room, only to find out again by Dave himself that he needed to swipe my card for a third time. I requested him to contact me on three separate occasions but he would never leave a message on my room phone nor call my cellular phone. It took several attempts at speaking with staff members for him to finally acknowledge that I was trying to get in contact with him. It seemed that each time I would try and speak with him I would be told that he left early for the day. This happened on at least two occasions. The communication with management need some help. A customer should not have to go to the front desk to speak with staff more than twice in order to get us response for management. I found this extremely irritating in and acceptable.Overall, I found my stay to be quite pleasant. The location is amazing. It is only a few short blocks to the main strip -Kalakaua. You can get there from either Royal Hawaiian or Lewers St. I was also pleasantly surprised to find that in staying on Kuhio street there were quite a few eateries (Marakume Udon being my favorite). Nordstrom rack is also on Kuhio would share a space with Hyatt centric. I did my fair share of damage there. If you take Kuhio to Seaside you’ll find a Ross dress for less. I found a large assortment of items there too. If you enjoy smoothies like I do, you can find a Jamba Juice on the corner of Kuhio and Seaside. I would also recommend taking a stroll to “Japantown” located in the Waikiki shopping center at seaside and color color for a matcha and vanilla soft serve ice cream cone at Nana’s. It’s absolutely amazing!

Was in Hawaii to care for a dying family member. The hotel went out of their way to be accommodating to our group and extended the booking rate I had to our whole group. It was much appreciated. The hotel is clean. The pool side is quieter than the street side. I don’t think any rooms have a water view, but it’s a short walk to the beach.

Stayed here in June for 8 nights in a room with 2 double beds. Booked through booking.com but don’t necessarily think I got a bargain, if I did I certainly would not have paid any more. Room size was ok as was bathroom size but I think we got one of the better size rooms. The place used to be a motel I think as there was a studio kitchen in our room however there was no way of actually using it as there were no cutlery or plates dishes etc. despite there being a microwave. There was tea bags and coffee sachets and a coffee machine but no kettle and no coffee pods for the machine.Beds were rather hard but some people like that and cant please everyone I guess. Staff were fine though didn’t really have much contact with them other than checking in.Pool was nice, coffee was nice at the onsite coffee shop (Hawaiian coffee is gross). The location was good, near down and the beach. Bus stop outside the hotel, the pink line will take you to the nearest shopping centre for $2. Food in Hawaii is expensive in terms of eating out. The 8 days cost us the most amount I’ve ever spent on holiday and that was just in food and drink. If you are on a budget be careful. The whole service charge / tip thing is not my thing either but I understand it’s an American thing. Personally I like a final price to pay and then tip for good service where appropriate rather than it being an expectation. Wouldn’t return to this hotel and probably would return to Hawaii unless I was desperate for a holiday and it was a major bargain.

Beautiful hotel overlooking Waikiki beach! Stayed here for a night before our cruise. Upgraded us to a room with a balcony and fantastic view!! Literally across the street from the beach... any closer and you would be in the ocean! Highly recommend!

Hotel is a couple of blocks back from the beach however it is close to a lot of good shopping and eating places. Hotel service was exceptional from all the team members but there is a couple of things to note. The room was a good size but there is a fair bit of noise transferrance.from the hallway. If you think you are paying for opportunity to walk out the door and onto beach think again but there is a nice pool, self service laundry and a Gym.If you want to park on site, it is valet parking only and $42 per night. looking at the car park I can see why.

We had a great room with 2 Double beds and a Sofa and small kitchenette. It was fine for 4 adults. Slightly older room but amenities were great.The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful.Location was excellent - buses literally outside the front door. Great access to shopping and food. The pool and spa were set in beautiful surroundings. We loved our stay here.We came with another family who at first weren't happy with their room, but the staff upgraded them to a Double deluxe to keep them happy. They also loved it.

Well ok maybe I can't go that far. :) My wife and I stayed here 3 days surrounding our wedding. We knew we would run into some reason to have a fun staff of awesome people around. And the day of check in we found it. I big stain on a dress one day before our wedding! The front desk staff was able to help us out with a local vendor and showed compassion and real empathy for our plight. If you've ever had to get something dry cleaned in a hurry you understand. (let alone a wedding dress) The valet staff was always helpful too, and on the spot with our rental, and the house keeping crew was always very polite and helpful when greeting us in the halls. It made for a great stay and enjoyable time during our wedding week. I want the king size bed we had...seriously it was comfortable. The staff here blew away my expectations. Management should know they are doing a great job.

I’m not sure if guest services agents generally put third party reservations in the least desirable rooms since it wasn’t booked directly through the hotel, but I definitely felt like we were put in that situation with our room. This was my first time booking a package which included air, hotel, and car rental. We booked a 7 night stay and were put in room 250 in the Royal Hawaiian tower.First off, the proximity from our room to the valet stand was convenient. Maybe too convenient. Our balcony, which was far too large than it needed to be (it was larger, if not equal size to our actual room), faced directly out to the parking lot. I was not upset about the view but if a room won for best valet/parking lot view, it would be this one. Secondly, ice machines are located on the 2nd floor making it not only convenient for us but for EVERYONE else. Our room was right next to the ice machine. I’m not talking same level, down the hallway, I’m talking right outside of our room. My husband and I are not the lightest of sleepers and can generally sleep through certain noises but from the sound of cars coming in and out of the lot and the ice machine going off, it was getting to be a bit much. But that’s definitely not all. The second floor just so happens to also be where the housekeeping storage is. Most days we were there, it sounded like the entire staff was up and about congregating next to our room, talking amongst each other loudly. I appreciate their enthusiasm but they should be mindful of their conversations they have and how everything can be heard from inside the rooms. There were also housekeeping carts outside our room almost all of the time. We felt like we had to constantly walk around them just to get to and from our room.I was shocked to not see a single hotel guest on the same floor as us. I did hear a couple one day go into room 251, adjacent to us, but never heard or seen them once after that. Perhaps they had the same issues but were smart to ask for another room. Aside from all noise related issues, the room itself was decent but the bathroom was minuscule. Our bathroom had no counter space. I couldn’t wash my face without the toilet paper getting soaked because water would trickle down my arm and the sink would be too short to catch any of it. The walk-in shower (I was expecting a bathtub) was crammed and had zero access to any light. It was like showering in a dark closet. Overall, if it wasn’t for the location and proximity to some of our favorite shops and restaurants, we would not come back. Parking is unnecessarily high ($42!) but I suppose it’s fair since they provide free WiFi (thank goodness!).Staff was very friendly. The valet staff particularly seemed to consistently go above and beyond.

The hotel was in a great location to access all of the great food and shopping of Waikiki. The staff was courteous and helpful when asked for information. My room seemed a little dated but that didn’t take away from the comfort of it.The pool was perfect. If you wanted to hit the beach it was about 15 minute walk to Waikiki.

Having reserved through Orbitz a bundled package to Honolulu, I'd say do not have great expectations on hotel because of photos shown. We arrived to be placed in a 'bungalow" building next to the Courtyard main tower building. It was unacceptable especially since we had to take our luggage on stairway to the room, had problems opening the door, and then saw a letter on the nightstand that stated the roof would be worked on during our week's stay there. This was in addition to a few unacceptable things in the room: no basin plug and loud air conditioner blowing right on the bed and terrible lighting. Because we had our tourist schedule to keep, after two nights' stay, we complained to the front desk. We were told they'd check to see if there was room availability in the tower building. We checked back and they did have a room on the 5th floor and we moved from the 'bungalow' room for the rest of our stay. The room was much better in the main building. The kicker is that on our last day, another letter appeared on the nightstand, that said their quarterly termite/pest maintenance in the room will happen 'tomorrow' and that the spraying would not affect our health. We had to ask for them to do this process after we checked out and they complied. We may not stay at another Courtyard by Marriott for a long time if again. And everyone knows, there are many other options for hotels.

Nice hotel but rooms are very cramped barely basic. Will not stay here again. I would not recommend it to friends. Bathroom is ridiculously tiny. Lacking the usual space and comfort of most hotel rooms.

We loved our stay at Courtyard by Marriott. The staff are super friendly and the service is great. We also enjoyed the cocktails and food. This hotel is in the best location for shopping, restaurant and the beach. We will defiantly be coming back.

My husband and I spent three nights in Waikiki before moving to the Leeward side of the island. The Courtyard was a good choice as far as location. We were right across the street from the T Galleria where we could catch the Waikiki Trolley to get us around. We weren't that far from the beach or from the main shopping area which was also good. The one big negative we found was that since it was in the middle of everything it wasn't very quiet at night. We could hear traffic and street noise all night which made for a not always restful experience.
