The staff was great, our view was fantastic (got to see the Friday night fireworks from our room), and we got an upgrade to a one bedroom suite. So if location is important to you this is a good spot.

We use the Courtyard every time we are in Honolulu for business, they are very accommodating and I like the location and the great customer service provided. The Valet service was quick and friendly as well.

Our room was ok, a bit run down but the service we got with the staff was excellent. Maid service helped us with some extras for two couples using the room and the reception desk personnel was excellent helping us with directions and places to see and eat at.

I was very pleased with my stay at the Courtyard Marriott Waikiki. My room was in the tower, which I liked better than the main building. The staff were very courteous and helpful. The room was clean and cheerful, I turned off the noisy air conditioner, really didn't need it anyway. I liked the separate shower, although not large, its a lot better than a tub shower. No resort fee and the location is great, just a couple blocks from the beach and main shopping area in the heart of Waikiki. I stayed the second night at a 4 star hotel (starting with an "H"), and wished I had stayed put at the Marriott. Plenty of eating places close by, would definitely recommend.

We were suppose to be in the main building and at check in the front desk girl told us we were going to get an upgrade and pointed at one of the out buildings , I told here that looked to be a downgrade , went to the room and could not believe how small the room was , the restroom was tiny and the shower is the smallest shower I’ve ever seen in a hotel/ motel this building is a motel style set up and the building looks poorly taken care of “ we will stay one night and leave in the morning and find a better place . Before booking make sure you are guaranteed a room in the main building as the out buildings need to be leveled and rebuilt ! On a good note the staff was very helpful and courteous.

Poor service staff were very rude. Had to wait in the lobby for a extra hour while they finished cleaning our rooms would not reccomend this place to anyone. Is not what we expected also had to pay a extra fee per a night that we were not told about.

Top marks for the location. Easy walk to shops, other hotels, restaurants and beach.The room itself was clean but on the small side. The tiny triangle shaped shower was dark (no light fixture inside shower) and EXTREMELY small. I'm 5' and it was a struggle to just turn around in shower. It was a nightmare for my 6'3" husband. Room was in the Tower across from main building but away from the and it was relatively quite. Bed was comfy and housekeeping was more than helpful. Room had a wall mounted AC unit that performed well and quiet but could use a good cleaning to get rid of the dust bunnies accumulated in it.

The hotel was nice and had a lovely pool area for taking a dip or just sitting in the nearby bar having a drink. Hot tub was good and hot as well. The location, while not on the beach was still good. Close to many restaurants, including on site. Buses were also easy to catch and inexpensive to tour. The room was small but had a refrigerator which was nice. If you plan on parking, the valet seems to back up and it is on a side street so you may have to circle before you figure out where to enter.

I checked in to the hotel on April 25, 2018 after booking the stay through the AAA website. AAA's website said the check-in time is 3:00 pm, but when I showed up at the hotel was told that the check-in time changed to 4:00 pm recently. So be aware that you might not be able to check in before 4:00.

Pros-Location, location, location. For us middle class travelers we are not going to spend $500 a night and not have money left for other things. We spend as little time possible in a hotel and rather see the sights around us. We are travelers, not settlers. This was reasonably priced $169 @night with two beds, a microwave, small fridge, wet bar and bathroom. It is located within a 5 minute walk of the famous Waikiki Beach without the crowds of the board walk and Kalakaua Ave, but they are at your toe tips if that’s your vibe. The clientele here were air crews, young folks and a few family. I’d say more adults than families. The best part are the amenities near by. A bus stop that runs all over the island outside your door. Not one but two 24 hour convenience stores across the street that stock anything you need and reasonable prices. $5.99 huge ham and cheese sandwiches, etc. An ihop across the street and McDonalds for the cheap fare. You are a block off of Lewers Street with exciting nightlife, restaurants of every flavor and size purse, and can get away from the crowds quickly if the rain pops up or it’s time to retreat. The people watching along Kalakaua Ave. and all the ritzy stores is always entertaining if you like crowds. Otherwise head to the beach and walk the boardwalk for a sunset drink and dine later. The front desk is exceedingly helpful and Shane the concierge is at the top of his game with spot on advice. From the time you walk in and smell the Ocean Mist aromatherapy you are spirited away to a great experience. The pool and hot tub were adequate and I noticed repairs were done quickly when the hot tub timer failed. Pool was open until 10 PM but we never stayed late enough to close it. The area’s only real Italian Restautant is attached to the hotel and a coffee shop breakfast bakery counter is on premise, but we like McDonalds and their Hawaiian spam dishes.CONS-Location. They bill themselves as the “Times Square” of Waikiki. You are in a concrete canyon that is the main thoroughfare of the beach front but no beach. Kneeling buses with their “beep-beep” and sirens racing by will make their presence known at all hours reverberating between the glass and concrete. The hotel acknowledges this and provides free ear plugs. (I bring my own ear phones and white noise generator to mask it all out.) The balconies give you a ringside seat to all the action. If you like quieter, try going higher (Elite club) or ask for a court yard side unit. Some pool revelry may be heard “I’m going back to room to get a condom” from some frolicking patrons, but after 10 PM things are generally quieter courtside. The tall buildings nearby block the sunrise and sunsets. Diamond Head is partially visible down Kuhio Street. I’m posting this for the record and hope it’s not a regular occurrence, but supposedly a tenant pulled the fire alarm at 3 AM and woke everyone up. Supposedly he was evicted but we’ll see if it is an on going problem if more people post here. The hot tub was small but we were patient and got in. Tub capacity seems to be a recurring problem at all of the resorts we stayed at in Hawaii. Note: Do not rent a car. You will pay $20 a night for parking and between the trolley, the bus, and tours, why stress over rush hour traffic 3-7 every day (really) when you are on vacation. All day adult bus fare is $5.25. Buses were clean and 20 min. apart with tracking apps. Tour Trolley about $26 per adult. Must see the Polynesian Cultural Center (all day with Luau and Breath of Ha theater). Dole plantation tour just because you get to see so much of the island. Must see Dukes surf legend on the beach at Waikiki. Top of Waikiki for nice sunset over view and top of the city viewing splurge. All in all, none of the negatives would keep me from coming back. The $500 we saved being off the beach was well spent elsewhere. Aloha!

This property consists of a couple of buildings a few blocks from the beach on noisy streets, one building pictured in the hotel advertising and another old one in my attached pictures. Luckily I am a frequent traveler and have Gold Star status in the Marriott travel program so they gave me the best room available ... which is mediocre. Rooms are basic and clean, with a poor view and not at all insulated from outside noise. The bathroom is small and functional, with no fan but a little old aluminum frame window for fresh air (yes like from the 1950's).

A wonderful hotel in a great location. On a busy road close to shops, the beach etc. The beach is approximately three blocks away. The hotel has an Italian restaurant attached to it. No room service offered however. Close to IHOP and McDonald’s for late night or early morning coffee’s. The hotel does have a coffee shop with sandwiches espresso coffee tea etc. but it opens at 6 am local time aka 12 PM EST. The rooms are tiny but efficient the room air conditioning is nice and cool the bathroom is tiny but also well laid out and very efficient.

This little place is a gem if you’re looking to use your dollars elsewhere in Waikiki. It’s a couple of blocks from the beach, so a few minutes by foot which is no big deal for most people. Near tons of restaurants, shops, etc. staff is great, nice enough pool and room for the price. One word of caution: the shower is tiny. If you’re on the bigger side, you’ll be very uncomfortable. It’s a shower for shorter and skinny people only! Smallest one I’ve ever seen. All in all though, great choice if saving some money is a top priority. Valet parking on site for about $45 daily fee.

This was a great hotel, the only complaint I would have is the room was a lot smaller then I expected. The Hotel staff were amazing, they helped us out with directions and were always happy and very pleasant. It is centrally located, which I liked. Cleaning staff did a great job! The only reason I would not return would be because of the size of the room. We were there 11 nights and had 2 big suitcases which took up a lot of room.

Nice small cosy hotel. it's not a 5 star one but it gives you nice rooms and the positioning it's really good . Close to the main avenue...next to shops and the wikiki beach. staff was good and polite. I recommend it!

I stayed here for two two weeks during a work trip and will likely do so again when I return in a few months. It isn't a perfect hotel - if your room faces Kuhio, you hear every bus, motorcycle, and ambulance that drives by (and neighbor that leaves their room). That some noise is to be expected in such a high traffic area but the insulation could be better; the showers are very small and due to humidity, my AC unit leaked any time I turned it off.With all that said, I did not spend much time in my room - I was there to work and see as much of the island as I could when not working and the bed was comfortable enough that I was already the next day for whatever was on the schedule.
user_name:
Boise_Jax
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We use the Marriot Courtyard Waikiki as our trip hotel in HNL for our Front Range Anglers fishing expeditions to Christmas Island. This past week with Typhoon Keni, Fiji Air cancelled all the flights in their network including the once a week flts to/from Christmas. I had 15 anglers stranded in Honolulu for what looked to be an unknown number of days. Brent stepped up and saved the day even thought his property was nearly full. All of my anglers were re-booked into the Courtyard, he kept our rates, and a week that was full of uncertainty, had been at least solved on the lodging side while we sorted out flights. Great job by the entire Staff at the Waikiki Beach Courtyard! Thanks!!!

I stayed here overnight before taking a cruise on Norwegians Pride of America. Staff goes out of its way to please , from the bellstaff to the front desk they are fantastic. I stayed in the older section on my outbound , but on my return I stayed in the newer section . This hotel is located near great shopping and restaurants. I would definitely recommend this Marriott.

Booked a corner room, base on the Marriott tier category only. Man is that Wrong. arrived to be led to another building with outdoor doors, yes like a Bates Roadside Motel. Room faced the city and smelled of mildew. Complained and front desk moved to main building. Yea. Next elevator. Who ever sound insulated that need to do the front. Could hear the elevator, but busses, cars, street conversations, no problem. Oh and Mildew smell. We checked out early and moved to The Modern, for the same price. Night to sunny Hawaii.Front Desk staff Amazing.Laundry lossy outdoors in the rain!

The lady on the front desk who checked us in (Jody) was so friendly and helpful, it really started our stay on a positive note. The room is clean and tidy and relatively modern looking. I don't have anything to compare it with, but had expected there would be robes and slippers provided for our use. There isn't. The tea/coffee maker has only one serve of coffee, and one sachet of creamer. For 2 people. No teaspoons or other cutlery. When we booked, I had asked for a softer mattress, but the one we got is very firm. The pillows have the problem they always do in hotels: lying on one is too low, but two are too high. They are happy for people to re-use towels, but don't really provide space to hang them to dry. The bathroom doesn't have an extraction fan, so gets very steamy and damp. The lighting isn't really adequate - there is a desk lamp and two bedside lamps, but no ceiling light. The shower is also quite dim, and only has a tiny shelf, with no hooks for hanging sponges. Toiletries are provided as promised, but only shampoo, conditioner, and bars of face and body soap. I ended up buying shower gel and body lotion. On the plus side, we had asked for a room a bit higher up, with a balcony and overlooking the pool, and we got that. It's not completely soundproof, but it's not too noisy. Overall, it's okay but we had expected more for what we paid.

Its an older property.. I've seen nicer courtyards. Parking is a hassle.. with pretty much only valet available. We stayed for a week using a Marriott certificate, honestly I was expecting more the rooms were pretty small and nothing special.. pretty run down. The housekeeping lady was really nice though.

Our room was well appointed- facing the courtyard with the fountain. There is AC if needed and nicely renovated look to the room. The loudest noise we heard was the water feature at the fountain which was pleasant. My spouse enjoyed the sports bar - and I enjoyed sitting by the pool. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only downside of our stay was the false missile alert that caused everyone a lot of stress. Clearly there was no state instituted emergency plan for "seeking shelter" as advised by the alert. I think this criticism is more directed to the state of Hawaii than the hotel staff - who were as surprised as we were and had no idea what to suggest. The food offered by the hotel was quite good and we ate at the little cafe every morning. We enjoyed the convenience valet parking but it is an extra expense that came as a surprise!

After months of cold in New England, we stayed here unexpectedly for a quick one night stay after arriving one day early in order avoid a snowstorm that was likely to cancel flights for a couple days. Scrambled to find a decent room to crash after our arrival. Located in Waikiki on one of the main drags, it's not oceanfront, but it's a quick, less than ten minute walk for anybody in good to average physical condition. The reviews mentioning how far it is from the beach must be from the disabled, obese, and senior citizens? It was six blocks straight down the street. The building is old. (But to our surprise, most of the more upscale hotels in Waikiki are decades old. In fact, the skyline consists of predominantly very old condos and hotel sky rises. Very few built in the last three decades with modern architecture. It's like looking at a skyline from the 1970's) However, all the public areas and guest rooms were renovated with modern amenities, new carpet, and everything was in good repair. Very clean and no funky musky old old hotel odors.The only problem with room was that the door to the balcony couldn't be opened and was secured shut. After a 16 hour flight and months of cold and darkness, I was really looking forward to sitting on the balcony and having a cocktail.Wifi was fast and free. All employees we dealt with were great! Nightly rate was very reasonable for Hawaii. Only $160. No resort fee, either. Parking is difficult and expensive in Waikiki, with most hotel and garages charging $40-60 per 24 hours. However, it is possible not to fork this out. Take my advice...First thing, rent the smallest compact car you can get! There is free parking along the one plus mile Ala Wai Blvd -2 blocks from the hotel- if you can find a spot (except for Mon & Fri from 8:30am-11:30am) We did six out of seven nights. We always found a space that we couldn't have fit into had we had a mid-sized car. It's best to find a spot before 4-5pm and leave it there. Uber for short rides.You can also park for free on Monsarrat Ave, by the the zoo. You can walk about 15 blocks or Uber back for $5ish. Also, The Banyan Condo tower, a ten minute walk down the street, charges $20 per day and is about the cheapest garage there is. There is also free parking on Ala Moana Ave, by the park and Marina, about a mile away across the bridge from Hilton Hawaii Village. It is almost vacant of cars after 9pm. Uber for $5, or take the bus five minutes back to hotel for $2.50. Don't pay ridiculous Waikiki parking fees! We didn't. We used TripAdvisor and knew where to go before we arrived!Uber from the airport at rush hour was $24. Taxi was $50-60Courtyard locations seems to very. Some are great. Some are so-so. Some have seen better days. This one was pretty good!

The hotel itself is an older property, but rooms have been updated, and the pool area and lobby are very nice. The rooms themselves are Very small and can be loud from street noise.The online checkin gives you the opportunity to ask for special requests. If the hotel is not going to look at those requests and provide the extra towels and amenities then “why bother” even asking if there are special requests??

I enjoyed staying in this room. The staff was excellent and incredibly friendly, always able to resolve any question in a matter of minutes. The room was comfortable and quiet and the hotel is a short walk away from the best parts of Waikiki and any shopping you want to do. The only strange thing about the room setup is that it was very difficult to get into the closet for some reason! But overall I would absolutely stay here again.

Dissatisfied and frustrated customer The Courtyard by Marriott was a disappointment. Considering we paid lots of money for our reservation we did not get that level of service. Our room was 1106. I have many issues with my stay that included the following: horribly uncomfortable bed, very low shower heads, Wi-Fi speed at snail speed, along with when asking front desk employees is there any city events happening they didn’t know anything, and almost slipping in the elevator. I will expand more on these topics and why I was frustrated and dissatisfied. Before I begin talking about the details of each of these problems, I did talk to front desk and did not have my room changed. Let’s start with the bed, I have not ever had such an uncomfortable sleep in my life, my back was hurting a lot. It felt that I was sinking into the bed while having springs poke me. To me having a good night sleep is very important. Second the shower in our room was so low I had to lean forwards to take a shower, already having back pain from bed this made me even more uncomfortable. With the shower being horribly designed these was a lack of shelf space in washroom and only got 2 towels per day. With the Wi-Fi being so slow, front desk connected me to the internet company. As the guest of the hotel I should not be the one contacting the internet service to resolve the problem while on a vacation. Even though I talked to the internet provider my problem did not get solved. Only place where we got internet was by the door of the bathroom or the front door of the room. We spoke to couple employees at front desk and asked about any local events, they seemed clueless. We missed out on an amazing firework show, and luckily saw a parade for police games. When staying at a hotel one would expect hotel crew to have knowledge of the area. The wet elevator floors were a hazard. If I go on a vacation I want to spend time enjoying myself and not getting injured because the hotel staff cannot keep the premises clean. The hotel does have a pool so that could be why the elevator floors were wet but that is not an excuse to forgo safety. The one thing I was happy about was the valet service, these men and women were really nice and helpful.

I was quite leery about the location, being that it is in the middle of Kuhio Ave among the many one-way streets - but that's only a concern if you are driving. And by the way, if you are driving, you will need to pay the $42/day parking valet fee...I was surprised at the overall experience, from check-in to check-out. All staff are professional and very friendly. Location is not bad as it's only a block walk to Waikiki and all the city lights. Many things to eat, drink, shop and do in the immediate vicinty! And once you get the hang of driving around, it gets really easy.I had a room in the tower removed from the main hotel. Although, there was only a single elevator, it moved pretty quickly and during peak traffic it was not a problem. Room was standard with a very nice and large balcony along with outdoor furniture. Quite cozy room and setup. My tower had a laundry facility which took both coins and credit cards. Awesome! There were chairs for you to get comfy while you waited. No real dining options within the hotel, but who needs this when everything you could ever crave is a few steps all around you?i was only bugged by the valet parking fee of $42. Other than that, I had a good 10-day stay here! I would stay again and recommend this property.

Was at the Marriott for two nights. Jody was most accommodating and helpful on our stay. She went beyond the call of duty. She made our stay a pleasant one. Great location and would not hesitate to stay here again. Great location near everything.

This place is nice because of it's central location - 5 minute walk to the main strip, close to bus transfer pick up points, Mcdonalds across the road, affordable and family friendly. They had a freezer down by the pool which had ice blocks for the kids to enjoy.Nothing bad to say as I was happy whilst I was there with my family.

Unfortunately, I would not recommend this hotel to friends or family. I visited for a full 7-Night stay during March to visit Pearl Harbor where my best friend is currently stationed. Details are provided below to help you assess whether this hotel fits your needs, however, I was personally extraordinarily underwhelmed by Marriott hotel, and for a Category 7, quite astounded considering every aspect of this hotel was either below-average or average at best. Now, I realize this hotel is in a "luxury" location of Waikiki, however, it did not make up for the poor overall quality of the hotel.Location = Above Average (The only time I will deem that recognition in this review)Staff = Average, but very friendly and I have no complaints. Elite Benefit (Gold/Platinum) Recognition = Poor. For a 7-Night stay I was provided what I would barely describe as an upgrade (honestly, I might have been happier with my original booking). I booked a Studio King, and ended up with a Double Deluxe (+80SqFt, but two double beds). I checked the app on multiple occasions, and outside of the first 3 days of my stay, Kings, Suites, and further upgrades were available. I don't expect a suite upgrade, however, for a 7-Night stay, it would be nice to have a slightly better upgrade. For reference, I did ask twice during my stay (both in the first 2 days) if any upgrades were available during my time there, and they stated no.Showers = Poor (Cramped, poor water pressure, water temperature only was lukewarm throughout the stay and took 10 minutes to heat up to lukewarm)Pool = Average (Small, but fine. Smaller than average hot tub as well. Approximately 8 person capacity)Fitness Center = Below Average (I believe it had 3 treadmills, 3 elliptical, 1 Cable Machine, and free-weights 5-50lbs)Elevator = Below Average (2 for the entire building, could potentially take up to 5 minutes to get downstairs.)Parking = Average for a hotel in this locationHousekeeping = Average/Above-AverageViews = Average/Below Average depending on where your room is located (Most will be below average)No breakfast or lounge is provided at this hotel.I am never happy to give an underwhelming review as it takes a lot of work to keep a hotel up and running, however, I do believe the hotel could do quite a few improvements to make guest experience more enjoyable. I would highly encourage Marriott to reassess this hotel category or throw in a few small improvements.

Suki the manager made it possible to enjoy our stay. She was very accommodating and very friendly. I had issue with Hotwire , over booking but she took care of me and my kids . Overall a fun trip and the location is great also.

Wow. They said that they were doing a complete make over; this is awesome. All new furniture, desk, dresser, night tables and kitchenette cupboards. New lighting which actually allows you to see. It can be dimmed if you like the dark. New bathroom and kitchenette counters. The hallway lights have been updated and are really great. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it!Wilfred

We spent 2 nights at courtyard Marriott in Waikiki beach Hawaii - it was our first time in Hawaii - waited until after 4 pm to get into our room due to late check out policy . Room was pretty ordinary and noisy even on 11th floor . Surely they have double glazing in Hawaii ? Not going back there !

I had 5 rooms here over the holidays and we greatly enjoyed the hotel. We loved the location. On the map it looks a little farther than it is from all of the action, but it was a very short walk to the beach and shopping. The hotel was clean and the service was very good. One of our rooms was an outside entrance room, which I wasn't very happy with being that I am a lifetime Platinum with Marriott...I was surprised that they gave me what I would consider a poor location. But, it was one of the kids rooms so I didn't complain.

Kudos to Heidy V. and her staff! This was a prearranged anniversary stay for my parents. Heidy reached out in advance and I was able to work with her to see that their special day was recognized and that they were treated like the special people that they are. She also helped me arrange billing from afar. The folks had a wonderful time, capped off with a personal note signed by all the staff and a beautiful night time snack that showed up for them in the room. They said it was clean, well staffed and that they folks there went over the top to help them with directions and etc. Thank you for making their trip start on such a wonderful note!

They aren't kidding when they say it's a bit noisy. What with the traffic noise, sounds of construction across the road it's like you are in New York. All that aside this is a great hotel. Conveniently located for all that's going on in Waikiki. Staff are wonderfully friendly and always willing to help. Room was of a nice size. The pool area was nice and the bar was always lively. Highly recommended.

My husband was on a work trip and away from our family on Valentines day. I didn't want him to feel lonely and took a chance. I took a chance and emailed their sales manager, hoping I could get some help to set up a little surprise-- a little picture of me and the kids slipped under the door. But to my pleasant surprise, they not only printed our picture, but they placed it in a basket of amazing Hawaiian goodies, an adorable heart shaped cookie, drinks, and balloons! I was so impressed by their quick response and their eagerness to help.

I'm booked here for 5 nights on business. I don't need to wait any more nights to write this review. I can put up with substandard accommodations when I am on my own, but if I were here with my wife I wouldn't even set our luggage down. As I write this there are gnats and ants crawling all over my keyboard and screen. The single-pane windows do nothing to keep out the sound of Harleys, garbage trucks (always in reverse) and lunatics screaming at taxicabs and fire hydrants.I've stayed at dozens of Courtyards. They have all been plain but clean. Perfect for business. The problem with this Courtyard is that it is aimed at unsophisticated tourists on a budget.The location is convenient to tourist shopping and restaurants, but nothing good. Finally, I gave two stars because the people are nice, from the Valets ($22/night) to the maids. Otherwise, no stars.

Great location to Main Area, malls, restaurants and international marketplace. Very small shower and small bath. Door to outside balcony didn't shut properly and did not lock when we left. Safe had problems. Great service though - front desk friendly and maintenance staff was very fast... came right away to fix door and lock. Could use some modernizing but convenient location. Stayed first night and transferred to resort and spa east of the courtyard.

Here for a few days and hotel is a great value, center location to walk all over and Ihop and pizza window along with sports bar right across the street. Small clean room but set up nice for being able to fit with two people and luggage-bathroom was too tight and wish there was a tub for soaking tired feet. Nice little balcony and able to keep slider open at night for wonderful breeze. Great service and nice little lobby computers, open sitting areas and large lobby to wander in. Pool and hot tub were nice with bathrooms for hotel guests outdoors and towels too. Was quite cozy where it was all situated. The maids were all super courteous and nice every day too.

We had 3 people in our room with balcony. I like most the swimming pool, not too big not too small, great Hawaiian atmosphere without paying a lot, with hot tub too. Parking service is fast and convenient, I just drop it off and go. The valet is a happy looking crew, eager to please. The hotel is in the heart of Waikiki, very convenient to walk to local stores and the beaches. I like the computers with internet access and free printing! And the price is affordable end. It's one of the few that is affordable, near the beach, and has a mid-size swimming pool and hot tub.
user_name:
Wayne L
San Francisco, United States

review_body: We stayed here on our first trip to Hawaii. Great Waikiki location - convenient to just about everything! Restaurants, beach, shops - yet off of busy Kalakaua (the street with all the high end stores and brands, favored by international tourists). The lobby is open air, and the two pools (one fresh, one salt) are very nice and UNCROWDED, when you want a break from the beach scene. The front side faces Kuhio Avenue, which can be noisy at night - mostly due to sirens occasionally after hours.

Fiancé took me to Hawaii for my birthday weekend. The hotel’s location is not bad. You can walk several blocks to the beach. The lobby is contemporary and they have a small pool. We had a room facing the street and had a long balcony. The room we stayed at is a little dated. The bathroom door which is a barn door doesn’t lock and the bathtub’s drain didn’t work properly. If you just want a basic room that’s clean and near the beach , this is the hotel for you. Btw, there’s an IHOP across the street.

Nice pool, very attentive staff. Noise is a huge issue. Earplugs on the nightstand were a warning sign about what was to happen. Extremely loud street noise that was distracting. If you spend time in your room to sleep, this may not be the best choice. Go to the full service Marriott property a few blocks away and it's money well-spent. If you're Gold or higher, there is a spectacular breakfast buffet. This will help to offset the cost differential. Parking is a tad high at $42/night. I had a one bedroom suite which was a platinum upgrade - thank you. However, it was still a tad cramped and the air conditioners failed to alleviate the dampness in the room. I was provided a 4pm late checkout which was much appreciated, but the Marriott gave me 10pm on a previous trip. I realize this depends on how full the hotel is, but if one is going to Waikiki, spend a little more and stay at the Marriott. You won't miss the traffic and wild reveler street noises that will keep you up.I will not return and this is only my second negative review of a Marriott-branded property in over 1000 nights stayed. My advice, compare the rates then look for some discounted rates for the Marriott such as Senior, government, corporate or advance purchase rates. Aloha!

The courtyard Marriott Waikiki met my expectations, but did not exceed them. I would agree with many other reviewers that this location is not as nice as other comparable Marriott properties, but given the good price we got on the room, and understanding the location and economics of Waikiki I am satisfied. I’d probably go back to the holiday inn express Waikiki again if I had the choice between the two. As for parking, the price is high. We did a drive down Ala Wai boulevard every time and once in awhile we were lucky enough to snag a free parking spot. Just be mindful that cars must be moved Monday’s and Thursday’s from 8:30-11:30am and they enforce this strictly!

It's not on the beach, but it was close enough to easily walk there. Plenty of shopping and choices to eat from. My shower leaked a lot water all over the bathroom because of a gap between the door and the tile. My room faced a vacant lot where there was a lot of trash and homeless people. It was also the path the fire trucks took every night with their sirens blasting.

Very nice hotel close to everything but it’s not on the beach. Staff was wonderful the whole stay and the service was great. The bar is convenient to the pool and not so expensive for Hawaii. Didn’t have any troubles with anything in the room and it was very clean. Enjoyed the stay. Thank you.

Our college basketball team spent 3 nights on the property and was extremely impressed with the service we received from Brent and Courtney in Sales. They were very organized and made sure everything went perfect. Would highly recommend them!

Hawaii still maintains its motto that it is "The Aloha State"; this Marriott, however, does NOT contribute to that motto:1. Sand inside the sheets of one side of the bed upon my late p.m. check-in. Had to ask for clean sheets and change the thing myself; no apology from middle management; no adjustment to the fee for my trouble.---NO ALOHA2. Room was basically shabby; low value for the price and does not compare to the mainland Marriott Courtyard equivalents. NO ALOHA3. Parking is too expensive; Marriott should be a leader in brokering better prices from its contracted parking vendor on behalf of their customers. NO ALOHA4. Given the false ballistic missile alarm, this hotel had no practiced emergency plan in place. Staff, including the GM, security, front desk staff did not know what to tell the guests as far as preparation. The GM was telling some visitors they could head for Diamond Head which, in itself, was inappropriate due to the distance. NO ALOHA5. I mistakenly left a hoodie in my room's closet; one that is clearly labeled with the name of a very prominent Hawaii private school. Given the hotel has my name, address, phone number, and email, it seems obvious I could have been easily contacted by housekeeping. Yes, yes, I realize the fine print reads that commercial establishments like hotels aren't liable for basically anything BUT wouldn't it be great if someone had the integrity to go the extra mile? The GM and his staff should not expect to be recognized for their customer service if it doesn't include going the extra mile, having integrity, and being outright honest. Smiling and being friendly is PART OF THE JOB rather than being noticed as the exception.Having integrity even when it will bring no monetary gain or accolades is what today's consumers are looking for. This Marriott? NO ALOHAThis Marriott is an embarrassment to the corporate name.

Excellent location, only blocks from the beach & great shopping. If you enjoy the hustle and bustle of the city this is a great place to stay. IHOP and ABC store right across the street.We used the pool and hot tub everyday and plan on returning next year.

My husband and I stayed at the Courtyard in Waikiki for part of our honeymoon and had such a wonderful experience.Facilities:The overall facilities were always very clean and smelled amazing. The room was on the small side but for a couple it worked. The shower leaked a little to the floor but as long as you put a towel down it was fine. The pool was amazing as was the hot tub. The whole deck area was nice to sit at while we waited to go to the airport. Front desk:The front desk people were always very friendly and very helpful. We were able to check in early which was great after a 10 hour flight. On our last day they not only held our bags but allowed us to get them to change and go to the beach. When we got back from the beach they also let us have a room to freshen up in before we headed out to the airport. Location: If you’re not looking to pay for staying right on the beach I recommend this hotel. It’s easily within walking distance of the beachfront and it’s in the heart of the downtown Waikiki area. You’re never more than a 5 minute walk from many restaurants, bars, and shops.

Location is great, 5 min walk to the beach, bus stop is right around the corner. Room was somewhat rundown, everything worked, but if you are looking to impress someone, look elsewhere. I live in NYC and traffic noise is something I used to, but if you are living in a quite area, you might have a problem with sleeping, the area is noisy by night.

I used up some Marriott points to spend eight nights here over the holidays. This hotel was very well located for my needs. It’s a couple of blocks from the beach but a very easy walk in a place where very few hotels are actually on the beach anyway. There are dozens if not hundreds of restaurants, bars and shops within easy walking distance. I found my room to be nice and up to date, as some others have noted, the bathrooms are a bit on the small side; I had no issues but could see a larger person finding it inconvenient. Aside from everything nearby, the bus stops right out front and $2.50 will get you anyplace you want to go. I had no problems and spent most of my time roaming Waikiki, so didn’t interact with a lot of the staff but everyone I did meet was very friendly and helpful. Checking in and out were both fast and painless. I hope to return some day and recommend this hotel.

Courtyard Marriott is definitely convenient for travelers who want to walk to the beach from their hotel. Waikiki Beach has lots of local shopping opportunity and luxury shopping as well. We went to the Royal Hawaiian Center to the Fendi store for some sunglasses and we were pleased with the selection.

This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. First it took us 4 hours to get checked in and then the rooms are terrible. I would not recommend this to anyone. It is dingy, the pool is small and it is not that clean.

I stayed here for four nights in early December, as part of a chorus toor. The first disappointment was on check-in, when I was told that, because I had paid the tour organizer for the room, I wouldn't earn any Marriott points for my stay. Really!! I paid for the rooms...Second disappointment was that even on the 14th floor (actually the 13th), there was a LOT of traffic noise. And while there were two of us occupying the room, they left ONE set of earplugs on the nightstand.Third disappointment was the quality of/stinginess of the towels. They were thin and housekeeping had only left two bath towels in the bathroom. And the bathroom had a TINY counter around the sink...with two of us, it was crowded. I can only imagine how bad this was for the chorus members who were four to a room!Fourth disappointment was the daily breakfast buffet, which was included in our tour price...every morning it was potatoes, scrambled eggs, bacon, and sausages. No fresh fruit, no yogurt, no Hawaiian specialties. To be clear, this property does not have the typical Courtyard restaurant; this was a non-Marriott restaurant that shared space. On the plus side, this is a convenient location for walking to the Waikiki shopping district and beaches. The bartenders, restaurant staff, and front-desk staff were all welcoming and friendly. They let us use one of the Penthouse suites for chorus rehearsal on two of the nights of our stay. I discovered after checking out that I had left some items in the nightstand. I called the day of check-out and housekeeping found my items and had them ready when I returned a few days later.As at most all Waikiki hotels, parking is expensive, so I recommended walking, using Lyft or pubic transportation while staying here. There is an Enterprise office about three blocks away, so we walked there to pick up a car on the day we checked out. We were able to leave the car with the valets and bring down our luggage, with no parking charge. We were also able to park there temporarily while I retrieved my left items.So a friendly staff working at a hotel that is not up to Marriott standards...

We were in town for a family wedding on the North Shore, and with long travel on each end decided to stay close to the airport in Waikiki on arrival, and the night before departure. It was easy to get to, and a great location for Waikiki action. The room was small, as I've come to expect in metro locations, but certainly adequate. Our rooms were pool view, with a small balcony, big enough for a couple of chairs and a table for lounging over coffee. The room we had on arrival was configured so that the AC blew right on the bed. The room we had on departure was just the opposite with the AC blowing on the other side of the room beyond the foot of the bed.There was a bit of confusion over breakfast. The room booking included breakfast, which we expected to be typical breakfast buffet fare. Here they provide one of two different coupons, based on the type of booking, that were redeemed at either of two places attached to the hotel. The confusion was over what exactly was covered by the coupon, and what items were charged for. We were not the only guests that were surprised by this. My advice, avoid the whole issue. If the room comes with breakfast don't charge for juice if you've already ordered coffee. The 2 different coupons are a needless confusion.The front desk staff was great, and did their best to sort out any issues. They were knowledgeable, and gave great advice about the area.The pool/hot tub area was quite nice, and a great place to lounge and sun.The valet parking offered guests unlimited in and out access.

The staff are very friendly and the lobby is nice (hence the 2 star rating). The room needs a facelift. The bed was horrid and the bathroom was odd. There was 1 wall in the bathroom that was unused, while the shower area was tiny with a shower head hung on the wall for a 4 foot person. No call ahead to get your car, you have to request your car in person.

I usually start off with any reviews with a 4-star. If the business gives me excellent service...then it goes up to 5-star...if not..it goes the other way. I'm REALLY disappointed at this Courtyard Marriott and the experience I've had during my stay in late Nov/early Dec. It's definitely my worst Marriott experience and I've stayed in many Marriotts all over the world. I'm not against the US$39 per day valet parking charge because I do realize that it's downtown Waikiki. 1st strike against this hotel is the fact that they took our luggage when we arrived, and promised to bring it up to our room. An hour later, we had to go retrieve our own luggage downstairs. The entire luggage cart was still at the Valet Counter!!! On top of that, the valet didn't even provide our claim ticket at that point and made it that much more awkward to retrieve the car when we needed it. (eventually we did get the claim ticket). 2nd strike is when we'd asked for additional pillow and sheets for the pull out sofa right before bedtime. (A 5-star experience would've been that the pillows and sheets already in the room because they knew we had 3 people in the room and my kid would be sleeping out the sofa). So we'd called downstairs to have pillow and sheets delivered. Again, this took an hour and we had to call twice! I'm not asking for a 2 minute turnaround time like a Disney Resort. But my kid needed to go to bed and an hour + additional phone call to remind them is unacceptable! 3rd strike (and this is a first world problem). Internet connection in the room was broken! Fine...Front Desk had asked us to go back to our room and to call them so that they could patch us through to tech support. I did just that and Front Desk didn't even answer my phone calls when I went back upstairs to call right away! It took 20 mins before someone answered my call and patched us through to tech support. Just for kicks and because it was late night, I had time to spend and took a good 45 mins call with Tech Support. (Typical painful tech support call) They had "reset" the router finally and the internet worked for about an hour and cut out again after we'd hung up. So we went back to Front Desk the next day to complain. For all our troubles...all they offered was a "free breakfast". First off...my issue is with the internet...so they could've offered the "free upgrade" to the high speed internet to see if it makes a difference rather than a breakfast! (Pssst...$5 high speed upgrade instead of a $15 breakfast Marriott...it costs you less!!!!) So needless to say...it was very annoying that we couldn't connect and had to go to either the hotel lobby or the McDonald's across the street! (BTW, the McDonald's connection was even faster) I'm not expecting much for a basic internet connection, but a broken connection and a connection that can't even do basic text message = NO connection at all! So obviously with these 3 strikes, this is a 1-star experience. STAY AWAY from this Courtyard! It's poorly ran operationally and while the rooms are clean, they are a bit small compare to other Marriotts. (But I supposed somewhat expected for a downtown Waikiki location)

Spend one night and that was more than enough. Gold status meant nothing except late checkout. Coffee machine in room but only de-caf. Tenth floor but poor sound blocking. Could hear street noise all night, plus neighbors in other rooms. Shower smaller than on a cruise ship or in Japan. Staff indifferent on checkout. Find someplace else; this isn’t the place to stay.

My second time at a courtyard by Marriott did not disappoint. Having already been in Waikiki for a few days, when we moved to the Marriott we really appreciated the location. So close to the hustle and bustle but also separate enough. The rooms are great if you’re not after a kitchen (but I believe you can get rooms with kitchens) and the pool is nice. The staff are also lovely, always saying good morning and happy to help. The Italian restaurant right next door is GREAT and so handy. Can’t recommend enough if you’re in Waikiki for a few days

Stayed for a night to see Jimmy Buffett in Waikiki Shell. This Courtyard is in heart of Waikiki and easy walking distance to the beach, shops and great food. We arrived early and they were able to accommodate us with rooms. As platinum and gold members we hoped to be able to drop off our bags and get to the pre-concert party. Great staff offered us our rooms and we were off to see Jimmy. The lobby area is busy with a pool right outside of the entrance and comfortable seating. The next morning a gorgeous rainbow was visible from our top floor view. Madame Pele must love parrotheads!

Lets face it hawaii can be expensive, especially on a holiday weekend. This property was not over priced and had a nice location. Not far from the beach or local attractions. The room was not large, had a small bath and very small shower but great balcony overseeing the city. There is a nice italian restaurant located outside the hotel, great food served outside as well as inside, a bit pricey however. lovely pool outside of hotel. Sell parking is not available. Parking is available for $39 p/night.

Stayed two nights. Fridge and microwave included in room. Small coffee maker for one free cup. Room was clean and nicely furnished. Attached street side restaurant was fairly priced during food specials hours. Parking was very expensive around $37 nightly. Area is very congested. Beach access is limited due to overly built up area. Major shopping walking distances. Expensive area to eat and sleep.

That's right. To park your own car it's 40 bucks a day. Never in all my travels to 5 continents have I heard of this. At a courtyard no less. They're gonna say it's valet. That only means they expect a tip on top of that. And yes the noise is real. It's right in front of a bus stop so you'll hear the 6 beeps plus a hiss of the hydraulics every 10 minutes. But the ear plugs that they provide it was sufficient. I know this isn't the only hotel to charge outrageous parking fees but people need to be warned.

This hotel was part of a deal before going on a cruise ship heading to Sydney Australia. We arrived at 8 a.m. on a Monday morning. We didn't expect to be allocated a room so early but we were offered a room we could get into straight away. I was asked if I was noise sensitive and I said that I was sure we could cope. We were very pleased to be able to have a refreshing shower after our overnight flight from Sydney, Australia. We did note that the room was a bit noisy but nothing out of the ordinary for a busy place. It wasn't until we got back to our room after dinner that we realised just how noisy the room was. My husband contacted reception and they said they would be able to move us the next day. We were due to go on an excursion around 9 a.m. but decided to check just in case there was a room already available. There was and we were able to move our things immediately. We were assigned a room on the 16th Floor which was the Elite Member Floor. I must say both rooms were quite small but very nicely furnished and the colourings gave a peaceful and calm feeling. The bathroom was well appointed with plenty of nooks and crannies to put our items. Even though we are not swimmers, we thoroughly enjoyed relaxing by the pool chatting and enjoying the peaceful surrounds . The bar was well located and we enjoyed many drinks at happy hour. Unfortunately breakfast was not that great and the staff seemed to be in disarray. We watched one couple walk out after telling the server they had waited one hour for their food. They were not happy. All in all I would certainly return and we thoroughly enjoyed our three night stay.

I stayed at the Courtyard Waikiki Beach for a night during a work trip to Honolulu. The hotel, while dated on the exterior, is your standard Courtyard with room interiors that are utilitarian and to the point. But that's good, as you expect the same at a Courtyard whether you're in Waikiki or Tempe.While the rooms may not be much to write home about, the staff was extremely nice and helpful. They upgraded my room and gave me a late check-in when I had a late flight. Also the wi-fi worked well, making it easy to do work.I would definitely stay at the Courtyard Waikiki Beach again next time I'm in Honolulu for work.
user_name:
erussell84
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Room 1605 is a queen bed over looking kuhio with a small ocean view off in distance. The room is small, the bathroom is small, the door is small, everything is small. There is a half closet, a small refrigerator, Small desk, large tv on wall. No chair or sofa etc...so either sit in desk chair or on bed. The bathroom has a small sink with limited counter space, a small toilet, and a small stall shower. Good water pressure. The hotel gave me two (small) towels, hand towels, and washcloths. Room was prepared feather free in advance of my arrival which is always very appreciated. They also accommodated my early check in...mahalo.The pool is small and did not seem heated. Pool is in between lobby and parking. The Jacuzzi was warm but also seemed a bit small.Offers a spa but I did not check it out. Self serve laundry is in the other tower.Location is noisy even up in 16th floor. They provided earplugs. The room and property was clean and seemed recently renovated. It is a short walk to various Waikiki attractions. I could also hear the doors slamming in hallway, my neighbor coughing and clanging of hangers in their room. So, not completely private.I would stay again, but only for a short visit. Would not be large enough to be comfortable for a longer stay or with multiple people in room.

The room was not what I expected from a Marriott property. The glasses were dirty and I killed a roach crawling across the floor. We were given a "complimentary upgrade" to the building on the back of the property. The view was poor and it has one slow elevator for 12 floors. I would have much rather stayed in the main building but didn't know better when checking in. The staff was friendly and somewhat helpful. It is an easy walk to the beach and the main tourist streets. There are so many quality hotels in the Waikiki area, I would definitely stay at a different one next time.

Visited this hotel for one night before a cruise. Check in was fast and easy. Room was very clean. Bed was comfy. Had shops on lower level between towers, which were a nice departure from normal convenience gift shop. Had a decent bar overlooking the Beach. Food was terrific for a bar. Only criticism was that the room was noisy, even 9 floors up. Street runs between hotel and Beach and there is a great deal of sound amplification created between the hotel towers.Definitely worth a stay!

There was a review in 2016 re. noise. Obviously nothing has been done since. We are currently checked in at this hotel in a corner suite. It's our first night and we have 5 more nights to go. The problem with this hotel is that it was poorly renovated. The windows are not insulated properly that's why you can hear people talking, cars, etc. and it feels like you are sleeping next to the street but we are on the 8th floor. This hotel fails the standard of the Marriott brand.

The Marriott was a great place to stay not only were the staff really helpful but they all went out of their way to make our holiday fantastic. The hotel is situated in a really good area it is situated down the end near diamond head. The rooms were really great we did stay in a premium room partial ocean view but we had a great view of the ocean. The resort itself had a great lot of places to just sit relax or do some shopping. If you choose to stay at the Marriott you won't be sorry.

Room disappointing -very noisy and right next to elevator. TV kept losing signal - every 10 to 45 seconds, extremely annoying. Talked to Assistant manager Larissa who was very rude and not helpful, basically told us to deal with it!Parking (Valet) hard to find - but the valet staff very friendly.Front desk staff friendly. Ironically they were more courteous than their assistant manager!

Very disappointed with the room. With 4 large pieces of luggage and 2 adults there is no room to walk in the room. We literally can not walk between the bed and dresser. The space between the wall and nightstand and bed barely let you pass without bumping into something. We immediately called the front desk to ask if there was anything else available. As a Marriott Gold member we had hoped for better. We were offered a room in the "other tower". Our last stay here left us with a sour taste regarding that tower. Needless to say we will not be coming back to this hotel. There are too many other options here in Waikiki. I should mention that the night manager offered to find us something bigger for the remainder of our stay but we had to pack up our things bring them down stairs in the morning and recheck in after 3pm. I'm not sure what she expects us to do from 8am to 3pm but that is absolutely unacceptable. Who in their right mind is going to pay for a room but not have access to it all day???

Stayed here on a Friday night on a quick stay on Oahu. Good location and very walkable to all the malls, restaurants and beach. Friendly staff and recently renovated. Rooms were a bit smaller than what I'd expect for a Courtyard but not unusual given the age and location of the hotel. Had a nice view from the balcony looking out to the ocean and could see the sunset. Only downside was all the street noise late into the night which was still loud on the 15th floor.

Had a nice stay at this Marriott. Room was a bit small compared to other Courtyard hotels I've stayed at but this is not unusual for a downtown hotel. Everything was clean and comfortable, the employees were all very friendly and the location was good. You could walk to the shopping district and China Town and the beach Waikiki if you wanted. Our room could have used a better seal on the sliding door. The weather stripping was in bad shape and that let in a lot of noise that might otherwise not have been heard. Not a big deal..... I have always found the downtown is much noisier that you think it should be.I would recommend this hotel to friends.

To make it clear this is not a Marriott Resort Hotel, its pretty clear in the description along with the price charged. Don't book and then complain that its not Marriott standard.Great location with plenty of places to eat near and only a 10 minute walk to the beach.We stayed here for 8 nights and found all the staff pleasant and helpful. The room was very clean and up to date. Bathroom on the small side but ok.Only one bed side table and lamp, did complain but nothing done about this, ended up using the chair from the desk.Pool ok for a quick dip but couldn't spend a day by the pool.We spent every day out exploring this hotel made an ideal base.

My daughter and I stayed for 1 week at this hotel, and, apart from the breakfast being a little disappointing, found the room, maid-service and reception to be extremely good.The room overlooked the pool and was cleaned thoroughly each day, with contact from the maid when she thought we had accidently thrown something in the bin which we hadn't meant to - extremely honest.Reception were helpful when we had a problem with our hire vehicle, and the location of the hotel was perfect for us.All in all, a lovely stay for my dream vacation.

The Courtyard looks like it is actually made up of a few buildings. The main desk is in a nice well appointed building. The staff as always with Marriott was pleasant and helpful.Maybe the other places in the hotel are good, but I would avoid the rooms that have 5 for the second to last digit; these rooms are in a building that shows its age overlooks a trashy part of Waikiki and the noise level was uncomfortable at best - I guess we should have been tipped off by the ear plugs the room attendant put on the night stand. Anyway, at 4 and at 5 every morning we were awakened to the sounds of trash trucks and busses going about their business. The pool in the main building looked inviting but the pool at our building was small and uninviting. The pool in yet another building looked large and seemed well used.

This is an old Courtyard and really need renovation. The check in was so so as the girl was on the phone when we arrived, she didn't acknowledge us standing there until after she finished her phone conversation. she did, however, had a smile for us during our check in. We have stayed at lots of Courtyards and Marriott hotels before, but this was the first one that didn't have a complimentary toothbrush as I have forgotten to bring mine.The room was ok, but house keeping always forgot to leave something not refilled. The first night was what was left of the previous guess's shampoo and conditioner and only one wash cloth, second night was one creamer packet for two people and the third was one tea packet and one decaf coffee. Just little annoying things make this a third rate hotel,

The rooms were nice and the hotel was clean and had many nice amenities. The service people in the building were not as friendly as one would expect for coming to Hawaii the first time. I was expecting warm friendly helpful people. I got helpful without the friendly.

I have stayed at a lot of Marriott hotels and was a bit disappointed in this one. It is older and in need of renovation. The "kitchenette" was just a sink and a refrigerator. The view was of the pool and okay but there was a lot of traffic through the hotel parking lot. The restaurants were a bit of a walk to find the really good ones. The staff was friendly and did the best they could to meet our requests. A very different feel from other Marriott hotels and would not be my first choice on our next vacation.

Stayed here for a week as a gold member, I booked a deluxe larger guest room. No upgrade available which was unfortunate. The hotel looks a little dated and room itself was average, I did notice a few things not working but didn't bother to report it. One of the outlets weren't working and the refrigerator smelled like something died inside of it and would spread into the room anytime it was opened. My biggest gripe is that after half the stay, I noticed that the lock on the room was broken as in the door just never locked. I reported having issues with the lock to the front desk and the maid who all said someone would take a look at it and nobody ever did for he rest of the day. I went down to the desk the next morning because I didn't want to leave all of my valuables inside of my room when the door doesn't lock and they sent in a maintenance guy to fix it. When I spoke to the manager, in response to the lack of safety of my room for the first half of my stay, she gave me 10,000 Marriott points (to give scope, it costs 35,000 points to stay one night here) which I wasn't pleased about since its kind of a big deal that my room just never locked and put my belongings and myself at risk. I spent about $1200 for my stay here and if I didn't already pre pay for my entire stay, I would have looked elsewhere. Avoid this place!

Set your expectations accordingly and you won't be disappointed. Good value at this hotel, but don't expect flawless perfection. Clean, but dated facility and rooms. Elevators could be faster, especially on the weekends when they appear to be full. Street noise could be an issue here if u are a soft sleeper. Friendly staff.Best pro: Very clean pool and jacuzzi! Felt great after riding the Honolulu Century Ride 9/24/2017.If u want an impeccable hotel at a rate of double or more, stay elsewhere on the beach. Otherwise, sleep here and save some $'s...just don't expect the world and you won't be disappointed.

I booked through AAA thinking it would be a great experience, I was so wrong! The only plus to this hotel is location, you can walk to several different shopping locations and restaurants. The front desk acted so careless that it was ridiculous. Learn how to be in customer service!! The hotel is not well lit at night, the rooms make you feel like your in a shoe box, thank goodness I wasn't claustrophobic. Valet parking for $39/day was a joke but you don't have any other choice with parking. The photos are very deceiving, this hotel looks old and needs to be renovated badly. The price and quality of the experience didn't go hand in hand with this experience. I told two different staff members that I wasn't happy with my experience and you could tell that they could care less and how it wasn't their problem. I'm glad I didn't agree to extend my stay here because I probably would have more to say, 3 nights here was beyond my tolerance level. My advice is if you can afford to stay a different hotel, then avoid this place if at all possible. It's not worth the stress and headache!

I have been traveling for 20 days and stayed most days at a Marriott hotel. This one was the worst! First of all, as a Gold member I was offered an upgrade to a better room.The better room was in a "tower" across the parking lot, with 12 floors and only one elevator. You have no idea how long it took. Everyone I met complained about it.I am a gold member and was. It offered breakfast although did see at the coffee shop in the lobby that there is some kind of deal with the hotel. Just hope I get those extra points.The room was ok but had an old feel...I am sure there are better options.I MUST congratulate the valet staff. They were quick, would ask you what time you were leaving and there was your car. GREAT service!

That's got to be the best thing about this place... it smells amazing.The pool is comfortable, even next to the parking lot( you really don't notice it's there)Valet parking is expensive $37 per nightRooms are tight/small but clean

I stayed two nights at the Courtyard and two nights a the Waikiki Marriott. If you want to be across the street from the beach this is not the hotel for you, but if you want to save money and stay in a comfortable and clean hotel I recommend this over the Marriott. I enjoyed staying at the Courtyard more than the Waikiki Marriott for the following reasons:Rooms: Modern, clean, looks newStaff: Extremely polite, helpful and attentiveLocation: in the heart of Wakiki (one block away from McDonalds, two blocks away from Starbucks)Hotel: The lobby is small, but it is modern and clean!

Our stay was very nice. Package deal with the Norwegian Cruise line. Easy in and out. Great location. Easy to Uber around town. Walking distance to Waikiki Beach and the Tiki bar and grill. Room was clean and ready when we got there. Easy shuttle to the ship.

We stay at this hotel for 5 days, it's not the most fancy hotel but it's in good location and the staff are great!We checked out at 12 and we got a room to take shower before the flight, I never got this service in any hotels!We booked north shore trip with jhon, he was great and very kind

Was very disappointed in our treatment at this hotel. I had booked 2 rooms but on arrival found that only 1 room was booked. The reason I was told that my credit card was declined on the second room which was not correct.However we did get the second room with a little difficulty.To did not work in one room but maintenance did semi fix it for the night.Amenities are basic. However as we were only overnighting we were happy to at least have accommodation.

We stayed in this hotel in August 2017 and were impressed with the service and the standard of the hotel for the price paid. On arrival the receptionist was extremely friendly and helpful as were the rest of the staff throughout our stay. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the shops and the beach and was ideal for our stay. Didn't experience any issues at all. Would have no hesitation in staying here again.

I have stayed in Marriott's galore, and this one was probably a mid range of how I rate my Marriott's. I booked a triple corner mini suite that advertised floor to ceiling windows. In the pictures it was absolutely beautiful but just alright in person. The furniture was up-to-date and comfortable along with all the typical courtyard amenities along with a small kitchen sink. The staff were super friendly and helpful, especially the valet crew. Upon arrival, my father asked if we could have a luggage cart to take our luggage to the room. They told us to put our luggage on the cart and it would be brought to the room. We unpacked a bit and I decided to head to the store for some water only to find our luggage still sitting in the parking lot on the cart. I took it to the room myself. The location was great, only two blocks to the beach and tons of shopping, food, and local transportation. I usually have no problem sleeping with windows open in the heart of major cities around the world, but between police sirens and garbage trucks from only the fourth floor, I had to sleep with my headphones in even with the windows closed.There was also a consistent congregation of local 'riffraff', as my father called them, hanging out on the small patch of grass between the main hotel and the tower we were staying in. They looked like just enough trouble that we steered clear of them each time we walked down the sidewalk to go shopping. Overall the room was fine, it could have used a little TLC here and there from a shower upgrade to some patchwork in the bathroom. The safe is in the most inconvenient location ever. It's inside the closet inside the bathroom, forcing you to pretty much kneel and put your elbows on the toilet to access the safe. The pools were nice and relaxing. There is a self-serve laundry room with three washers and three dryers, but the place is consistently busy. It took me three hours of waiting amongst all the other guests to get done two small loads of laundry. I did use the gym which I found all the equipment fully functional unlike many other hotel gyms and there were fresh apples and water along with clean towels provided. Overall the price was a bargain, but I think I would spend just a bit more to stay at the other Marriott on the beach. If you're on a strict budget, this is still overall a great place for the value to your money since it is much cheaper and still a great location.

Excellent location, excellent amenities, but most of all, an amazing staff. Every person, from Valet to Front Desk Manager to Housekeeping staff - everyone has the "Aloha Spirit" and they truly go out of their way to ensure my stay is comfortable. This is my second visit to this hotel and I'm planning to return soon. Mahalo to the CYMW Team!!

Myself and my mother stayed here for two weeks in August, and you really can't ask for more from a reasonably priced hotel in Waikiki. The location is great- 10 minute walk to the beach, plenty of quirky local shops nearby, and you're just over the road from the TFS duty free store if you're looking for some bargains. There's plenty of food places nearby, and the restaurant in the hotel is also great- offering good breakfast, great early bird deals, and outdoor seating. We had a deluxe room with two double beds, and the room was very reasonably sized with a large balcony. There is a kitchenette in the room including sink, microwave, coffee machine and fridge. There is a mini market in the hotel for buying quick breakfasts, ice creams and even microwave dinners! The coffee shop in the hotel is also great value for a good coffee with very friendly staff. All the staff are so friendly- never walk past without saying aloha! Even when reception is busy the receptionists still find time for a smile across the lobby. Always loads of staff available at the valet as well, we didn't have a car but it looked like there was never a long wait for your car. (On a side note I would definitely hire a car if I went back to Oahu) The maid was lovely, and very knowledgeable, always told us which bus to get on when she asked where we were headed for the day. The pool area was also very relaxed- in the sun in the morning so very quiet, then in the afternoon it was all in the shade so great for families with young kids to keep them out of the sun for a while. They even had two movie nights a week down by the pool!The bar in the hotel was again reasonably priced for the area (Hawaii is SO expensive for food and drink!) and the barmen were lovely- such comfortable seats outside too for all times of the day. I would definitely stay here if I were to visit Hawaii again.

Had a great time, there are 2 pools (one each side of the carpark) which were both nice. Close enough to walk into Waikiki for meals and to the beach. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful in terms of recommendations and help. Room was nice and clean. No resort fee!

My wife and I stayed here a couple of years ago and it was very disappointing. For the prices charged the rooms are not worth it and paying extra for breakfast included is a joke. For what they charge you extra for breakfast and you only get very limited choice on what you can have and it was disgusting. You could eat breakfast anywhere else in wikiki for half the price and have endless choices. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else

Wife and Friends got together for a weekend getaway. Great Location easy walking distance to International marketplace, the beach and other attractions. Friendly staff.Across the street is McDonalds and IHOP. Hotel has nice KimoBean Coffee Shop.

I stated with a group of 160+ military members.things to know--Parking is Valet OnlyThere is only one conference room by reservation & charge The coffee shop in the lobby is slightly overpriced but that is to be expected. It has excellent drinks & service The pool is nice & cleanThe security is good if not overzealous, I am a member of leadership & we were approached multiple times about our members possibly damaging items. Once they gave us a picture from a hallways camera of an individual who broke a common area TV. We were easily able to confirm it was none of our members due to a distinct tattoo on the members arm. However when I confirmed with the front desk their security guard continued to question me even though I told him multiple times that we have no members with such a tattoo. To which he then stated that he wasn't concerned about the tattoo, that he was able to trace the member to a specific room and that will confirm who it is, it was as if he thought I would be intimidated and suddenly admit that it was one of our members. He then turned to look at the elevator and pointing to one of my guys said "What about him, he looks like this photo" I said no that not only did he not have any tattoos but he was no where near the same build. The guy is a weight lifter vs the thinner culpritThe staff at the desk is friendlyIf you are looking for a central location it is very nice There is a bus stop to nearly the entire city in front of the hotel If you take hotel transportation over to their other resort you can get a $50 AMEX gift card & go to a famous LuauThere is a local gentleman who sits in the lobby, he is full of great information about the language, culture, area, restaurants. He has brought me baked goods from two of the restaurants he has mentioned so far. I would stay at this hotel again based purely off my experience with his friendly, upbeat conversation & advice.

I enjoyed my stay at this location. After the hotel I initially booked for my trip not being anything close to what I expected, I was able to get a room here for my stay. I was pleased and the staff was very friendly.

Bad hotel. I have stayed at the site several times - the staff is not helpful at all. I told them up fron ton check in I'd have a car to park only one day, but they still chared a full week of parking - even with out a car. I told the front desk and the parking staff. I have called twice and even when they see the notes entered - they will not refund parking fees - basicly they are frauds - they know they are over charging - I'm a platnum member, how do they treat others?The hotel is old and very small, this with criminal minded staff makes for property to avoid.

Needed something utilitarian in between flights - clean bed and bathroom and got that. Not a place we'd likely stay at again though. Needs some serious maintenance - and that was on the "elite" floor. (Poorly functioning air conditioner, sliding glass door handle held together with duct tape, water damage just painted over). But in fairness, it doesn't pretend to be something it's not plus has lovely customer service - valet, reception, house keeping.

We were in Honolulu for a high school sports tournament. We reserved multiple rooms, and the process was exceptional from the start. We would absolutely use this hotel in the future. The rooms were clean, updated, have mini fridges in them, and a super quick walk to the beach. Great location too! You cannot go wrong staying at this property as it is close to the beach, restaurants and shops!

We stay here for 6 night in a suite in the Royal Hawaiian Tower room 456 which is at the back of the hotel in a separate tower. You walk through the valet car parking area to get to it. This tower has a pool, ice machine and a laundry. Another pool and spa are located in the main building.This hotel is older style but the room was clean and tidy. The shower was extremely small but was hot and had good pressure. Furniture was in good order and looked newish We had a bedroom with a TV and a separate sitting area also with a TV and a desk. Lounge could be converted into a bed if needed. It also had a small sink, coffee machine, microwave and fridge and a small balcony, with table and chairs. I used the balcony to hang a line so I could dry our clothes.Hotel is in a good location, easy walk to Lewers street the International market place T Galleria (Trolley Ticket Office). There is an Ihop, Whalers, and ABC Stores across the road and a McDonalds in the next block. The Pink trolley stops at the front of the hotel.We had breakfast included which was in the Spada Restaurant on premises. (Read my separate review). Breakfast was limited but good. There is also a coffee shop in the main hotel. Wifi was also includedStaff were friendly and arranged a Dinner Cruise for us, and transfers to Pearl Harbour and the Airport on our departure.The only downside to this hotel is the garbage bins, which are emptied at about 4am each morning. It is extremely noisy and wakes you up as they have multiple bins to empty.Would recommend this hotel as it is close to many things and was reasonably priced.

I stayed one night at this hotel. The reason for the two stars is because the front desk staff were friendly and very accommodating. The valet parking attendants were professional, helpful, and fast! Now the room...I was on the 7th floor overlooking the street in a King suite. The room smelled moldy. The carpet felt damp. There were 2 tvs in the room and neither of them could be powered on. The furniture was icky and there was no way I'd consider sitting on it. The bed was comfy and the linens were clean. The air conditioner wasn't a standard AC. It blew thick, damp air - I shut it off. I wanted to shower so bad but the water wasn't hot, in fact wasn't even lukewarm. I was too tired to ask fornew room, so I dealt with it. The room had a microwave and a fridge. Outdoor pool. Saw an advertisement that they were showing a movie at night at the pool. This hotel reminded me of the cheap hotels we used to rent in college for spring break and cram 10 people in it! It is located several blocks from the beach. it is in the middle of tons of shopping opportunities. But there are much better options for your money. I certainly won't stay here again.

Two day business trip so didn't care about anything other than a clean room. The room had a bug infestation and my room wasn't cleaned/bed made during my stay. When I advised the front desk upon check out the response was "that happens". I will be staying at a different property next time around.
