This is one the worth Courtyard I ever saw. The only could point is its location, but really this is it. We had a warm welcome, and after this that was it. I have been unable to get any laundry done, because no one would pick up the phone within 30 min of pickup, then when I complain at the front desk, they just reply to me that I could get it done at 5 block from the Hotel! When arrived there it was a loundrymat, so no dry cleaning or service, so I could have stay at the hotel...That was the same each time we had any question, for parking, rental etc..Now let's talk about the room. A shoebox. I remind me the hotel room in London, where you have to choose whether you put your suitcase on the bed or on the floor.The door was not closing properly, so before leaving I had to make sure that it was locked. The hotel was generally ver noisy. Either on the road side or on the pool sideIf you have the choice, choose another place

Great location, a short walk to the heart of Waikiki. If you're feeling energetic you can walk to the top of Diamond head from the resort, it will take approx 1hr to the top one way. Rooms are on the older side, but still a good standard. Go for a sea view room if you can as the views are definitely worth it!

Visited w family for a few days. Very busy areA. We had the one bedroom corner suite which was small but larger than the other rooms. Clean but very noisy at night. We were adjusting to the time difference and could not sleep due to road noise. However the room was clean but the bathroom was tiny especially the shower Pool was nice and shaded and the hot tub was small. A little pricey. Parking was $39 per day! Wouldn't recommend. I would generally avoid Waikiki and try to stay a little further away

We spent 3 nights at the Courtyard Waikiki Beach with my wife and 2 kids. The building is old,however it's very well maintained and looks in good condition. All staff was very attentive and friendly . It was definitely a very nice experience . There was a group of people having a small party at the room next to ours . I dialed 0 and in 2 minutes security came to help us with the issue . That's a great way to show that they care about their guests . Well done!

Great choice by my husband to start off the celebration. The property is a bit dated, to be sure. A renovation is def in order. That being said, everything works fine-it's just a bit old looking. 3rd floor pool is nice and food service is prompt & welcoming. Balcony rooms facing the Kuhio Grill are nightly treated to live music at the Grill and sunsets over Waikiki. Absolutely everyone--from front desk to room service to housekeeping--is friendly and helpful. Location is awesome: walking distance to Duke's, the Hars Rock, Azure, shopping and the long stretch that is Waikiki Beach. I recommend a morning walk east along the boardwalk (Kalakaua Ave). At the end walk left onto Coconut past local residences. Walk left onto Diamond Head and continue as far as you like past the amazing Diamond Head itself & expensive beachfront properties. Turn around and cone back when ready.Beach across the street is great for families with very safe swimming and all the amenities. To get away from the crowds tho, rent a car and travel up to the North Shore or Rte. 93 to Makaha Beach.

I have stayed at this hotel many times and it has always been a great experience.I am an elite member and they always go out of their way to grant my requests, late check out, room upgrade, choice of tower. The staff is terrific and always will to help. The showers are small but how long do you stay in the shower. It' not as big as the resort but then again you are not paying the resort prices or the resort fee. Great location right in the heart of Waikiki I will be back on my next trip.

We stayed at the Courtyard for 3 weeks. It was a business trip that my family accompanied my spouse on. My guess is that the majority of people at the hotel were there for business. Over 3 weeks, I did not have one bad experience. The entire staff from front desk to valet to housekeeping/maintenance were outstanding. Very helpful, kind and gracious. I am very particular about cleanliness and our room was immaculately taken care of daily. The hotel did not appear dated to me and yes, the rooms are smaller but not horribly so. The hotel is conveniently located in downtown Waikiki with a very short walk to the beach, stores and restaurants. If you are a Marriott member, you will not find the typical perks you'd acquire in other cities but this was a non-issue for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel for people not seeking the traditional Waikiki resort experience.

This property is similar to a boutique hotel. Originally the property was owned by Wyland - the famous artist. Now it is currently owned by Marriott who has done an extensive upgrading and remodeling to the property. Loved the staff and the service.

I stayed at the courtyard last week for business This hotel is centrally located in Waikiki I had a 2 bed deluxe room which had a microwave and fridge both of which came in very handyThe hotel is about 2 blocks from the beach and located near restaurants and storesIf you are here on vacation you do not need a car but you may need one when on businessHowever Hotel parking is very expensive Room and bathroom cleanThe hotel does have a pool and spa but I did not have time for either

This is a good clean hotel, but not a resort! I stay in a lot of Marriott hotels and this is good as long as you are not expecting a "Hawaii resort" experience, but the price is great for Waikiki! I would not say "don't stay here", but I do want to make sure people know what to expect before they book. As I said, the rooms are up to Marriott standards as far as cleanliness, decorations, and service. But, don't expect to have the "Hawaii" experience, it's just a hotel and not a resort! I do highly recommend the Marriott Beach Resort or the Courtyard North Shore if your looking for the resort experience, they are truly the ones that will give you the best Hawaiian atmosphere. But again, if your just on a budget this is a good hotel. Here are a couple of need to knows. 1. Get a high room! There are a lot of streets and apartments around you so the high room gives you a much quieter experience. 2. The pool is small and does not have enough lounges. I recommend you just plan to go to the beach. 3. It does not have a restaurant of their own, no Marriott breakfast? This hotel was not built as a Marriott so it does not have the usual amenities. There is a small coffee shop on the premises and it has basic pastries for breakfast, as well as an IHOP across the street. There is also a small Italian restaurant attached to the end of the hotel and they do have good food. 4. Again, if you are just looking for a good hotel room and plan to be gone all the time this is a good value, just don't expect the normal Marriott amenities!

Travelling with the kids to Hawaii, this hotel was the first of our vacation trip. As we are 3, I asked for a rollerbed at the reception. After 1 hour, I called the reception to get this rollerbed as we wanted to sleep after 25 hours of travel. One hour later, I called the reception again, got some appologizes and finaly, after another 30 minutes someone brang the bed.As a Marriott Reward member since 14 years, I asked for a late check-out at 2pm. Got a very unfriendly answer that 1pm would be the last, afterwards it would cost me USD 50.-- per hour.The hotel is well situated, even if quite noisy. You're not too far from Waikiki Beach and many restaurants.

I have stayed at this property several times in the last couple of years, tho mostly when I couldn't find good rates at other Marriotts in Waikiki. If you're traveling for business, it's a decent place to spend a few days -- not hard to get around and close enough to the beach; just a few blocks walk. and it's a couple of blocks from all the high-end and mall shopping in waikiki, if that's your thing.the rooms are ok, nothing to write home about. the room i was in for my most recent staywas def not the best: tho it was clean and well-maintained, it smelled musty -- like old, wet laundry -- and traffic noise was an issue. 3rd floor room overlooked Kuhio Ave and a couple of bus stops. really loud in the mornings and sometimes pretty late into the evening.smallish gym but definitely enough to get in a decent workout, if you are creative and if you time your workout to miss the crowd.staff was consistently welcoming and helpful -- this has been the case every time i stay at this property and i think i have been there 5-6 times in the last two years.

Stayed in this property several times in the last few months and must admit it's not my favourite. An old building with many rooms in need of a refresh. I have yet to stay in a room where there was not a problem, flooding of a backed up sink, room door not closing, internet not reaching room, cracks in the wall, and the lust goes on.Every time I called or spoke to the front desk the starting response was an insincere "I am sorry"Oh your a Marriott top tier member, that's nice, so are the other 50 % of the guests staying.Not planning on returning so soon.

The Courtyard Marriott is a no frills hotel for budget conscious travellers. The location is convenient for shopping in Waikiki and 5-10 minutes walk to the beach. The hotel is on the corner of a busy intersection so you will hear traffic during the daytime but it isn't a problem at night once the tour buses are gone. There are many places to get breakfast including IHOP, McDonald's, and Starbucks Reserve nearby. The restaurant downstairs has a restaurant where we had a good breakfast sandwich. To get to our room we went through an indoor corridor and through an exit door that led to an outdoor walkway where our room was located off. I was a little surprised the entrance to the room was from the outside. We had to tie our do not disturb sign to the door because it kept blowing off in the wind. I would suggest the hotel come up with a solution for this as I saw other's do this too. The lobby is extremely fragrant with a Hawaiian floral scent and too overpowering so I think they can tone it down so it doesn't bother people who are sensitive to strong perfume. The bathroom was tiny and shower was dark. We are not big people and it was just big enough for one of us. The sink and shower are both compact sizes so that could be an issue for some. The bedroom was good size though. The free wifi is super slow and you have to pay for high speed access. We turned the tv on and it wasn't working. After looking at all the cords, it was due to the plug being loose. We both had stuffy and runny noses while we were in the room and thought maybe needs a new air filter. When we set the air at night it seems like it doesn't remain at the temperature we set it because it would get stuffy in the middle of the night and the air felt damp. On a good note, the staff was friendly and when we called for more towels, the employee came promptly. We also had an issue with our door not opening. After getting a new key card and that not working, a worker came to fix the door. He came within 5 minutes. There were a few glitches with our stay and there could be some improvements especially with the wifi, air conditioning and the door sign.

Rooms have paper thin walls. Heard elevators and street traffic all night. Rooms are very small. Rooms are clean and staff helpful. Valet parking only available and expensive. Location okay but be prepared to walk to get to the beach.

The hotel is renovated and nice.Great location (really!! How much do ppl really stay in hotel room..beach, etc..) the staff was extra nice they really go out the way to help.. Anna was very friendly and helpful...trolley car and public transportation is the best.. right outside hotel...took us everywhere.. china town..great buys and swap meet(flea market) at aloha stadium excellent and walmart $$$...ABC store way over priced!! It was a short trip....Marukame Udon Japanese restaurant is excellent...right down the street... homeless situation is horrible..we all should remember how blessed we are.... I would definitely stay again..aloha!!

I booked this because of price. It is walking distance to the beach. It was clean and quiet. The area has a lot of homeless and this made the area feel worse than it was. The staff was excellent. They bar is tiny, but the drinks are good. They have a warm salt water pool and that was well worth the visit. The other pool is small, but pretty.

This Courtyard is a disappoint to the Marriott brand. The main tower is the only one that has been renovated, but it still has 2 inch gaps between the room door, a window type a/c unit and the other 2 towers look very "seedy". As a loyal Marriott rewards member, I was shocked at this hotel. The room was nicely furnished and the bathroom was large, but you could probably get a room at the Waikiki Marriott for close to the same price. The pool area here was fine and the kids enjoyed swimming at night with the changing lights in the pool.The employees at check-in were friendly. We did have room keys that didn't work 3 times in a row and maintenance was still trying to fix when we left.The location is good for walking to Waikiki beach and felt safe.

I stayed here a few weeks ago for 2 days before my cruise. This is your basic Courtyard – nothing fancy. I was told the rooms were updated but it could have had more improvements. I was in Tower 2 – not sure what Tower 1 looked like. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. I appreciate that there wasn’t any resort fee at this location. Hotel is centrally located to restaurants and shops. Overall I probably wouldn’t stay here again.

It is unfortunate that the customer service at the Courtyard is so very poor because the hotel really is in a great location. The rooms are small but functional and the hotel amenities are what you would expect from a 3 star hotel in Waikiki. Be aware though, if you are on the Kuhio St side it is very noisy at night and the free wifi is very slow. My issues then, lie with the incidentals and credit card holding charges expected of the guests. We had booked two rooms with bookings.com for 10 nights. Both rooms were under the same booking but two different surnames. When checking in I supplied the booking conformation and was informed our rooms were on different levels because unless they are under the same name they are not treated as a group booking... go figure. We were then told that they would hold the entire room amount plus $200 USD for room incidentals. As we were paying with cash (5 different people paying) this did not suit us at all. I offered to pay the entire amount upfront and have the $200 incidentals charged to our CC. Louise informed us that that was not policy and the only way to pay for the full amount in cash was after the 7th day (?) and the holdings would then be released back to my CC taking 5-7 days. With her poor attitude I accepted defeat and agreed. She continued to tell us rudely that our rooms weren't ready and to come back at 3. They did call us at 2.40pm to say one room was now ready so we headed back to the hotel. I had had time to think about our CC situation and decided that it wasn't good enough. I spoke to the person behind the reception, now the manager named Jodie who agreed to release our money and accept full cash payment (how easy was that) She informed us that the payment would be returned within 5-7 days (it was held for no more then an hour). Jodie confirmed that both card amounts were released and I was satisfied. On the seventh day one card amount had been released but not the second. I left it a few more days incase it was due to being an Australian bank and on the night before check out spoke with Ana (who was very helpful and friendly during the visit) confirm the release and she said it had NOT been released. I would like to mention that this was not a few hundred dollars it was over $6000 AUD. According to all three people this was the policy however this is not made clear on booking.com which states '100% of the first night may be charged after booking' only. Overall a very very disappointing stay which dampened our holiday and we will certainly not make the same mistake twice.

First of all this is not a luxury hotel on the beach. You can not get an ocean view.However, this is a very nice moderate range hotel which is located in very convenient area in Wikiki. Because the hotel is a couple of blocks north from the busiest area, it is relatively quiet, especially at night.Good value for service.

This was a business trip so I didn't spend much time in the room. It's a standard Courtyard. The hotel was appealing from the outside with nice landscaping and a small pool. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I was in and out of the lobby frequently and also only heard pleasant interactions with the staff and other guests. There is a small coffee shop in the lobby for a light breakfast. There is also a market with a microwave in the lobby. There is a small bar that always seemed to have a steady business. The pool is small and only gets sun for a short amount of time but it was pretty. In the section that I was in there were ice machines only on two floors. My room had a refrigerator was was good. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The room was small but clean and sufficient for one person. My big negative for this hotel is the noise. I was on the 5th floor on the Kuhio St. side of the building. I was shocked at how much noise came in. Kuhil St was very busy. There was a bus stop 1/2 block away and around the corner was a tour bus pick-up for Japanese tourists. There was a constant stream of buses. Two nights the bar across the street was extremely noisy! There were the frequent emergency vehicles going by. The other side of the hotel was probably quieter. If I had not had ear plugs I would not have been able to sleep. There is an Italian Restaurant connected to the hotel that also is open for breakfast. It's about a 10 minute walk to the beach. There are two ABCs stores within the block. Plenty of places to eat within a 15 minute walk both higher end and budget friendly. I recommend taking some time to walk around the block in the front and back of the hotel looking for small local shops. I wish I had done it on my first day instead of my last.

Only half mile from Waikiki and a block from newly updated International Marketplace. Landscaping is aloha lush, valet parking, gorgeous pool for those wanting to avoid sand. Shuttle at front door to anywhere you want to go or Uber for quick transport. Room was immaculate. Coffee shop and Italian restaurant on site.

Me and my Husband have stayed here 3 times, it's very comfortable and location perfect to get to any where to walk, bus or get the hotel Staff to help with anything. Reception Staff very nice and helpful. We will be back.

I travel to Honolulu frequently so I tend to stay with a trusted brand. The Courtyard fits that nicely. The personnel make this a special property. It starts with the valet parking team and goes all the way to the always smiling staff that keeps your room fresh and clean. A short walk to the beach or run along the ala wai. You really can't go wrong here.

After being a loyal Marriott customer for 15 years, we had decided to go to Hawaii for 5 nights and what a lovely experience we had! The staff are kind and helpful at every question we had. The concierge went out of their way to ring our booking day trips to confirm some information as was confused about something. Our room every day was clean and spotless and housekeeping were very helpful when asking for extra items.About 10 mins walked from Waikiki Beach and such an ideal location!!!Would definitely recommend coming back again!

I have visited often over the last several year and it was always bittersweet as I was leaving my stationed husband. Heidy always takes good care of us, remembers all the goings on in our life and family and stops to check in on the latest news. The rooms are immaculate and housekeeping goes above and beyond. I use to stay here so I could work but the hotel, but it is so great now that I am retired I still stay. It is far enough away from the base to feel like an actual vacation for my husband but close enough that he can report to work if ordered.

The Courtyard is a "no-frills" Marriott. Although rooms have been updated, It's still not a high-end resort hotel. It's basic and clean and they have a friendly and helpful front desk staff. We've stayed here several times when we could get a good rate. The location is on 'The Bus' line and is quite central for walking to most places in Waikiki. It appears that most complaints about this hotel is that they are not as good as other Marriotts. Perhaps it's because people don't understand that there are several 'brands' within the Marriott chain ranging from ultra-luxury (Ritz) to mid-range (Courtyard) hotels. We've enjoyed all our stays here and wouldn't hesitate to come back. Just don't expect a deluxe resort hotel. My rating is based on this particular Marriott delivering exactly what they should - a very good mid-range hotel.

Great hospitality the staff is just wonderful all the way from the assistant managers Hisham Elazzouizi. To the ladies that clean my room. If I had the opportunity to comeback I will stay here. Everything is top class. Thank you for a wonderful stay.:)

We stayed here for 7 nights. Christian took care of us. Thanks. Rooms clean, everyone friendly and helpful. You can talk to anything you want....beach, shopping, bar hopping and the sites. It can be a little noisy but not big deal. Go check out the North Shore, go do some hiking... beautiful island.We really enjoyed it.Mahalo

We were arriving in Honolulu a couple days prior to a cruise. I decided to book a hotel that was not directly on the beach but within a walkable distance. This location fit the bill. I also read that this hotel had recently undergone some major renovations. This information, combined with a moderate price, made this property seem like a good value. Wow, was I wrong. Standing in my room and looking at the door, I could see a vertical shaft of light on one edge of the door because the door wasn't square. The exterior windows were such poor quality that it sounded as if the traffic on the busy street below was passing through my room. The concierge desk undoubtedly had an official policy of hiring only the grumpy. They were not welcoming at all. That said....the folks at the front desk were friendly, helpful and cheerful. There is a coffee shop on the premises that also followed the same hiring principles as the concierge desk. There is an Italian restaurant that shares space at this hotel. The food was very good and the wait staff friendly and efficient.All in all, I would never stay at this property again. The price may look inviting but it is not a good value at all. If Mr. Marriott were to play undercover boss at this facility, I doubt that they would have the Marriott signage 24 hours later.

Staff very friendly and helpful. Had the BEST room service ever by Xing Jiao...she needs a raise! :) She took such extra care in cleaning and organizing our stuff. Rooms are small but but clean. Close to everything in Waikiki.

True to form Marriott Hospitality, vibe, friendliness, and cleanliness. A great location within a few minutes walk of Waikiki and all of the shopping, it provides a clean place to stay while working yet giving you ready access to all of the shopping and restaurants of Waikiki. It is on a pretty major street, so any police sirens or loud vehicles tends to reverberate between the Courtyard and the building across the street.

Sadly, this was not up to Marriott standards. No elevator if you are not lucky to be staying "loft" section of this hotel, felt more like a motel. The room did not live up to what we enjoy from Marriott. There was no hot water for showering. We have a reservation to stay at this hotel at the end of the week for two nights, and we are now cancelling this stay.

Stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the top floor, very friendly staff and the hotel has been recently renovated. The only drawback is the lack of elevators (only 2), the staff more than make up for this. Centrally located.

I stay at this hotel whenever I come to Honolulu (four consecutive years now). The location can't be beat. The hotel is near transportation, shopping, and good eateries. It is a no frills hotel. (It's not like the Hilton Hawaiian Village which is a huge maze, busy, and crawling with tourists as well as residents.) The Courtyard has pretty much the basics: a small Italian restaurant, a coffee house, a mini-market, a business center, a travel center, a pool area, a spa (not affiliated with the hotel) and a bar. All of this on the first floor! The rooms are nice; the staff is very helpful and pleasant.

I love staying here when I'm in Waikiki. It's not a huge hotel, it's been renovated recently and the staff is always nice. The main building has bathtubs and lanai in the rooms (The side building with salt water pool does not). The rooms are everything you expect from Marriott, comfortable beds and good linens, etc. The main pool here is nice. There isn't much sun, but the pool is large and there is a nice hot tub also. There is a bar accessible from the pool area that is good. There's also an Italian restaurant and a little coffee shop. This is a great place to stay in Waikiki. It's nicer than anything else in this price range by far. Frankly, I prefer this Courtyard location to the big Marriott in Waikiki The big Marriott is so large that it can be confusing, the courtyard is smaller and friendlier, in my opinion. Located right in the heart of Waikiki, anything you need is within walking distance. This property is not beachfront, but the beach is very close. Finding metered parking in Waikiki is quite the task, especially at night. The Courtyard offers valet parking only, I'm not sure about the current price, but it's probably going to be your only option here. There is no self parking and finding a meter after 6pm is like winning in lotto. If you're a local staycationing, ask about kamaaina discount when booking. They won't offer it, but it does exist. ;)

I am a big Marriott fan, and it is impossible to beat the "family" feeling that guests receive at this property. I had stayed here 3 times on business, and every time it has been great. The business center is convenient, and staff are more than happy to help you. "Courtney at the Courtyard" really helped me this last visit (and also my first visit), when I needed prepare a brief. She was super! Others there are also helpful. Rooms are clean and nice (not grand, but then you are not on the waterfront). Location is good for me. Easy to walk anywhere - International Market, etc. Valet parking is quick and convenient.

I wanted to thank Brent and his group sales team for an excellent stay for our group. Everything went smoothly, from reservations, to check in, to accommodating special requests. Perfect hotel for our small group who was here on business, the hotel is away from some of the hustle and bustle of Kalakaua, and had easy access.

We booked a 'junior sweet' for 3 people. On past visits we stayed in the main building; not luxury by any means, but clean. I spent an hour on the phone, directly with the hotel, trying to ensure a hold due to our late arrival (2200). When we arrived the next evening there was little to no support for assistance nor baggage, and we were traveling with a wheelchair. We struggled with bagggae to the room in an adjacent building, only to find a dingy sweltering room with an inoperable air conditioning system. I returned to the desk asking what happened to our 'junior suite' only to be told that was it. The third rollout bed was not prepared and with one person on duty it took an hour to prepare. Overall, I cannot recommend this hotel. The room and service was terrible.

Stayed at the Courtyard Waikiki Beach for one night. Dave checked me in, the process was quick and smooth. I stayed in a one bedroom. The living area was spacious and had a great place for working if traveling on business. Luckily I was not there on business and the black out curtains worked perfectly. Check out was simple, I just had to call the front desk. Didn't get to check out the pool, but maybe next time.

There's nothing special about this hotel.. But there's nothing much wrong with it either. It's within easy reach of the beach, the shops,The restaurants etc. And the facilities are pretty good - better than basic, but not exceptional - probably what you should expect.A few things went wrong in the room - we had a 1 bedroom suite - bit of a waste of time really because no bigger than a decent sized double - our aircon was leaking, and one if the electric sockets in the bathroom was inoperative. These were dealt with quickly and efficiently by the maintenance team.The staff and service here are really good. Everybody is really friendly and nothing appears to be too much trouble. You'd probably want to stay somewhere a bit more up market if you can afford it but, to be fair, it's clean and comfortable and you can get sun lounger, and there are a couple of pools... you'll probably need the money that you save staying here for all the other massively expensive stuff in Waikiki!

I booked my room hoping that I will have a great stay at this Marriott property. At the end, I think Courtyard Waikiki has failed to meet Marriott's standards. Overall the stay was very disappointing.1. The only positive aspect of the hotel is its location. Beach, shopping and restaurants are just a short walk away. For those using public transportation, the bus stop is right in front of this hotel. 2. The deluxe room I stayed had a very small bathroom. Particularly, the shower area is very cramped. The taps in the kitchen sink and bathroom wash basin are positioned so badly that 50% of the water will flow outside during usage. And the placing the wardrobe inside the very small bathroom is a very bad idea.3. The breakfast was the worst of all and totally disappointing. Very poor for a 3 star hotel. Never expected such a bad breakfast from a Marriott hotel. Very limited choices and too small portion sizes. Even the banana was not provided in full. Never seen any hotel providing half banana for breakfast. And the size reduced to a quarter by the end of the stay.4. Rooms not sound proof. Only table lamps. Poor lighting in the room.5. The deluxe large (king or queen) guest room is poor, but expensive than the deluxe double room.

I actually like a lot of Marriott Courtyard properties. Most have had an excellent lobby upgrade creating a modern, comfortable environment. Not this one. I felt like this was a forgotten hotel that had not had much done to it since maybe the 1970s. It has multiple towers located around the pool area. The pool is very small. The lobby is not pleasant. Actually, unpleasant. The staff are okay but not particularly welcoming. This hotel is competing with the likes of the Hilton Garden Inn and the Holiday Inn Express. Both of those nearby properties are worth staying at. Unless you only care about price, I recommend against this hotel.

With friendly , knowledgeable staff and a central location this is a good choice for Waikiki. Rooms are newly renovated, WiFi is free. There is a pool, a bar, a coffee shop, and a good Italian restaurant on site. Two blocks or less to the beach.

Visited on a business trip, and for that, it was fine. Not a property we would likely select for vacation. We found the observations of other travelers to be on the mark. Summarizing key points:Pro's: - Quieter than the heart of Waikiki (Kaulakua Ave).  - Clean. - Surprisingly competitive happy hour prices in the lobby bar! - No resort fees.Con's: -The Royal Hawaiian Tower has a single, small elevator with no access control. The valet stand sort of oversees the building entrance, On the whole, would recommend single women travelers not use this tower. (It could be easily resolved with key card control of the elevator). The main tower is fine; it has interior corridors. - Very tight control of parking by the valets. No quick in an outs. Even a couple minutes will incur a fee of about $3 for the first 30 minutes.Neither, just for transparency: - About a 4 block walk to Waikiki Beach. - Like much of Waikiki, an older property. Clearly wasn't built as a Courtyard, yet meets the standard. - Not much green space. This is common in Waikiki. At least they didn't fill every inch with a souvenir stand or bar. If one cares about décor and was looking for something Hawaiian, it might not measure up.So, Courtyard represents itself appropriately. Its not a resort, yet is clean and comfortable. Service is decent, and everything in Waikiki is within walking distance. There's a value play for those who simply need a place to sleep. We have business on Oahu about once a year, and would consider staying here again.

If you want a view of the ocean and cookies on your bed this is not your hotel. If you came to Hawaii to explore our beautiful islands or a local needing a much-needed staycation this is a great hotel to try. It is reasonably priced and has several amenities that bigger hotels offer. The Guest Room and Guest Suites are newly renovated. My husband and I stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. It was furnished with a microwave, pull-out couch, and mini-refrigerator. It had 2 flat screen tv's and several outlets in the room. The mattresses were comfortable and the pillows were soft. Our room was on the 7th floor. The city noise did not bother us at all. I loved the decor of the room and the soft relaxing color scheme. What is Awesome about this hotel:1. LocationFOR TOURISTS: It's int he heart of lWaikiki, within walking distance to Waikiki Beach, Shopping, signature Restaurants and entertainment. LOCALS: It's near many popular hotels where you will attend business meetings, graduations, weddings, etc. 2. Amenities*On site restaurant and coffee shop.*Fitness center.*2 outdoor pools (One is FRESH water and the other is SALT WATER both heated).*Jacuzzi*FREE WIFI*SPA Facility*Snack Bar *Free business office WITH PRINTERThere are more amenities that they offer. 3. Great staff that exemplify the Aloha spiritFrom the valet to the front desk, room help and every staff in the hotel we were greeted with smiling faces. 4. No resort Fee! For your Information: 1. ParkingAs every hotel in Waikiki you have to pay for parking. Courtyard Waikiki Beach only offers Valet. It cost $39 PER DAY! 2. Spada (on site restaurant) This restaurant offers Italian food. Use your registered credit card on Yelp to get 3% back on your total bill. When my husband and I came for lunch there was only 1 server for the whole restaurant. 3. Check out the stand located near the hotel with free coupons and information on what Oahu has to offer.Overall, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and plan to return.

This hotel is in a perfect location, 1 block from the beach, Royal Hawaiian Village, the recently renovated Hawaiian Marketplace and all the dining/shopping places. The Front desk staff are so friendly and if you are a member of Marriott, they will upgrade your room. There are 2 pools, with one being heated. The rooms themselves are very clean and spacious. The suite had its own lounge area with a sofa and working desk. The internet in these rooms was excellent. The best internet ever on the island. The kitchenette has all the necessary requirements. One main thing to point out is the size of the bathroom which is huge comparing to others. The balcony is also spacious and has 2 chairs/table. We will always recommend this hotel to others and have already booked this hotel for our upcoming trip during the Christmas break.

We recently stayed at the Courtyard Marriott . If you are thinking you will see a beach from your room as the name of the hotel suggests you will be mistaken . The rooms look out on to hundreds of other skyscrapers . In fact nothing of the place suggests you are near a gorgeous ocean . The hotel itself is huge . If you want a small hotel this is not for you . The rooms have a funky layout and most of the electrical outlets in our room actually worked . The pillows were extremely comfortable . The room had a refrigerator and a hair dryer . The shower was tiny . In order to access the lobby from the room one has to walk across the parking lot . It was raining and we had to stand in the rain waiting for the valet to bring our car to us . This hotel will not be my first choice if visiting Honolulu again .

The best part of this hotel is the staff! They are always cheerful and very helpful. The hotel is an older one that has been updated. Unless you get an upgraded room, they are small. Nice, but small. If the price is right and the need was there, I would stay there again.

I was there for a business trip. This is not a high end hotel. But the staff make this place feeling like home after a day's tiresome. They changed my room upon request and extend my late check-out after I explained my situation. It is worth the money. Good location as well, close to the beach and some popular restaurant.

The entry to the hotel and pool area are really nice. I would like to give this hotel a higher rating except for with the experience I had - I cannot. I was in town for a business trip and on the 3rd day of my stay opened my microwave to heat up some coffee. Inside was a furry bowl of macaroni and cheese that had clearly been there for a while. I was on my way out for the day so I went to the front desk to specifically request that the room be serviced and the microwave cleaned. Bad enough, right? Nope. Upon my return that evening I checked the microwave to find the furry dish still inside. I received an "oops, sorry" from the front desk and did have someone there immediately to clean but this was still quite disappointing. I'm in a Marriott a couple times a month and have never run into this. The hotel itself was pretty dated but other than the microwave incident the staff was pretty responsible and helpful. I did find the on site gym well stocked with free weights, sit up balls and treadmills. It was also quite clean which was appreciated.I will look to stay elsewhere during my next trip.

The staff is very nice except a person at the valet booth. This is a very old and run down hotel. I stayed in the tower. The elevator is available to anyone off the street, no key card required. Then the entrance to the room is outside, motel style. If I had been staying alone I would have been uneasy as there were a lot of sketchy people hanging outside near the vacant lot directly across from the tower. The entrance door doesn't fit the frame so bugs, light, humidity can all easily come in. Many marks on the walls that could have easily been fixed and painted over. Beds uncomfortable and small lengthwise. My fuse blew in the bathroom and maintenance took about an hour finding the problem, somewhere outside of my room. All the while I was trying to get ready for dinner in the dark. Hairdryer was cracked, still worked but I wasn't sure if I may get shocked. A/C unit cranked as low as it would go but still was warm at night. Walking distance to beach but the view was that sketchy lot. Parked my car for about 2 min in a space that was for valet so I could run in and get my luggage. With all the one ways and tight entrance area to valet it was more convenient for me. When I came back down with my bag the valet was moving cars to box my rental in so they could tow it. He also scolded me for parking there. There were about 5 open valet spaces so I don't know what his problem was but not nice to scold your guest. I would never stay here again. Only did this time because the price my company would pay but for $196/night it was way overpriced. It's on the level of a cheap motel, not a Marriott. Only positive was the nice staff at the front desk.

This was my second stay at the Courtyard in six months. Very good location. Amazing welcome by David at the desk. And great guest service later by everyone at the desk. Room was good, I was concerned it might be a little noisy since on the street, but traffic died down around 10 PM and was not an issue. Coffee place was expensive - about twice the price of Starbucks which is 1 1/12 blocks away. IHOP directly across the street for breakfast - 10X better than any Courtyard Bistro for breakfast - not that this hotel has one. Yes - No resort fee - that's a big savings - most hotels add $25-40/night, no resort fee and free internet - for those who complained about value - not sure you realized the savings! Overall a very good visit - I was sooo impressed with the team I emailed them and the ownership office to recognize them. Their Assistant Front Office Manager responded, ownership has not.

This hotel is extremely overpriced, the rooms are literally little boxes, Travelodge in the UK offers better rooms than this hotel. We were on the 14th floor and the noise from the street was ridiculous, the rooms were small, the amenities were not great- very disappointed to spend our last days in the Hawaii Islands here! In addition to paying overpriced room rates, the parking is a rip-off at $40 a day! I would expect if you have paid for a room, to have free parking for hotel guests included. If you can avoid this hotel, I would suggest that you do so.

Marriott should be proud to have the staff here representing their brand! Second time in a year we have visited this hotel and although it's not directly on the beach, with this level of customer service and a beautifully well maintained property, we have chosen to stay here repeatedly. From the valet service, front desk staff, and our bar (aka waiter/restaurant) staff, the staff here has you taken care of! Last year the concierge booked me the fishing trip of my lifetime on the Ruckus! In the bar and in addition to those blue Hawaiian cocktails, you definitely should try the fish and chips!We've stayed in a few different rooms here and they have all been very nice! Comfortable for work and play.Love being close to all my favorite shops and restaurants. Also, the birds in the courtyard are a bit rambunctious in the mornings.Aloha!

Hotel is in a great location on Waikiki easily walkable to restaurants, shops and beach. Hotel has been refurbished but it's more a window dressing which is reflected in the poor quality of the construction. Rooms are not well sound proofed at all - lots of noise - from the streets, other rooms, elevator etc. One will need earplugs to sleep.

The good side: Whatever the staff could do to make the stay pleasant, they did. I stayed for 2 weeks on a business trip. Everyone on the desk, at the valet stand, in the bar, was warm and pleasant and as accommodating as they could be. The room was unfailingly clean. This place smelled really good, and that's a deal breaker for me.The hotel is an older one but has been immaculately renovated. The website calls it a resort, but that's a stretch. However, you don't have to pay resort fees and on Oahu, that's a plus. The property is small and it's in a busy area about a quarter mile from the beach. There's a small breakfast restaurant in the lobby, and an Italian restaurant open for dinner. The bar area was comfortable and convenient. The pool is shaded most of the day by surrounding buildings, so the water is cold. The standard rooms are small- no microwave. (There's one in the lobby.) They do have refrigerators. The bathroom measures 48 by 63 inches, and has a tiny shower. The location is noisy, especially at 2 am when the bars let out. Thank goodness I have good headphones. Lighting needs to be added near the only entrance open at night. It's dark and hidden by foliage.

staff very helpful-standard room adequate but small shower-two room suite full size bath-bed and room comfortable- ductless mini split AC(which I prefer)- good central Waikiki location 10 min to beach-been coming for 10 years - good value for the price

Stayed here for business due to cost, won't make that mistake again. It was a decent hotel but you could tell it was older and needed some attention. My door for example didn't fit the frame right, so when leaving my room I was able to promptly announce to my neighbors with a loud slamming door. Sorry about that folks. The staff was very nice and helpful for a number of reasons. It's ok, but that's not what I expected or was looking for.

Hotel has friendly staff, rooms are clean but minimal and very very small, lots of traffic and noisy with a ventless type act unit hooked on your room wall, building is very old and plumbing is not good.
user_name:
Explorer663662
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed at the Courtyard for a week and we were quite happy with the experience. Front desk staff were a bit disorganised and don't count on early check in. Getting off an overnight flight (with no sleep) and having to wait for hours wasn't fun. But we were very happy with the one bedroom suite we had. Very spacious and well appointed. The bed was super comfortable (the fold out couch had a super thin mattress so i would assume anyone who would have to sleep on it would have a Jerry and Elaine visiting Del Boca Vista experience on that bed. Stella!!). Clearly we were in a renovated room, and despite us being on a high floor the soundproofing was nonexistent. Please please please invest in better soundproofing for the balcony doors (didn't seem very secure either). 16 floors up and the road (and pedestrian) noise was very loud. But we will stay here again for the great location and price. The suite is definitely worth paying for, especially if you want to spend some time just hanging out in your room.

I found out that I had left my prescription sun glasses in my room after I had checked out and gone to the Honolulu Airport. I called the room service and they confirmed that they have located my glasses and transferred my call to the Gold Elite customers service manager , Heidi. She told me to wait at the curb of the terminal since I have not checked in yet. 25 minutes later, she personally delivered my glasses to me. I am impressed with Heidi who went an extra mile to satisfy her customers!!

Typical Courtyard property, meets usual Marriott expectations. If you like Courtyard, you will be OK here. Rooms are small. Location is loud, noisey, lots of traffic and congestion. Property is not on the beach, but within walking distance.

Stayed here for a work trip since it was the most affordable but still close to our offices. Overall, great location in Waikiki, but the hotel itself was underwhelming. I was in a room facing the street which was loud 24/7, with car and foot traffic. The pool is anti-climatic since EVERYONE is watching you swim from folks parking, getting their cars, hotel keys, etc. Also, the rooms didn't feel that clean despite being recently updated and honestly felt super IKEA-ey despite being a Marriott hotel. And to get a cab to get to the airport is insane. It took nearly1 hour because my request was handed off to someone else, who then passed it off, etc. I barely made my flight!!

I stayed here April 6-9 because hotel that I booked make an error with my hotel reservation and I found myself without a hotel room during spring break at 12:30am. Thank you Marriott for accommodating me at the last minute.I travel to Oahu frequently. This was the first time I've stayed at this hotel.WHAT I LIKED:the friendly and helpful gentleman who checked me in at the front desk. I think his name was Nick, an older man with glasses. Super helpful!The hotel had been updated recently so things are modern and newIHOP restaurant is directly across the street The lobby has a little mini makers for snacksThe hotel is conveniently located near retail shops and ABC store The facility is about a 15 minute walk to the beachHotel features room service and Paul Mitchell toiletries There is onsite parking for a feeBest of all -- NO RESORT FEEfree in room WiFiBed was comfortableI had room with two double beds. I'm short so it was great for me but someone 6 foot tall might find that double bed too smallWould I return again? ABSOLUTELY!!!!! Great service is everything and that's what I received here!!!! THANK YOU, COURTYARD MARRIOTT!!!

I have stayed at this hotel several times. Its location is above average, only a few blocks from the beach. While I would prefer one of the beachfront hotel (Moana Surfrider, Royal Hawaiian), they come with a much bigger price tag even without the tacked on resort fee. This hotel honestly tells you the cost per night without the subterfuge of a tacked on fee to pay for the pool--which in the case of the hotels above are small. I do have one negative comment. I have previously stayed in the main part of the hotel. I stayed this time in the tower across the way. It is much noisier than the main building and my view is of parking garages, so the balcony is useless. I am also not crazy about the room which is handicapped accessible which means there is a roll-in shower. Obviously, if I needed this, it would be great. The room is bigger and might be perfect (Pullout sofa I don't need) for a family with children. But I preferred my previous room which was much smaller but I could see the water from the bed. I was offered a choice and should have had more information before I chose. I also expect that they would have moved me if I asked. The desk clerks are excellent.As I said, I have stayed here before. It is well-located amongst interesting restaurants and a short walk to the beach. I will be back.

This property is in an older structure with strange, small rooms. There is no central air, but rather, individual AC units in the rooms that don't quite remove the humidity. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. While my room was clean, the elevators and hallways were not. You're about 3 blocks from the beach. The pool area is nice.

Location is great, several staff are very friendly and personable. What is most concerning is security. Not once was I asked for identification when having room cards reinstated. Why? The cards are always failing, none of them have been kept near any electronic devices to deactivate them but the cards constantly fail. When having them reinstated at the desk, never was I asked for identification.Location is great but he noise is something that will keep you up at night sometimes. Muscle cars and Harley's along Kuhio Avenue and bars along the side streets will ensure that noise will be a constant companion.Valet - Parked a car overnight once and was presented a USD$118 bill for what was suppose to be a USD$39 charge for the night. Careless much?Rooms - Decent but please invest in better soundproofing. Disappointed with Housekeeping cracking once of my difusser with not so much as an apology note. I can always have it replaced, no biggie, but at least be honest enough to apologise for breaking it.6 more nights here and counting down the days till I can leave this joint!

Rooms were recently remodeled, and while they obviously weren't brand new, they weren't shabby either. We stayed in a 1bd suite, though friends who stayed in deluxe rooms complained about shower size. The shower in the 1bd suite was over a tub so we didn't have that problem.Location, though, is amazing for Waikiki. Walking distance to a ton of restaurants, bars, shopping, the International Marketplace, Yokocho Alley, etc. BUT the best part is that it wasn't on the main road (Kalakaua) so it was quieter when we wanted to get some rest.Service was great. People are super friendly. I coordinated my wedding hotel block here and had a great experience with Brent. Highly recommend him.

We were on vacation for 10 days. The room was overlooking the pool on the 9th floor, with a nice balcony. The staff was very nice and helpful. We did have a problem with our door not locking on several occasions, but maintenance usually was quick to respond and temporarily fix it. As many have stated, room is small, but we weren't there to live in the room, just to sleep and shower! :). I wished the mandatory $39 a day for valet was advertised better. After all, you are already paying for a rental car, so this doubled the price of our rental. But it was safer and more convenient than trying to find a parking place each time we returned to the hotel. In regard to noise, we could definitely hear every door close and loud voices from the hallway. The doors could use more insulation around them as the light is peering around the door at night time (like a night light). Overall, I would recommend the hotel to people who aren't looking for a resort feel. We enjoyed the pool and spa. Sun only on part of the pool, throughout the morning, not the afternoon hours.

We had just flown back from Australia and were exhausted. We had a reservation here and hoped to check in early. The reception desk gave us a room when we arrived. It was in the back tower. (I have to assume that the back tower was a different from the front tower as a used Yugo is from a Mercedes.) The walk outside our room was littered with trash. The bathtub in the room was the worst I'd ever seen, outside of a dump. It was supposed to be a junior suite. Outside of being a large room, there was nothing suite-like about the room. I won't go into all the things wrong with the room, but as we were leaving, there was some type of package taped above the door. I didn't check it out for fear that it was drug paraphernalia left by the last guest. My wife fell asleep due to exhaustion. When I complained to the manager on duty, he did offered to move us to a different room, presumably in the front tower, which looked good. I wish I had taken him up on his offer. In the alternative, he did offer to credit us back some Marriott Rewards points which we used for our stay. It was of little consolation. The staff was friendly, but the fact that such a room existed in the Marriott chain, much less was billed as a "junior suite", is appalling. And we are platinum elite Marriott Rewards members. If that is the kind of room one gets there as a platinum elite member, I shudder to think what kind of room that someone not a Marriott Rewards member would receive. I gave a 2 star rating because the front tower probably is good, unlike the tower of horrors in the back.

My daughter and I arrived separately as we traveled to take a cruise on the Pride of America. It was a perfectly adequate room on the first night, then a small suite on our return stay. The market was small and we never did make it to the coffee bar. The lounge is small, but but adequate. The luggage storage is quite helpful. The concierge is well meaning and is GREAT for restaurant reservations. I'm just REALLY sorry it didn't occur to me the first Friday night we were there to arrange both a luau and catamaran for the return weekend -- we really missed out. The hotel is close enough to the beach that we did happen on the hula dancing Saturday night in the little park area so we didn't miss out completely. If I'd known better, I would have just walked down to the beach that Sunday morning and signed right up. There aren't bathtubs in all the rooms - so be sure to ask for one if you need one (like for bathing the kids).There was a death at a neighboring hotel (26 floor jumper/pushed) so it was challenging making it back in the second day and the front desk clerk said it's not uncommon so be ready to cover the kids' eyesYou just never know what you're going to find on the islands

Not a good property for Marriott. Room had a musty smell and bed was damp. When booking the room, I was quoted one price for the room and charged a higher price upon check in. Doors to the hotel were left open at the end of hall way. Joseph Martin 9240)330-9338

Loved the stay with my groups. They allowed us to use their storage rooms, had great bus parking, clean rooms, terrific staff and service, fast internet, free use of computers, restaurant on site, laundry, nice pool, snack bar, I could go on and on. The area is getting better as well- Kuhio street used to be a bit dodgy but has improved over the years. I would give the place five stars if the hotel has a slightly better location. I still felt safe and liked the smaller restaurants nearby. If you are on a budget then this is the place for you! A shout out to Brent Umehira, the hotel's sales manager, for making our resvervation go so smoothly.

Close to shops and walking distance to everything you need. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are smallish however they are clean and updated. The only negative I found about this hotel is the parking, they charge $39 for valet only which is expensive. I parked on the street most nights which was annoying however I saved a lot of money. I would recommend this hotel, we arrived early and got to check in early. Staff are always ready to help and an iHop across the street!

I spent a week at the Marriott Courtyard in Waikiki while on vacation.The entire staff was welcoming, friendly, and helpful. The public areas of the hotelare lovely with a bar, coffee shop, and market store. A very nice pool and hot tub arealso on the premises. My room was cruise ship small and dated but it was spotlessly clean and had a new large flat screen TV with many channels. The bed was comfortable and I also had a balcony.The location was perfect with many restaurants and stores close by and a short walk to the beach. It was the perfect place for me but I was solo. There were a few drawbacks,the AC was annoying as it blows right over the bed. I shut it off at night. The hot water was iffy but no resort fee and I was in Hawaii.

Go for Raymond. He will take care of you. We were late at checking in and we came to find out our requests weren't made so we asked and Raymond helped us out by clarifying that if we use the Marriot App on our phone sometimes the requests will be late from the app. Anyways, we reserved for 2 rooms and we wanted both rooms to be on the same floor. He squared that away too. He also gave us directions on where to go for shopping and food. Made sure if we needed anything we can just call him or come down to the front desk. Both Raymund and his partner were really helpful and without them we would be having a hard time with hotel info and directions.
user_name:
Monte Carlo R
Ewa Beach, Hawaii

review_body: I'm surprised Marriott allows the Courtyard name on this property. It will make me think twice before assuming that booking a Courtyard gets a certain standard of quality. Old motel-style room (mine had an outside entrance) with low ceilings, a musty smell, and literally the smallest bathroom I have encounted outside of a cruise ship (couldn't turn around in the shower). The noise was unbearable - both the walls and windows are thin and provide literally NO sound insulation. I would have left immediately if it hadn't been so late at night. As it was, I checked out the next morning and found a wonderful Hilton Garden Inn just down the street that was new (and amazing!) for the same price.

We have stayed at this hotel a few times now and its in the perfect location. Its walking distance to the beach, all the shops & restaurants but not right in the middle of the fray. Its location makes it easy to maneuver without a lot of foot traffic.The hotel is older and does have some small rooms but its Hawaii...you will spend most of your time outdoors so no big deal. We love this hotel for many many reasons but we will continue to stay here because of staff and location alone. During our stays...it truly feels like our home away from home.

The hotel has a great location for the price, but if you're expecting the normal 'Courtyard' luxury, it's not here. The rooms were very loud, the bathroom didn't have a fan, and the room was extremely crowded. Having said that, the beds were comfortable (including the pull out couch). The parking was highway robbery pricewise as well. BUT great location and a comfortable stay.

The rooms are comfortable and clean. As a previous guest commented, request a room not facing the busy street. The windows are not double paned, so the noise is noticeable. For the money, it is a good value for Waikiki.

We spent a week in Hawaii and stayed at the Courtyard Waikiki. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki, close to almost everything. It's a leisurely 10 minute walk to Waikiki Beach, and there's shopping and food of all kinds within 5 minutes walk. The staff provided a warm welcome and as a Platinum Marriott member, they recognized my status, which is appreciated. The concierge was helpful and offered information on destinations in the area. The room was clean and welcoming and I was upgraded to a Suite, because of my status. The room service attendants were very nice and always helpful. We did use the Italian restaurant located at the hotel, and it was very good (separate review) Overall the hotel was a great choice. From the convenience of the location to the inviting room, the Courtyard hit a home run.

If you don't plan on spending a lot of time at your hotel this place is affordable by Hawaiian standards. There are no views of the ocean and you are not right near the beach though it is in walking distance. The rooms are small and the appointments are neither Hawaiian feeling or upscale. The pool is fine but seemed to be in shade most of the day, at least while I was around it. The staff is friendly and works hard. Good place to hang your hat and rest your head

Room was small but comfortable. Nothing supplied in kitchen area except microwave. Cleaning supplied us with extra towels and shampoos as we had 4 adults in room. Staff was always friendly. Would recommend this to families.

We stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott for a week for my wedding. We had 18 rooms booked with over 30 guests, and we only had great things to say about the hotel! Brent Umehira, Sales Manager, was fantastic to deal with from the start! He managed all of our queries happily and timely! The Courtyard provided my guests with flexible individual payment prepaid or post stay. The rooms were clean and comfortable, plenty of space for us. The location was super conveniently located with only mins walk to beach and attractions. The buses and shuttles were located just outdoors or around the corner.... And all service staff were super super friendly and helpful at all times!! We would 100% recommend any one of our friends to stay here. They have truly made our first Hawaiian experience and wedding special and extraordinarily memorable.

We booked 4 nights at the Courtyard Waikiki. The price is great for Waikiki and the location is terrific. You are able to walk almost everywhere. But it is clearly a second tier hotel. The room was very small and bare bones (but adequate). It definitely was not up to the standards of other Courtyards I have stayed in. The biggest warning - the hotel has very bad sound proofing and given that this is a resort area you will be kept up at all hours by loud guests. Also none of the room doors are designed for quiet closing and bang at all hours. We also had to leave our room late at night because of a fire alarm ( a guest decide to burn popcorn in their room). Bottom line - you get a great price but you get amenities and a clientele commensurate with the price.

Very comfortable and accommodating! Would highly recommend! Easy to get to from the airport. Friendly staff, nicely decorated. Coffee shop and lots of things to do within walking distance. We enjoyed the grounds and poolside. Thank you for making our trip impressive!

I'm a longtime and loyal Marriott customer and it pains me to be critical of any of their properties. That said, I think it is important for would be visitors to have the proper expectations when visiting.My Visit. It was a short stay with a late arrival made later by a delayed flight. In the end I arrived at the hotel around 1:30 a.m. I called prior to arriving because Waze directed me to Kuhio Street without positioning me at the hotels entrance on Royal Hawaiin Ave. The front desk person who answered the call was helpful in providing from detailed directions. Just be advised that Honolulu has a lot of one way streets so if you are coming from the airport, you may get similar directions, so you will want to turn onto Lewers St, then right on Manukai St then Right onto Royal Hawaiian and look for the Entrance on the right. Upon arrival, I was greeted by a very welcoming and friendly front desk attendant (Jason) who quickly checked me in, acknowledged my Platinum status and provided my welcome amenities and granted me my late check out request. Since it was a short visit, he gave me an abbreviated overview of the hotel and food options but wisely realized I was tired and only hit the major points.Going up to my room, my initial reaction was similar to others, the overall vibe is tired and a throwback to yesteryear. While renovations were recently completely, a major overhaul is still needed! For example, the door to the room seemed to be similar to one found on an exterior facing room but didn't quite close properly, the sliding glass door & windows didn't adequately block street noise (mind you I was on the 17th floor) and the shower head directed the water flow at an angle so that it only hit me from the shoulder and up (and water flow below my shoulder were run off from my body and the shower head couldn't be moved).So despite these issues, I did find the room to be clean and the bed was moderately comfortable. Additionally, what the hotel lacks in its building and rooms, it more than makes up for it with the attitude of its staff. Everyone one of the employees I interacted with were extremely friendly and customer focused. While not directly on the beach, the hotel is located in near a lot of restaurants and shops.So overall, the hotel is tired and dated but clean, the staff is very friendly and accommodating. For Waikiki the price is appropriate and a value if you are on a budget.

This hotel is right on Kuhio and Royal Hawaiian. Location-wise, it's very good. But it's one of the older buildings in Waikiki, and regardless of all the renovations that Marriott made, it has a very big sonority problem. It is very noisy. They upgraded me to a one-bedroom suite because I have the Marriott Gold card but the noise in the room was the same as sleeping on the street itself. I asked to be changed to another, they gave me a double-deluxe room that was on the quieter side, this was not as noisy but still unacceptable for the Marriott brand. The rooms have balconies and you just hope that you don't have a loud-mouth for a neighbor because you can hear the adjoining lanais. I don't recommend this hotel.

Having stayed at Marriott hotels before, I felt it was a safe bet to book this hotel on a recent visit to Hawaii. However we were quickly disappointed as we entered into a lobby with a distinct lack of aloha atmosphere.Our room had mould in the shower and ants near the coffee machine. When we did get our room cleaned it was not done properly with the bed only half made and dust on the headboard. Sleeping proved to be a challenge with a very noisy road below, with the windows not nearly good enough to cancel out the sound. There was also a blue light next to the coffee machine that stayed on continuously and was bright enough to disrupt sleep. As I've mentioned I'm usually a fan of Marriott hotels but having stayed here I would no longer consider Marriott hotels for a holiday.

On the plus side, the staff was friendly and responded enthusiastically and quickly to requests. Check in and out was very fast and my requests were accommodated.On the down side, I was told that this property had been recently renovated. Not having ever stayed here before I wondered where the renovation occurred. The room I was in felt very dated. The paint was peeling in the bathroom and during a rainstorm, water poured out of the AC. The location was very noisy even though my room looked out over a little used courtyard. The workout room had a peculiar odor to it; so bad that my workout scheduled suffered because I couldn't handle the odor. I would stay here again because I'm a longtime Marriott customer but it's not one of Marriott's jewels.

I was checked in by Raymond at the front desk. Every time I came up to the front desk Raymond remembered my name. I have never had that happen at a large hotel. It was very nice and enhanced my week long stay. I also came to him with a request for my co-worker to have a late check out because our flights were leaving late in the day. Her request was denied when she asked. Raymond was able to grant the request for me, perhaps a cross between my hotel rewards status and his willingness to accommodate the customer.I have stayed at his hotel many times for work travel, in the past, and this was one of my best experiences staying there.

Due to Marriott rewards we were upgraded - big room, pool was nice and the location was good. Close to restaurants, easy walking- Wished the front desk staff had been able to give recommendations. Each time we wanted to talk to the concierge - no one was around. We were looking to book tours and it would have been helpful with restaurant reservations. Ended up using trip advisor to find a Pearl Harbor tour.

Don't waste your money at this place, noisy, old deco room and tiny bathroom, I'm a Marriott Gold Member, they even refused to offer me breakfast voucher, and kept arguing with me for the Gold member benefit. $39 per night for valet parking only, wtf, why not robing from bank!!! Never waste your money at this place, go for Marriott Resort or Hilton close by.

I really enjoyed this hotel. Two blocks from the beach and one block away from all the mayhem on Kalakawa Ave. We stayed for 5 nights and were upgraded to a suite in the main tower, which was wonderful. The building is older, but you couldn't really tell due to the recent renovations. Staff was wonderful in every department. Bar was quaint, but got the job done. Food menu also got the job done during the times we didn't feel like venturing out. We almost stayed at the full-service Marriott Resort a few blocks away but were very glad we chose the Courtyard. Room was clean. Bed was comfortable. Having a huge lanai was a plus! It can get a bit noisy, but that is to be expected when you stay at an urban hotel. My only real complaint is that the hot tub wasn't hot enough and the gorgeous pool was way to cold to use. Regardless, I'd definitely recommend and would stay again. They also have a nice limo-SUV/taxi standing by to take you back to the airport for the same rates a taxi would charge. It was a great way to end our trip.

I'm really enjoying my stay here at Marriott's Courtyard. I've stayed in many locations in Waikiki/Honolulu and this is my favorite. There are many types of restaurants nearby whether it's IHOP or Tanaka of Tokyo, you will find all styles of food and price points. The shops and services are nearby, so I just had a short walk to the P.O. And on the way back picked up my souvenirs for home. After spending time in Maui and Kauai where I enjoyed the Aloha spirit, being back in the center of this city was fun. The room is nice and very comfortable, the price is reasonable here and there are NO resort fees. I found the staff to be professional and helpful all the time. I highly recommend this hotel for its value and location!
user_name:
valeriem543
New York City, New York

review_body: Staff are friendly, welcoming and very helpful.Location is good, waikiki beach is within easy walking distance.Lots of Resturants close by.Rooms are clean and very comfortable.Breakfast is included and is a help yourself buffet continental.
user_name:
Amanda C
Biggin Hill, England, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed here on the last night since it was a few blocks from the beach and not far from the airport (we had been staying on the North Shore) and we could save a few bucks. The room itself was fine - a junior suite with separate bedroom was nice - comfortable bed - huge closest. Bathroom was SUPER small (the closest was bigger) - but it worked fine, clean - no problem. The view wasn't great - like staying in a big city, but not a big deal for what we needed/expected. Coffee shop was nice. Service was very good - desk staff very helpful. Business center computers were super slow - took 25 min to print boarding passes - but at least it was free. Overall good experience.

We celebrated my husband's 50th birthday in Waikiki and Brent and the whole Courtyard crew made it so great for us. We were a group of 26 people so it was a big group... And everyone from Brent, to concierge, to the front desk, to valet... What a great team... also the are close and convenient to everything... Great price... over all 5++++

I was a little hesitate after reading the reviews, the rooms do tend to be on the small side and the shower is as well but they make up for this in customer service. We were pleasantly surprised how nice EVERYONE was. We stayed 2 days before our cruise and 1 day after. The desk clerk name Suki was great when we came in for our last day after the cruise. We were tired having just gotten off the ship and arrived at the Hotel about 10.30am know that we probably could't check in till at least 3ish, so just for the heck of it I thought I would ask for an early check in if possible. Suki made that happen! She upgraded us to a suite and let us check in by 11.00am, we were very thankful for that. She provided great customer service as did Jason when we checked in the first time. The hotel is in a perfect location, close to everything. I would stay here again and recommend it.

First, Marriott Courtyard is usually my hotel of choice for business travel. This hotel appears to be a rehab of something else. However, the workmanship is mediocre. The lobby bartenders are extremely accommodating. I ate there two nights (food served by the restaurant) and it was good. The lobby is open air and pleasant. Be aware the hotel is not close to the beach.There is a shortage of parking. So valet parking is required. My primary problem is with the rooms. My room was very small and the bathroom was extremely small. I checked the floor map in the room and it appeared that all rooms on my floor were the same size. I requested a king size bed and was given a queen size. The room was not large enough to hold a king size. Even two people who know each other intimately would find this room too small. The room smelled and the air conditioner could not control the humidity. There was mold in the bathroom shower. On two of the three days I was there I had to ask that my room be cleaned when it had not been done by 5 p.m.The above situation is definitely not consistent with Marriott Courtyard quality that I usually experience.

After reading some of the negative reviews, I was expecting a terrible experience. It was not that bad.The good: based on reviews, we requested a room that faced the pool. We were on the 12th floor, on the corner. You could see the ocean, and a great view of the mountain. It's a city, you're going to hear noise. It was not excessive. Location is decent, easy walk to the beach and places to eat. It was a 15 minute walk to the convention center. Lobby, room, and pool all clean. Our room size was pretty average, same with the bathroom.The not so good: Started off with waiting over an hour for our bags to be delivered from their locker. The outlet in the bathroom did not work. The toilet paper holder fell off the wall with each use. Shower was average, but being on the corner, we did have a window which made it brighter. Hot tub could have been hotter, and the on-button was very finicky. All little things, but did show a lack of attention to details.

I am a big Marriott fan and have stayed at many properties. This property has a great location, great additional services, but needs serious updating, from carpet, to lamps, to paint, I suggest closing down a floor at a time and refresh.

We booked this hotel because of its proximity to convention center compared to the Waikiki Marriott resort. When we arrived, we were told that we were eligible for an upgrade because of our point status but that the hotel was full so they couldn't give us one. This would normally not have bothered us at all but... there are no bathtubs in regular rooms only upgraded ones and as stated in other reviews, the rooms are VERY small. There is no real place to put your luggage away and two people can't really be in the bathroom at the same time.If you are sensitive to sound at all I would not recommend this hotel. Other reviews have said the walls are thin and that proved to be true for us as well. The man next door was a loud talker (not shouting but every word could be heard) as well as any drawer opening, etc. There was a wind storm one night that howled around us so that it felt like we might end up in Oz any time.Housekeeping was careless. They forgot to replenish coffee, they left cleaning supplies in the room. They poured leftover coffee in the toilet and spilled coffee on the toilet seat and didn't clean it up. It also looked like they had used our washcloth to wipe up coffee and then hung the coffee stained washcloth with the other towel. Not very impressive. That said, if you just want a place to put your stuff while you go to the beach, It is about a 1/2 mile walk to the beach and the bar has a pretty busy happy hour. There are great restaurants walking distance and tons of shopping near by.

We've stayed here before but were not in the main building and the room was larger. This time we weren't so lucky. This room is like a shoe box. Hardly room for our suitcases and no luggage stand (because there's no room for one) I barely slept last night because the bed is beyond AWFUL! I hurt this morning. Bathroom is tiny with no vanity space at all. If you have other options don't be fooled by the Marriott name. While I will, I don't like giving bad reviews so I'll finish with some positives. You would be within walking distance to excellent shopping and all manner of dining choices from McDonalds to very fine dining including the newly re-opened International Market Place. You also would be within walking distance to Waikiki Beach. The check in staff was pleasant. The valet, although $39 (plus tax) a night, is pricey but the service is outstanding. The room was clean. We get points at least for staying here. We are only here for 3 nights. I might have to seek out a chiropractor or acupuncturist by that time though.

This is an older property, but very well maintained. My room had a nice balcony overlooking the pool - it was a smaller room, but comparative with Honolulu. The staff were very pleasant, and I slept soundly. Plenty of food and drinks within 5 minutes or less. I would stay here again on another business layover.

As a Marriott member I have to say this was one of the biggest disappointments of a hotel in the portfolio I have stayed in. We stayed for one night since the cost was a bit lower than the larger Marriott on the beach. However our flight was canceled and the airline put us up at the larger Marriott the following night so I have the opportunity to compare. Even before staying at the larger facility I noticed off the bat these rooms are teeeny tiny. Understand it's a city hotel but never have I stayed in that small of a room.
