In addition walks are paper thin and could hear word for word for neighbors conversations which didn't add up to a good nights sleep. I'd also note getting to the entrance is a pain both Google and wake kept taking us to the front door which not where you enter, we drove around in circles a few times. I will say it was very clean, in walking distance to everything and staff was friendly. However for a few bucks more go to the larger Marriott. MUCH larger well kept and quiet rooms, much better service and in the middle of the action.

Conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki. It is a walking distance to the beach, shops, restaurants and nightlife. Friendly and professional staff including the parking attendants. The check in process was stress free. I used the mobile app to check in so the have the keys and room ready for me upon arrival. The front desk staff was helpful. Suki - with her warm smile and acknowledge my Platinum Elite status. I was upgraded to a Suite with a Queen Size bed. I asked if they have the same room category and size with a King Size bed instead and was able to accomodate me. Room was huge and definitely a big improvements from the last time I was here. I guess the renovations paid off. The living room area was big enough to accomodate a family of four. Minimal but modern and chic furnishings. The big noticeable improments is the bathroom. Its large and bright. King size bed was comfortable. Wifi worked well. Very clean. The housekeeping staff attention to details was excellent. The only negative is that my room and balcony facing the busy Kuhio Avenue and it does gets noisy but it didnt bother me as much. Overall, I am very satisfied with my hotel stay and will definitely stay here again.

This hotel has the smallest bathrooms that I have ever seen other than in Japan... or on an airplane. You can outstretch your arms and touch both walls. The shower is the size of a phonebooth. Tiny. The bedroom is also on the small size. Nicely updated and clean. Air conditioning never felt cool enough. Pillows were flimsy. I had a nice balcony overlooking the street. The street was very noisy. However, the local bus to the airport and other buses stop directly in front. Sure, it's noisy, but very convenient. Bus to airport is $2.50 and takes about an hour. Sure better than $40 a day for valet parking. An easy walk to shopping and beach.Staff were friendly and willing to help. One recommended Maguro Brothers for poke. It is located directly behind the hotel. Highly recommend grabbing dinner there!

My boyfriend and I came here for our two year anniversary. We were very pleased with our stay. We were only here for a couple of days but it was great for us. A little small for the price but the decor was cute and the room was very clean.

I stayed at the Courtyard for a total of 3 nights. The staff were prompt, courteous, and friendly. The night bartender was amazing. The hotel is pretty current with a nice pool. It's location was ideal for walking to the beach and access to plenty of food and shopping. My room was spacious with a nice balcony overlooking the pool. My biggest concern was that each day during my stay I saw roaches each day. I contacted the front desk and they said they would spray. On the second night of my trip the air conditioner started to leak but it didn't last long and nothing was damaged. Seeing the roaches made it hard for me to sleep for fear that I would wake up with them on me or in my suitcase etc. If the Courtyard gets a great exterminator there is no reason I wouldn't be able to give a higher rating. Also, nothing was done after I contacted the front dress to address my concerns. "I'm sorry" was all I received.

Nicely situated in the middle. 10 minute walk to beaches or shopping, several blocks to zoo. Friendly helpful staff. Ihop and Mcdonalds across the street, other restaurants nearby. Friday fireworks on the beach. Pool is shady a large part of the day- nice break from the sun. Hotel itself was clean and quiet. City noises if windows were open, muted if closed, not sleep disturbing. Our "elite" room was on the small side with minimal furniture, but certainly adequate and comfortable. Bring an electrical outlet splitter for charging devices as outlets are few. Closet is small, 4 bureau drawers. Maybe other rooms had more, we didn't need more.

While attending a yearly dental conference, I stayed at this facility last week, Tuesday-Friday. I booked this hotel because of its proximity to convention center compared to the Waikiki Marriott resort which I highly recommend. In addition, the $166 daily rate was great and the pics look good on line. If you are looking at this property I'm sure you agree the pics look really nice. Well, upon checking-in, I asked the front desk person about a possible up-grade as a platinum member. The young clerk responded, we have up graded you two tiers to a nicer room. When I got to my room, the room was probably 325 square feet if not smaller and very old looking. Iron didn't work!! If this was an upgrade, don't expect much from a regular room. That night the air conditioner didn't work too well and my room was pretty muggy. Luckily the following day I got an real upgrade to a one bedroom suite. Enough about the rooms and let tell you more about the hotel... The bar is pretty small but appealing and the drink prices are resonable especially during happy hour. Don't expect much from the pool. Didn't seem like it got much sun because it's covered by hotel shadows from each tower and very old in appearance. As far as restaurants, there is a coffe bean and an Italian place. I had lunch at the Italian place and don't expect much 1-10 I give it a 7 based on my experience. I recommend the Siam palace (Thai restaurant) across st. Happy hour check out the sky tower in Waikiki. Great music, food and the mai tais are incredible and different to how we know them. All that said, if you are there for business like me, the price made the experience bearable. If you are on vacation, I recommend a different properly because of pool, room size and lack of hotel amenities. Hope this helps!

I stayed here in May when my grandmother was sick. It was a last minute trip, and I was able to get a decent rate for a double queen room. The hotel is nice and it's in a decent location. My only issue with it was that I was in an area of the hotel where there were only stairs to my room, so dealing with luggage wasn't fun. I know I could have waited for them to bring my bags for me, but I was pressed for time. Also it was a low floor, so there was a lot of outside noise and no view - not that I was there much. I would stay here again as it is affordable compared to most Waikiki hotels. But it's nothing to rave about. If you're just looking for a place to lay your head and plan to spend most of your time elsewhere, it's definitely a solid choice.

Very small queen room, with little room to move around. The so-called queen size belt seemed more like a full size bed. No luggage rack in the room and not much room for one. Small closet, probably less than two feet wide. Not much drawer space either. Carpeting is very tired. The room and doors had been painted, but you could clearly see old damage under the paint. The shower didn't have much room to move in. The shower head down-pipe should have been angled to better spray you. As it is, you are in a tight corner against the wall trying to get wet! Parking prices (at the time) not properly displayed on the website. Almost $40.00 a day to park! I guess that is normal for the area.NOT part of my review, as it is not the hotels fault, (though they could mention it on their website, or insulate better....) but at every chance the locals get, the are setting off fireworks. Until all hours of the night. And the street noise from the cars and especially the motorcycles gets to be a bit much at 2:00 AM!I wish I had brought some ear plugs!

We had a corner room on the 15th floor with a partial ocean view. Since we were about 6 blocks from the ocean, the view included many of the other buildings. The location was good as we were able to walk to most of the places we wanted to see. It is also has a bus stop in front, and a tour we went on picked up across the street.The staff were friendly and helpful. Pool area is pretty with a waterfall. Even though we were on the 15th floor, we could hear the traffic on Kuhio Ave., including a street sweeper and buses early in the morning. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. The bathroom light switch is in a weird place and the shower was small, had a weird shape and no light in the shower. The shower drain had a screw that was sticking out a bit. I mentioned it to the front desk and it was fixed immediately. The safe didn't work, and the front desk said it was probably a battery, but we didn't bother to get it fixed. There was a coffee shop and restaurant in the building. We went to the restaurant for breakfast and supper one day. For breakfast one morning, we ate at an IHOP (International House of Pancakes) which is across the street. Most mornings however, we grabbed something at the ABC which is also across the street.

Great staff, nice and clean room; a little walk to the beach; good food all around; have to try the Musubi and Bento express on Seaside across from Ross; will recommend; there is a nice Taco place and a Vietnamese restaurant; shaved one block towards the ocean - amazing;

All of the staff members were super helpful, kind, and understanding. The hotel itself was in a great location with just a short walk to the beach, and several restaurants nearby. The pool, hot tub, and 24-hour fitness center were great to have, and everything was nice and clean.

Pros- Clean Common areas were nice. Easy walk from here to all Waikiki sites. Staff was helpful. Cons- small rooms. Small beds. No storage space for our luggage. Valet fee was high. In hind sight we didn't need a car for our stay. Booked for price. Wont likely do so again.

This was my second visit to Waikiki Courtyard and it was perfect for my needs. The rooms are newly decorated and are quite cheerful. The hotel is convenient to everything -- restaurants, shopping, the beach. The front desk and valet staff could not have been more helpful. I'll be back!

My husband and I were staying on Kauai for the majority of our Hawaiian getaway, but decided we wanted include a day of shopping and dining over on Oahu! With our one day/night package, we chose to stay at the Courtyard Waikiki Beach. The property's pictures looked nice, the accessibility to Waikiki's amenities was great, and the price per night seemed reasonable......until it came to us actually checking in.Before we get into some of the areas that weren't all that spectacular about this property, I'd like to begin with the positives. First and foremost, you're on vacation in Hawaii! Life is pretty darn good if these words are coming out of your mouth! Anyway, you'll love the location of this hotel! It's within walking distance of everything Waikiki has to offer.The staff was very friendly and the lobby had a clean and updated look to it! And while we didn't use it, there is a small heated salt water pool (which I thought was very unique).Now, for the more challenging aspects of the property...... while the actual hotel itself is easy to locate, the accessibility to get your car parked to check in is not practical at all. In fact, if you're driving your own car, prepare to take a unique route just to get down the one way street that leads up to the parking area itself. In addition, please note that when you check in, you must leave your car parked in the designated area near valet until you've completed the entire check in process. Once you've received your room key, you will then meet up with the valet staff who will park your vehicle for you. It is important to note that there is no self parking and you must pay the $40 a day to have valet park your vehicle. While we completely understand that space is a premium in Hawaii, we literally had to have our jaws picked up off the floor when they told us what the daily valet fee was. The final fee that we nearly incurred was the Early Check In Fee. Should you wish to check in before 3:00 p.m., they will charge you $25.00.The room itself was fine. It's not really worth a complaint or a praise. However, you should know it gets very "lively" and loud at night in the Waikiki area. Neither my husband or I slept that well due to the sirens, car alarms, slamming doors, and screaming people that seemed to stay active throughout the night. Of course this isn't the actual property's fault, but if you're looking for a quiet getaway to Hawaii, Waikiki is probably not the best choice (as this goes for any hotel in the area).All in all, we love Oahu and the Waikiki experience! However, if we would have stayed at this particular property and had to pay $40 a night for valet for 10 days, we would have croaked. Just know that if you're staying at a resort in Hawaii (any island for that matter), you're more than likely going to pay a parking fee. However, we've never incurred anything this high.

My first trip to Hawaii for a conference and I enjoyed my stay here at the Courtyard Waikiki Beach. Even prior to my trip I called for several different reasons and Tatiana was always available to assist me. Upon my arrival I was greeted kindly. The location was walking distance to basically everything, especially shopping. One night while going out I thought I needed a taxi and the valet guys began to call one for me until I realized I could walk. Oh cant forget I received a beautiful lei necklace from the front desk. The hotel staff are friendly and respectful, The room was comfortable and very well cleaned. Even after I departed the hotel and arrived back home I needed assistance with my invoice (no incorrect charges) Heidy, the GM was able to assist me without a second thought. I am truly grateful for the wonderful service received at Courtyard Waikiki and will definitely return.

We chose to stay at the Courtyard by Marriott Waikiki based on its proximity to shops, restaurants, public transport without having to pay a premium for hotels closer to the beach. We arrived around 11am and was offered a "Loft room" in one of their adjacent buildings as it was the only one available at the time. The front desk clerk did mention that there were stairs but that the room would be slightly larger than the equivalent rooms in their main tower. What we didn't realise is that there would be 3 flights of stairs! The loft rooms themselves are adequate but very dark during the day and noisy most nights as there was a bar close by on the adjacent street. Given that we intended to spend most of our time outside of the hotel room, we weren't too bothered except for the fact that the hot water took an extremely long time to kick in, making showers frustratingly long or unbearably cold. We didn't want to kick up too much of a fuss initially as we suspected it might be due to over usage, but after 3 nights of very cold showers, we requested a room change. The hotel was apologetic and moved us to a room in the main tower which was much nicer, lighter and with hot water! We found that the concierge was extremely busy and with only one person manning the desk, we spent a lot of time waiting to be served. When we did reach the front of the line however, they provided top notch service. Brent in particular was amazing considering the pressure of a growing line waiting for his services. He very patient, helpful and thorough. Other staff that provided excellent service: Jodi at the front desk who was very accommodating of our room change request, and Kalin at the Valet/Bell Services who was very friendly and helpful too.We would recommend this hotel based on convenience and cost, but would specifically request a room in the main tower on a higher floor facing the pool the next time. (the road is quite busy and noisy, even in the main tower)

Overall I had a good experience at the Courtyard Waikiki Beach. It's close to some amazing restaurants, shopping, and Waikiki Beach. The lobby is nice but there is no formal breakfast service. Bar has a limited food menu. The walls are thin, expect some noise from adjacent rooms and elevators. Rooms seem like they were renovated within the past 5 years. The problem and why I'm scoring so poorly is that the rooms are not secure. A little pressure on the room door handle and it pops right open without the use of a keycard. Anyone from the street can access the elevator and rooms and any level! Two days after this issue (which was corrected by the on-site engineer) the housekeeping service had left my door wedged open during cleaning and never pushed the latch back in. So my room was completely open to anyone, probably for hours.

I'm typing this from the balcony of my room on the 15th floor (OK the 14th floor, because they omitted the 13th). It's the fourth night of my four-night stay -- a solo trip to see family. It's my second time in Waikiki.Would I stay again? Maybe, if traveling solo and I got a good rate that couldn't be matched by surrounding properties. The room is pretty small, which is fine for a solo traveler. For a couple or a family, it definitely could get crowded. That's factor.I had just a basic room ... and knew that when booking. Still, offering a microwave in addition to the refrigerator would be nice.However, the location is pretty much ideal for the price. No, it's not on the beach, and for the price you're paying you shouldn't expect it to be on the beach. Don't be fooled by the hotel's name. But the beach is plenty close, and the more tranquil Ala Wai, while not a tourist draw, is even closer and is a great spot for runners and walkers.The hotel has been recently updated and it shows. The room was super-clean, the lobby was nicely done, the pool was good, and the fitness area a bit above average for this sort of property. All five stars in that department.The biggest drawback of this property and location is the street noise. Garbage trucks, buses, and emergency vehicles remind you this is a crowded urban space and far from a beachfront paradise. That, and the small room size, are about the only negatives.It's important to keep in mind that Waikiki is a tourist trap teeming with people who are willing to be ensnared by a trap that just happens to be steps from a pretty dang awesome beach. The Courtyard is right in the middle of it, which has positives and negatives ... but the positives outweigh the negatives.

I was very satisfied with my stay at Courtyard Waikiki in December. This is part of a top recognized name brand of hotels, and they live up to their reputation with their customer service, room service, and prime location. Some people complain about the noise or the size of the rooms--which, to be fair, are a little smaller or noisier than what some may expect. However, for being in Hawaii, the size is well above average and the noise is quieter than what I would have expected staying in downtown Waikiki. (I spent over 60 nights in hotels in Hawaii in 2016 for business, so I have lots of experiences to compare to.) For a 3 star hotel, I give this property a 5 star rating! Customer service was friendly, accommodating, and fast. Room service was courteous, thorough, and helpful. And the location can't be beat for a business trip (plenty of surrounding restaurants, beach is not too far to go relax, and H1 is close by). I'll be asking my company to let me stay here again on my next trip to Hawaii. 5 stars all around.

This hotel is central to your shopping needs and only a few blocks from beautiful Waikiki Beach. The lobby is gorgeous and state of the art. The rooms a small, but modern and clean. The on-site bar is an added bonus.

We stayed here one night prior to getting into our time share. It happened to be Halloween. We were awakened all night by Hallow-Weeners reveling in the streets. There appears to be little if any insulation in the walls, and windows are single paned. So glad I did not have a weeks stay at this facility. Rooms are very small, but clean. Absolutely nothing special about this Courtyard aside from location (which is pretty good for shopping & restaurants). Parking is pricey - but it is HI.

Unfortunately I stayed with family at this dirtiest property. There was a poorly patched hole in the bathroom, carpets were dirty, fire alarm went off 10 minutes after we checked in, pull out sofa was very old and hurt the back, pool water was freezing cold and the valet charging $39.00 just rudely hands the key and asks you to grab your own car. This was our Christmas Eve nightmare at this horrible property. The low floor I was "upgraded" to as a Marriott Platinum member was very noisy with traffic outside.Tweeted our experience in private message to Marriott rewards who then pointed me to Heidy (Front Desk Manager). Amazingly her response was that this is not really a Marriott property. Marriott took over five years ago and we are slowly converting it. She said the safe was pushed too far back causing the hole in the wall when they installed it, carpet has nail polish and she said when we have budget we will replace the pull out beds. WOWThis hotel is a shame to Marriott name and is not up to Marriott standards. Very disappointed with the property and the management response. She offered me 5000 Marriott points which I refused. They need to refund you or charge a Motel 6 rate - not a Marriott rate. They shouldn't be charging for Valet when there was no valet - they just hand you the key and ask you to grab the car. I asked Heidy for GMs email but haven't heard back yet. Shame on you guysWish I could give them less than 1 point - its beyond terrible. Will NEVER recommend it to anyone.
user_name:
RajT468
New York City, New York

review_body: If you are not travelling alone, try to book a deluxe room at minimum as the standard rooms are very small for two people. The property is a bit old and the remodeling was poorly executed with no attention to details. Some people complain about the noise but this is Waikiki and its busy day and night so if you want to experience serenity you need to be on another part of the island. Staff is great and always willing to do everything so you have a pleasant stay. That being said, this is hotel is a great value.

My husband and I started our honeymoon off at the Courtyard at Waikiki Beach. I picked this place because it seemed central but not crazy expensive. We knew we wanted to rent a car and travel around the island so no point in spending lots on a hotel just to sleep. The staff was really friendly when we arrived and presented us with beautiful Lei's ( I did call ahead and tell them it was our honeymoon). They even upgraded us to a suite which was wonderful and like clock work saw a rainbow on our balcony every day. The location was super close to everything. Just a few blocks from the main strip. The happy hour was good and the pool nice (however it seems like there is a forever wind going through the property - we went in September. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want to be central without the expense!

Yes this hotel is surrounded by noisy streets. But you cant avoid sound by just getting a higher room. The rooms are smalls: my headboard was on the other side of the next room's TV. Had to listen to a tennis match; couldn't sleep until they were done. We were here during the Holidays. We have to wait 45 mins for our room, even though we had reservations. While waiting I saw two couples being told that their suite wasn't available because they were letting the people who were already there, stay longer.

We enjoyed our stay here, as the Marriott Courtyard is rather informal yet offers all the amenities needed. The location is ideal, parking available and the surrounding shops and restaurants offer good options in the close vicinity. Do make sure to rent your car on a later day if you do not really need it while staying in Waikiki, as parking is rather expensive (also at the Courtyard).

I had high hopes for this property, and used a Category 8 hotel package to stay here. I'm Platinum Premier with Marriott by the way. Have to say I was disappointed in the hotel. Staff was great, but the room itself leaves much to be desired. Tiny room with a tiny, claustrophobic shower. Remodel of the room was nice, but the sliding doors were not replaced, and must have been at least 50 years old. Even though we were on the 14th floor, our room faced Kuhio Avenue, and the noise from the street was easily heard through the poorly insulated sliders. Usually I am not bothered by noise, but it took some time to get to sleep with all the buses running past, not to mention the other loud sounds coming from below. Here's my summary of the Courtyard Waikiki:Pros:Great, attentive staffNice remodel of roomsSmall but clean poolExcellent locationCons:Loud....way too loudOld sliding doors really need replacingSmall rooms with very tight shower (much wasted space in the bathroom)Try other places in Waikiki, like the Hyatt Centric.

When you first enter this hotel, everything seems to be on par with what you would typically expect in a Marriott. Once you get to the room, it starts to go down hill. The room was clean, but very small for a single queen. The few feet on either sides of the bed made for a rather stuffy atmosphere. The internet wifi with an upgrade was incredibly slow. It was almost impossible to watch netflix, little alone youtube, on the wifi. We also had an issue with the lock on our door being broken when we first arrived. The door had to be slammed shut to ensure that the door was locked upon entering or leaving, the issue was quickly resolved by the staff.

I stayed here a week and struggled with wifi the entire stay. Have stayed here previously with the same wifi experience. It's hard to complain about much while in Hawaii, but it's difficult if you're also here for work, like I was, and need internet connectivity. Being a brand which tries to cater to the business traveler, wifi connectivity is a basic necessity - which falls short at this hotel. Otherwise, it's in a great location close to Waikiki beach and the staff is very hospitable. Please fix your wifi issues!
user_name:
Dc2011dc
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel was clean. The location is good. Can walk to the beach. Shops nearby to grab anything you need. Center of Waikiki. Access to Pearl Harbor, downtown Honolulu and beach is great. Restaurant on site is mediocre but works if you need a meal and don't want to go far. The Thai Restaurant across the street is good. The street noise is horrendous. They put me in a room over the front door and even though that door is locked at 9pm, the noise on the street continued most days until 4am. Fountain ran most of the night also. Heard water running while trying to fall asleep.I was here on business. No desk or table in room. Had to work with laptop in bed. Too hard on my back. Room was clean. Shower was extremely small. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Concierge was great as was the front desk help. Stored my lugguge last day safely for the full day before flying out.

The courtyard bills itself as being on Royal Hawaiian Avenue. But it is really on Kuhio Avenue – a very busy street that used to be full of older mom and pop hotels. So it is right on the bus line and a convenient location To stay. The hotel essentially is a renovation of an older building that was just completed in 2016. So The insides are brand-new, but the outsides are the same. So the hotel itself is a little strange as the older outside and the new inside Clash a little. And there is still a small punch list of little things that need to be tweaked – like our towel bar came off and needed to be screwed back in. And our first room did have a musty smell and we ended up switching rooms -- which was fine.But if you don't care about the disconnect between the outside look and inside look, this hotel is a good option, though i still prefer the Hyatt place down the street.Though the hotel is right on Kuhio Street, those doors have been closed and you enter via the side Royal Hawaiian Avenue. This means you should as for a room overlooking the pool if you want to avoid the Kuhio St traffic noise. They have updated the pool area very nicely and there is valet parking available. We did manage to find Street parking nearby for free, but plan on paying for parking during busy times. The staff was very friendly and even remembered our names. There is the usual courtyard amenities, including a pool, fitness center, restaurant, casual café, tour and massage services. Security was good with guards ensuring non-guests didn't go up to guests floors. All in all, this is a fine place to stay -- especially with new construction (nordstrom rack, etc) which brings more shops in the area.

I tend to stay away from Courtyard hotels as them offer the least benefits for Marriott rewards members but my experience at the Marriott Courtyard Waikiki was poor, really poor. First the good; rooms were remodeled and nicely decorated. We decided on the one room suite, corner room. Now the bad .... I do not recommend the corner room in the second building. Our corner room looked out upon another hotel through the one window and at an empty lot through the second window. You do NOT get an Ocean view. Our room had the smallest shower door I have ever seen. I'm not sure why but it wad maybe 24 in across. Check out or pick. The bathroom was small. Heck the walk in closet was twice the size of the bathroom. We originally booked the room for four nights but we checked out after only one night.

This is an older Courtyard, but centrally located in Waikiki. The rooms are decent. We stayed in a room (#708) with a king bead and sofabed. I found it odd how low on the wall the outlets were... Could have previously been a handicapped room. It's a downtown area, so the noise was about as expected.The staff were all very courteous and helpful. The outside area/courtyard by the pool is nice. If I could give the hotel a 3.5 rating, I would. It's a little better than good, but not 4 or 5 star worthy.

I've read some unfair reviews of Courtyard Marriott on here, so would like to pass my opinion to all that are considering staying here. - very clean rooms and hotel grounds. - comfortable rooms, perfect for the 2 of us (We're in a deluxe room, queen bed) - very comfy bed and pillows - shower is super small, but fine! Good water pressure - well located - easy walk to beach and main strip, and 'the bus' stop near by for everything else - exceptionally friendly staff- We are staying here over Christmas / New Years so yes it is pricey, but so is everywhere in Waikiki !!! I feel what we paid is reasonable. - absolutely no cockroaches (like a previous post suggested !!) - a little noisy, our room is near the elevator but is so fine, hasn't caused us any problems at all. -elevator works fine and is usually very quick, obviously depending on who is waiting below or above you !! - has a wall aircon unit which works a treat. - balcony is teeny tiny, just big enough for 2 chairs and a table. (We didn't spend any time out there) - plunge pool in the second tower is private and well sized, main pool is great with a cute waterfall for little ones to play under, but let's be honest it's all about Waikiki beach if you wanna swim !!this is great value, comfortable, simple and well located stay that I'd recommend to anyone staying in Waikiki!!

It's a very comfortable and clean hotel in the center of Waikiki. There are a lot of shops all around where you can find and buy all you need. Rooms are renovated and big enough. You can also find a market place inside of the hotel and some shops, plus a gym and swimming pools.

We had a corner suite across the pool from the main hotel building. Great location; quiet and close to the beach, shops and restaurants; friendly staff; clean and comfortable (although a previous guest had left a pair of underpants on a shelf).Two calls to maintenance on the first day (blind fell and door wouldn't lock); quickly dealt with by friendly staff and no subsequent issues over a week's stay.Pool is not as good as the pictures it's basically in the car-park; a second warm brine pool is very pleasant.Don't bother with the breakfast deal - in return for an increased rate 2 vouchers worth $12 each are provided for breakfast each morning in the Spada restaurant on site. Breakfast was adequate at best and we struggled to spend the vouchers (received 14 still have 8). My feeling is the room rates generally in Waikiki at this time of year are quite expensive but this hotel was still expensive when compared to its peers.

Yes, it's a few blocks off of the beach and accordingly cheaper, but buyer beware! The location generates a lot of noise from traffic, the homeless people yelling and screaming all night long, thumpers driving by at all hours, and every night I was there a car alarm went off in the middle of the night. I had them switch me to the other building away from the main street but it didn't help. The short of it, pay a few bucks more and go somewhere else if you want a pleasurable trip to Waikiki.

When we got back to the hotel room at night of our second day at the hotel, my friend went to the bathroom to take a shower, she witnessed 4 cockroaches running all over our bathroom. We immediately called the front desk to have someone take care of the situation as it seemed very serious. After waiting for 30 minutes, all we got is that someone was on the way. Hotel offered to move us to another room at the same category... wow... exciting....huh?Waiting for another 10 minute or so, I made a call to the customer service to discuss the situation and formally submit a claim. During the call, we witnessed another cockroach moving around our room. At this moment, we had no choice but to ask the customer service that we need to move out of the building, look for neighboring hotels within Marriott chain to relocate. Long story short, we only found a Marriott resort at about 50min away from Waikiki as it was Christmas, the occupancy was very high everywhere in Hawaii. Got a ridiculously expensive rate due to the same reason, but later on was told from Courtyard that they will only refund the missing stays but cannot pay in full amount. The other 50 min away Marriott facility offerred us to only charge us one night as it was almost 3 am when we arrived at the facility. What Courtyard is basically doing is that they just threw us out for the 2 nights not caring where to stay....I don't think I am being unreasonable to ask them to simply take the full payment which I paid for Courtyard and take care of the other room which we only got charged for one night. In monetary value, it all come down to roughly $200 difference....I cannot believe with such a circumstances and all the hassle we went through, they are offering this and call them customer service....

Frankly, this building should never have been allowed to be converted to a Courtyard. Room size is far smaller than Courtyard standard, and bathrooms are laughably small, with shower heads at about 5 feet, 10 inches off the minuscule shower pan.Check-in is generally good, but beware the staff and their "we're upgrading you!" spiel. In this building, "upgrades" can often get you a SMALLER room, such as the xx19 rooms. These rooms, while at the end of the building, have even more reduced square footage because a service elevator cuts into a corner. I would be surprised if xx19 rooms are any larger than 140 square feet total.Decor has been refreshed and the rooms are generally clean - and why not, it can't possibly take more than 10 minutes to clean them! - with reasonably large TVs and channel selection. But the sliding doors to the balconies remain single pane, meaning traffic noise, and there is no such thing as an "ocean view" at this property - you're either looking at the canal (even numbered rooms) or at Kuhio Avenue and the Ohana hotel directly across the street (odd numbered rooms).Consider this if you're a single traveler, less than 6 feet tall, and if the hotel is below $200 when the other options are significantly above $200. And then be prepared to live in Tiny Hotel for your stay.

Very polite but at the same time professional service at the front desk. All the ladies were very well trained and with know-how. Hotel itself is an old building and that is 3*** to me so I saw much worse quality, not to say Courtyard is bad, It is just Courtyard hotel so do not expect much. Rooms were renovated to quite high standard and bed was quite knew as well, sheets smell good, something which was a nice surprise. Short walk from the Waikiki Beach, good location, lots of places to have a quick grab to eat. Still Waikiki is not my kind of place, I prefer Kauai, Big Island since life there is slow. Oh, on weekends you can get quite a loud noise from passers by, but there is not much hotel can do about that. Rooms have no toothbrush, but has shampoo, soap and towels.

If you like to hear motorcycles, trucks and sirens all night this is the place for you. Very dated rooms. Our suite was right on the road and never quiet. Not representative of any Marriott property I have ever been to...disappointing. Go somewhere else. Safe did not work on arrival.

I was going through my wallet this morning and I found this hotel address card. That took me back to 2 years ago, the night I arrived the hotel with my wife who's 8 months pregnant and my 2 and half year old son after an 11 hours flight from BJ, I couldn't find my booked room from an online travel service which I already paid in full. Later I found out I made a mistake by booking the check in date 1 month earlier.At the front dest, Nara ( I believe that was her name) and Heidy was like angels who helped me spending 2 hours going back and forth with the travel service to get things resolved. Throughout the 2 hours, they have been very helpful and care. I was so thankful for all the things that they have done for me and my family. They save my trip! I would also like to take this opportunity to congrats the hotel management for having such a wonderful team! They are the stars!This is a Hotel that I will definitely come back and stay next time I am in Honolulu. I want to say thank you again to Nara and Heidy!

Waikiki, let´s face it, is a tourist trap! It was nice in the 30ies, 40ies, 50ies, now it lives from its reputation from older times. So does this Hotel, amongst others I´ve been to in Waikiki! When I checked in, rooms were not available in the main building, where reception and elevators right behind it are. The building across the parking lot is not far to walk, but old, run-down and 8 stories high. Its windows are aluminum, and have not seen rubber insulation in centuries, if any at all. The noise in a room on second floor was just awful, very loud and nasty. So it would have been on 8th floor too, a lady told me who was in one of them. After a day I had to move to the main building! Which was organized by reception, after they finally noticed and acknowledged my complaint! Room on 17th floor #1710 actually, a bit smaller than my first room, but nicer, cleaner, better, higher, not so noisy, even though here too, no rubber insulation on windows. In fact, they must have been put in in the 1950ies, and never been changed. So if you expect a noise reduction room, don´t! Once you opened that window, it seems as whole Waikiki population has gotten into your room to party! All in all my stay was okay at Courtyard Marriott. One day a school group arrived and all members were seating on each square foot of the reception hall, amongst their luggage etc. It was loud, noisy, nasty, and the weather outside was rainy. So my mood writing this might have been affected by the bad weather too, but take that away, there is still some points valid in this review. Don´t choose a room in the side building, its rooms are bigger, louder, not so comfy. Also the pool provided in that building is a pool with four concrete walls around it, so if you want to commit suicide while on vacation, this would be the perfect place to do it! Better go to the beach and do it there! Lots of of nicer possibilities to exit this planet! Check in at 3 pm is kind of VERY late. Check out at 12 is hence too early, given the amount of rooms they have. I guess its profit that drives the rules in this place. Oh how I long for the good old days :-)

The front desk at the Courtyard was amazing and always pleasant to talk with. The room was on the small side but had everything a good hotel should have. The bathroom was also small and the shower was tight, but I stand at 6'1". The maids asked if I needed anything any time I passed by. The pool was reasonably sized with a hot tub and a waterfall for the kids to play under. The location was perfect to walk to any of the many sites that Waikiki has to offer. If traveling around the island, prepare for traffic to get to the downtown area which is the only vice, but the parking fee was reasonable and the valet was superb!

Room tidy and good view from balcony of mountains.Staff very helpful and friendly throughout my stay - both at reception, room service and maids, and bar staff.Nice pool and hot tub area that's never too busy.Well equipped gym that's open 24hrs so never gets too crowded and good for fitting a workout in pre or post beach. Beach is 15 mins walk to Waikiki.

We stopped here on our way to and back from a holiday in New Zealand. Our first stay, 2 nights, was good though the room was quite small. We asked for something larger for our return trip which would be 5 nights. This was arranged and on our return we were tol he were in a different building across the car park. This was not the same standard as the main building. It was a two room unit, nicely decorated and clean. We had a problem with the shower which had a very narrow entrance which was also partially blocked by the towel rail. The hallway to the elevator was on the outside if the building, very narrow and most of the time had cleaning trollies parked on it. The only elevator was very slow at times because it was also used by the cleaning staff.Very second best!

We recently spent the weekend, and joined some friends there for happy hour on Friday - excellent food, drinks and service! Our room was not up to par - the entertainment center was badly damaged, the bathroom door was really dusty/dirty, the bathtub had not been cleaned well, the sheet and quilt were stained, and the sliding glass door handle was very rusty. There were about a dozen or more people with coolers that were in the pool and jacuzzi around midnight or later screaming, and it took two calls for the front desk to get someone out there. I lost a night's sleep and when speaking to the manager the next day, she did not respond appropriately to take of this. Very upset, as I do stay at this hotel periodically, and think it may be time to move elsewhere until they change management and complete an update to the rooms.

Very nice Modern Hotel , rooms are great / comfortable Location is excellent From HNL Airport I took the city bus $2.50 took under 30 mins bus stoped right in from of the Hotel :) & return to Airport the same Bus $ 2.50 Will definitely recommend 5 ***** stars will stay again on next trip to Hawaii

This was a return trip after some years so I was interested to see the renovations particularly with the price rise in accomodation. Like last time we booked a 1 brd suite but this one was in the main hotel wing and the layout was much better - ie could go onto the balcony from the sitting area without going through the bedroom. much better when you have someone who wants to sleep in. We asked for a high floor reading reviews about noise. Very practical and roomy. Large long balcony that overlooked the street - yes there was some noise at night but with the doors closed it was fine. Good size sitting room and little kitchen area to prepare stuff for the beach from trips to the local food pantry. We asked for plates and cultery as the cupboards were bare and quickly got this. Some small maintenance issues were quickly tended to. Bit of a problem with cockroaches but Im sure the staff will attend to this as we did alert them. Very pleasant stay all round. Hotel bar always seemed busy - one of the female staff didnt seem too happy to be working and was not particularly friendly but other staff pleasant. Check in was seriously at 3pm - we arrived at 7am in the morning and were hoping to get in around lunchtime but no luck - they appeared hugely busy ...these things happen.

If you can get this hotel for a cheap price I'd say you'll be happy. If you could have gotten one of the bigger resorts on the beach for the same price you'll be very disappointed. Staff was very friendly. The rooms are tiny (and I mean tiny). Rooms feel pretty dated too. My biggest complaint is there was no breakfast, at all. There was a crappy little coffee shop near the lobby that I would not recommend. They charge $3.50 for a bagel and then want to charge another 50 cents for cream cheese. Kind of feels like you're getting nickel and dimed there. Location is okay. Within walking distance of everything but the kuhio street gets a little "colorful" after 9PM. I'd advise a resort down by the beach unless your budget doesn't permit.

I had read mixed reviews on TripAdvisor but I (mistakenly) thought the conditions couldn't be that bad. They are. On our first night we found a roach in the hallway. On the second night we found a gecko in our room. There was never any toilet paper in the room. And from the third night onwards, the lock in our room did not work. And instead of being offered a differet room management sent in the technician to fix the lock every few hours! Every few hours. Every day for the rest of our stay. On our last day we came back to find the door fully opened (luckily nothing was missing) Finally, on our last night, I woke up in the middle of the night to find, guess what? More roaches running around the bedroom. Disgusting! I am a Marriot Rewards member and I can't believe this is a Marriott property. I had initially planned to come back after a week at the North Shore. I have since cancelled the reservation. I encourage everyone to do the same.

Its our first visit to Honolulu and we were very much welcome by the front desk team at Marriott. After a 10 hour flight, we got our room on the 2nd floor facing the main road and it was very noisy for us to have a good night sleep. A request of room change was handled very efficiently and promptly and we were very impressed with the professionalism. The rest of our stay was flawless!!Location - well located with only 5 minutes walk to the shopping area (DFS/H&M, Macy, etc). Another 5 minutes walk from there brings you to the beach. There is a bus stop in front of the hotel as well as across the road which makes it so easy for us to go around the island. 20 mins walk to Ala Moana Centre.Room - Very spacious with 2 double beds and a nice balcony facing the swimming pool. A microwave comes in handy to heat up food or water as you don't get a kettle only a coffee maker. Pillows were soft and comfortable so are the beds. Toilet was a bit dark but manageable. I would definitely stay here again!! Thanks for making our trip so memorable.

If you don't mind sleeping with roaches then this is the place to stay. I found 4 roaches the first nite, 3 in the morning & 2 on the second night after they told me they would spray. I was moved to another room and see what I found in the picture.

I've stayed at the Courtyard on multiple visits and it's a good, economical option that's reasonably close to the beach and restaurants. It's clean and convenient (considering I spend most of my aloha-time outside of the hotel, it's usually a bargain). The rooms are snug (especially the showers) and they have been modestly upgraded recently. The desk staff is friendly and helpful. I like that there's a hospitality room available if you have a red-eye flight (handy for squeezing as much beach time in as you can!). Rooms on the Kuhio side tend to be noisy. Parking is expensive. Definitely an overall value play if you come to Hawaii a lot and want to save a few bucks.

We stayed one night in the Courtyard Waikiki Beach for our layover to Kauai the next morning. It was a short but good stay.The hotel is well located and it takes less than a 10 minute walk to get to the Waikiki strip. The drive from the airport to the hotel took about 20 minutes, so quite smooth.The staff was great, very efficient while remaining friendly. Although the room was a bit small (for me, my wife and our 18 month old), it was quite well appointed, had AC and even a built-in small kitchen. The shower was a bit small. We were on one of the upper floors and had a partial ocean view. It had a nice balcony as well.The main entrance hall has a coffee shop and some other stores and there is a pool with seating area outside, which was quite nice. The property feels a bit aged, but all in all it was good value to be right downtown.Definitely a good value option in a good location near the Waikiki strip

Small room and the noise was sometimes annoying. I stayed here two different times in November 2016 and I was on different sides, still a bit noisy. The front desk staff are great and really helpful. The valet staff need an attitude adjustment. Perhaps it was because I wasn't in a car, but they were not very helpful with transportation or the luggage storage. There is a nice coffee shop and the staff are super friendly even early in the morning. Very clean. It's your average Courtyard, but near the beach and shopping.

The staff and bell service were terrific and efficient. The rooms are out dated. The first room smelled like wet dog and the AC barely worked. They moved us to another tower which was slightly better but not great. Shower is small and no lights. Great location but needs improvement.

Stayed several times due to the property's prime location in Waikiki and lower price, but let's just say, you get what you pay for. The rooms have had a minimal remodel recently, but it amounts to some new carpet and paint. The door to every room I stayed in had a large gap at the bottom, sometimes up to two inches. The AC in the rooms is anemic at best. Even after notifying the front desk, they weren't able to fix it. There isn't much sound insulation for the rooms, so you get the pleasure of all the best street noise that Waikiki has to offer. On the positive side, the wifi is fast, the beds are comfortable, the pool is small but nice, and the lobby/bar area is comfortable.

Visited there around Thanksgiving. The hotel and the room are pleasant. The location is great, just a couple of blocks from the center of the action in Waikiki and an easy walk to the beach. Lots of stores, restaurants, and services around, and it's on major bus lines. I wish they could give me more confidence in the cleanliness of the room, maybe shampoo the carper and scrub the shower walls. The bed is much too soft for my preference. The street noise can be a little loud, but that didn't bother me, but it's noticeable if you're sensitive to that.

I booked this hotel at the last minute. And did not realize that in order to stay here you have to pay $39.00 dollars to park your car. Seriously that is a little much. So please check that. When I checked in the front desk staff was pleasant. The rooms are very very small compared to other courtyards I have stayed. If you are a tall or chubby person you might have trouble in the shower. It was pretty small and shower head low. Even though the room was small. It was very clean and neat. It had a microwave oven and and mini frig. Overall not a bad stay. Would I stay here again?? Probably not because of the over excessive price for parking. If this review helped you please let me know. Thanks

My family really injoyed this hotel. Very clean and neat. And the coffee shop is AMAZING! Right in the center of everything. Can't wait to vacation here again. Comfortable beds, rooms are alittle tight, little closet space but it was manageable for a family of 3.

I went to the Marriott app and was able to get a great rate on short notice which included a discount for reward members. Although I was unable to check in on the app (probably due to late booking status), I was greeted warmly, and checked in efficiently by the front desk staff. The next day, our keys would not work, and we thought it was due to checking out status for that day, but the front desk made new keys, and sent a technician to meet us at the room, as she indicated the keys still showed as valid. The technician arrived on the floor at the same time we did and he let us in the room and indicated he would have to get some tool to fix the lock because the new keys also did not work. We were checked out efficiently and the room was nice as it has recently been remodeled. Although the shower was small and the shower head was low, this is not unusual for Waikiki.

If you're looking for a nice clean hotel and don't mind not having a resort atmosphere then this hotel is for you. My only druthers is that Ibooked a corner 1 bedroom suite based upon the pictures I saw on the website & what I got was a long narrow suite (room 758) which looked across directly into another apartment complex window. On the website I also had a confirmed complimentary continental breakfast for 2 & I asked about it when I checked in & the desk clerk said their computer didn't show it. Granted it was busy when I checked in so I didn't push it but afterwards I checked my email & showed it to the front desk. After that they gave me the vouchers.

I am surprised I haven’t received a survey request from Marriott from my last stay. I’ve been waiting for an after stay survey to express my dissatisfaction with my family stay in Courtyard Waikiki Beach. We stayed in this hotel from 27 July to 2 August. My satisfaction level for the hotel was nothing to write home about. The hotel site said there was a kitchenette on in the rooms, there was none. I can list a whole page of things that was wrong with the hotel but will only stay with the following:- The bed cover on our bed was ripped due to wear and tear- Visible rust on room ac- Dirt under the bed- No ice maker or microwave on our 8th floor, there’s only one icemaker and microwave on the first floor servicing the whole hotel. We have to go to the lobby every time we need ice or need to use the microwave- Banging noise from next door neighbor; I called the manager on them only to find out a teenage accidentally locked in the restroom and couldn’t get out. It so happened that my call was what saved the teenager, I never got a call from management to thank me for the call or apologize for all the noise that woke my family up from our afternoon siesta- Unknown people banging on our room doors and running away. We think this were teenagers staying on our floor whom we told to keep the noise down earlier in the day- No acknowledgement of elite members etc.Due to the poor services experienced at this property I will definitely not go back there for a stay nor recommend this property to fellow travelers.

The room was just ok. Nothing wrong with it but nothing stood out as above average. Most people wouldn't concern themselves too much about their room if they are spending as much time as possible outside in this beautiful island. Thank goodness we got out as much as possible.The gift shop was a poor excuse for a gift shop. Couldn't buy toiletries or snacks. they sold musical instruments and Asian supplements. Weird combination!I called the front desk for a courtesy toiletry kit. They said, "We stopped offering those". What? Who does that!?My girlfriend and I sat at the pool one morning early and we were "whooshed" away by a cranky old groundskeeper that told us we could not sit on the chairs...you know...the ones used for sitting? My complaint to the front desk fell on deaf ears when complaining about his rudeness.Parking was a nightmare and very expensive.Again, average experience but I will look for a different hotel the next time I visit without a doubt.

I stayed here for 2 nights and I think the location is great. I didn't rent a car and everything is in walking distance. The rooms are comfortable as I was located on the higher floor with a balcony. Note that this hotel do not charge resort fees, which is a big plus for me. Valet is charged, although you don't really need a car in Honolulu.The only complaint I have is that the walls are a bit thin. Otherwise, everything was great for me. No breakfast provided, although plenty of choices around the area.

Good location within easy walking distance to beach, shopping and the trolley. We stayed 2 nights before setting off on our 7 night cruise around the islands and then 2 more nights after the cruise was complete. Rooms were comfortable and nice. The biggest inconvenience was that 2 of the 3 washing machines in the guest laundry were out of service. This caused us to spend extra time that wouldn't have ordinarily been necessary. Staff was friendly and service was usually quick.

We stay here all the time. Best to ask for a room on "the quiet side" over looking the pool. The other side has suites, but is also on a noisy street. Service is great, right in the middle of it all, at a real good price.

I am writing this review while on stay since I am so embarrassed at least and angry at most. I booked 2 nights for 4 people. Two nights is a part of my 9 nights trip on Hawaii islands. I have stayed 2 nights on Courtyard on the other 2 islands resectively and was satisfied. So naturally I expected a good and same quality stay. 1. Bed: I wonder how a sofa bed is qualified as a bed. Its main usage should be a sofa, not a bed. Well I realize that I did not fully understand the description for the room a queen and a sofa bed because I perceived a sofa bed was not a bed. A sofa bed doesn't have the same quality as a regular bed. 2. NOISY: The room is "noise through". All the noises come through the windows on the balcony. The windows is supposed to filter the noise. I couldn't sleep and woke up at 3pm. A passing truck or suv on the street is a concrete example. So n-o-i-s-y!!! 3. Service people are still friendly.In conclusion I would not recommend my friends to stay on this place. My friends are planning to come to Hawaii because of my experience. This is my 2nd trip to Hawaii. The stay on Courtyard Waikiki Beach has ruined my family vacation. Period!!!
user_name:
johnmaeng
New York City, New York

review_body: Just got out yesterday and I was ready to leave from day one. I only stay at Marriotts and I do have a good relationship with chain, but this was a bad experience.Cons:Wifi - Non-existent in the rooms. You will be lucky to load the google page before 9pm, but after 9 expect it not to load at all. The lobby appears to work fine.Door & locks - Every room has issues with the doors. After checking in and dropping off my luggage, I had to use my foot for leverage to close the door. I did have them fix, which they promptly addressed but you still needed to pull to make sure it locked properly.Bathroom - Small in all dimensions. If you are short or overweight, this is not the hotel for you. I barely fit in the shower and I am short, I had to constantly adjust the shower head. One other thing that bothered me but I never had the hotel staff fix was the toilet. It was not fully bolted down so every time you sat down you felt it move a little.Halls - They were sort of cleaning up the place. I noticed a lot of drying fixes. I just wish they had also painted them. Pool - You are in Hawaii, what is the need for a pool? I did walk down there, its a bit dirty and small, not to mention because it is surrounded by buildings, don't expect any tanning to occur here.Pros:Pillows - God I love these pillows. I keep meaning to buy some of them. They are amazing. The beds are ok, but these pillows are just to die for.Lobby - They must have just re-did the place recently because they were doing photo shoots of the bar, guest station, etc.Location - While not right on the beach, you are a very short walk from everything. Staff - Like everywhere in Hawaii, they are always polite and friendly.
user_name:
Ben P
Waltham, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: Close to all Waikiki's sights and whereabouts we truly enjoyed this hotel for a short stop getting in on a late flight. Free wifi with decent speed, clean large room with balcony, comfortable beds as on most if not all Marriot hotels..

On the other hand, if this hotel were in St. Louis the bathrooms would be larger. The bed is comfortable, the room is clean, the shower has hot water. If that is all you need this place is for you. I have been to Honolulu many times and recently stayed here for a purely business trip, but gosh it is a forlorn place. When you enter your room and close the door you close off all Hawaiian ambience. This property does not offer an attractive hotel room, it is more like a pleasant cell. THe service was fine and friendly.

Wow, talk about low end. This place wasn't terrible but the rooms are tiny, no view anywhere, very Old and dated, too much money for what its worth but the service was very good. We thought that a Marriott would naturally be a nice place to stay.....this one was questionable.

We made a group of reservations, one here, one in Maui and then one evening back here. On the last day, they did not have the one bedroom king room we had booked. On the first stay, they did not have it and downgraded us to a room in the older tower. We were not compensated for the one night downgrade. When we discussed this at the front desk checking in for the last stay, there was a room available that we had reserved. Since it was the last one, the front desk clerk called the manager for permission to sell it. Management refused to book us in to the type room we had reserved. We had a similar bad experience with the Courtyard in Kauai. We are done with Marriott!Topping it off, on the last night, the phone kept coming on speaker with a loud dial tone. Sleep was fleeting.
user_name:
Keith K
Portland, Oregon, United States

review_body: Great stay over a week in paradise. Actually a lot better then we thought after reading some previous reviews. We had some noise at night from the street but think that's most of Waikiki. The valet team were great and the service was always quick. Great happy hour specials in the bar. For us a better stay than the other Marriott property in Waikiki.

We were in Honolulu in June as part of a USA/Canada holiday. Having originally booked into a different hotel, we were disappointed so decided to switch to the the Courtyard Waikiki. Rooms were clean and comfortable, and staff were friendly and helpful. Location is prefect for getting about. Would recommend.

This property is in definite need of some upgrades. The lobby is fine and the staff helpful but the rooms are small, noisy and badly designed. The only plug in the bathroom is next to the toilet and not near the vanity. The shower is tiny with a shower head set for very short people. They are doing some upgrades to make it ADA compliant but that won't help the room design. It is fairly close to the shopping and beach area.

Only stayed a day before heading out to Maui. However, the place was clean, close to the beach and the staff was friendly. The bar is poolside and serve some great drinks. Accommodates kids as well as couples.

Was undergoing renovations - but staff were so helpful and the noise and mess was kept to a minimumWe were situated in the back tower - in a new room - clean and tidy - free wifi and aircon was cold!This is a cheaper location and one street back from the main strip - views are to East and back over the city - but very happy with the location and service

I have been staying at this hotel for 4 years on business trips to Honolulu. This time around it seems that they have stopped in their improvement in the property. I stayed in a room facing the main street and it was very noiset into the early hours of the moring. They sliding doors did not block any street noise. The property has tried to upgrade but things are still old. It seems they started to improve and then stopped

Came here on business. I've stayed here over 12 years ago and the place has really go r down. The room was really small and the bathroom was even smaller. The shower was so small I could barely fit in it and with no light in the shower it was very dark. The whole experience made me feel like I was staying in a YMCA...and this was on the "elite members" floor. Over all, I do not recommend this place and wi not stay here again. If you are a Marriott Rewards member, stay some where else!

Just checked in and so far so good! We were given a larger room on the corner in the main tower overlooking the pool. The room was very clean and comfortable. 4th floor....I was a bit weary about the low floor but so far not noisy at all.

Had five days at this hotel in October 2016.As the site mentions the hotel has been upgraded to the new look and the rooms are pretty well done. This was done in march but take note the hallways are still a bit of work in progress so not fully finished at this stage.Check in was a bit messy and resulted in a few issues but it happens sometimesLocation is good for catching the local bus places as it stops just outside and arrives back on the other side of the road.

A party hotel. Large loud party next door. Complained to staff and they finally moved us a hour later. At 11:30 woken up again by valet who needed a key for car and had to carry it to front desk. Toliet did not work and they had to send someone to repair it. Shower stopped up and had to stand in an inch of what I hope was my shower water.Our room was in a sections of hotel that required you walking about a half a block to your room . Had to walk over at night and a bunch of homeless people standing around between our room and main building. Worst hotel experience I have ever had. I have been places where I paid a lot less and the room was clean and in good repair. This looks like a place they keep for college parties. .

We stayed in the hotel two nights one week and another night the following weekend. We got the same room, at our request, and thoroughly enjoyed both visits. The staff was extremely nice and friendly, along with very helpful with some of our travel needs on our first visit to the islands. Christian (concierge) and Jose (bartender) both provided recommendations for dinner, breakfast, and travel options. The front desk folks (Liane, Suki) were very accomodating, and helpful. I would stay here again should I every be back in Waikiki.

Stayed one night and was very glad I didn't have to stay another. The building is old and worn. The furniture is old and stained and disgusting. I booked two one bedroom suites and allegedly checked in the day before on the app. However, once I got to the hotel, I was told that, despite calling the hotel directly weeks in advance and having it noted on my reservation, and despite checking in 24 hours in advance, they were unable to honor a request that both suites be on the same floor. My request for extra towels and pillows was not granted. We pulled out one of the pullout couch beds and it was so stained no one wanted to sleep on it. Don't bother asking to change rooms because they won't do it if you so much as dropped your bags, used the bathroom and left the room. While the front desk people seem really nice to deal with, you never get your concerns addressed. They just offer a breakfast coupon and assume that the matter is sufficiently taken care of. We were told no sheets/blankets or pillows were provided for the pullout because it was their policy to have housekeeping make up the pullout if it was to be used. However, we came in at midnight and the bed wasn't made, no sheets or anything were in the room and we had to wait for housekeeping. When housekeeping did finally come, they just dropped off linens and left, So much for making up the bed. We had to have them called back to make the pullout because it was too disgusting to touch and we had been promised that numerous layers of sheets would be placed to keep distance from the mattress. Never happened. The air conditioner and several lights in that suited didn't work and a TV in the living room of the second suite didn't work. The walls are so thin you can hear everything going on around you including traffic and street noise as well as noise in the hallways;.The pool looked small. The valet area was so congested you would have to wait forever for your car or for a cab to be called. The breakfast coupons were worthless as the kitchen in on the of the restaurants was closed because the exhaust fan wasn't working and the other option only had bagels. We spent less than 24 hours in Honolulu and only approximately nine hours at the hotel and we couldn't wait to leave.

From arriving to leaving they made it very easy to get into your room. From the front desk to the valet to housekeeping. Not close to the beach but they have a great pool and jacuzzi. If you plan on just getting a basic room this hotel has it, because who wants to stay in the room the whole vacation, but they also have larger updated rooms too very modern and clean. Also there is a good Italian restaurant right in the hotel. Enjoy!

Absolutely value for money hotel in the centre of all amenities in Waikiki beach area,pleasant staff,good cleanliness and comfortable bed. All bars,restaurants and shops within walking distance and of course the beach. Great place to stay and I love Hawaii having been visiting for the last 20yrs. I thoroughly recommend this hotel for anyone coming for the first time,as all transport to where you would wish to go stops outside. Stay and enjoy.

First time in Hawaii and we stayed at the Courtyard. It wasn't the best but I'm sure it's wasn't the worst either. Close enough to walk to Waikiki beach. Bedroom was really small. Not much amenities and had to go to the 2nd floor and we were on the 6th for ice. That was annoying. Other than that everyone we came across was pleasant.

Although our room was very clean and had beautiful views, it was too noisy just to hang out in our room. There was construction going on from early in the morning to early evening. Of course this was out of their control but it was very annoying. Also, the room was quite small. What we did like was the bar on the premises and the adjoining Italian restaurant where the food was very good.

Arriving in Honolulu at 6:30am on a flight from Australia you never know if you'll actually get an early check in from any hotel, and I think in most instances you probably wouldn't.We headed straight to the reception desk at the hotel and explained our situation to Larissa, who told us that she'd see if she could find us anything before our actual checkin time (which was much later in the day).After looking for ages Larissa ended up finding something for us so that we could check in, relax and sleep (about 10am by this time) and this set the mood for the rest of our stay.The hotel is clean and comfortable, the pool and hot tub are clean (saw a maintenance guy testing the water at the end of that day), there are deck chairs around to relax in the sun (or shade, if you wish) and the location of the hotel is great.There is also a laundry to wash your clothing (great for families who need access to a washing machine).Close to shopping, restaurants and a couple of blocks back from the beach.Wifi is also available (we used the standard one provided for free by the hotel with no issues) and no resort fee is a plus.We would not hesitate to stay here again, and will definitely recommend it to others.Special shoutout to Larissa at reception who went above and beyond in trying to find us a room quickly (and succeeded), she is an asset to this hotel.

Called at 1100 the day of our stay to ask if early check-in would be available and to see if there was a shuttle available to bring us to Pearl Harbor at 1230 for a 1315 tour. Was greeted kindly over the phone and was told early check-in would be no problem and that a shuttle would be available once we checked in. Upon arrival at the hotel, the valet services seemed to be very rushed and rude. Asked about self parking, they said we would not be permitted to park on property and that they had no idea where I could park. Then was asked when we would expect to need our car again, (not sure why that matters), to which I replied not soon since we would be taking a shuttle back out.Checked in with the front desk and was informed no early check-in was available. I asked for the employee I spoke with on the phone about early check-in to which she replied "I never said you could check in early" (which was the entire reason I called earlier). After a few minutes of back and fourth, the clerk "found" a room available. Dropped off our bags, and came down to schedule the shuttle to Pearl Harbor. Unfortunately the last shuttle to Pearl Harbor was at 1030. Ok, I was told a shuttle would be available. You see a trend here? Went outside to valet to request our car and was given an uninthused look like, really? Returning from our afternoon out was a relief because it seemed the mood of hotel staff had changed. We got to our room to realize the air conditioning unit was blowing what seemed to be cool air with the enthusiasm of a gnats flapping wings. Called down to see if we could get service for the unit. About 20 minutes later an employee shows up to inform us that the unit was working normally and there was "nothing he could do," awesome.Off to bed we went. What we didn't realize when we got to the room was that it was located just feet away from the nightlife. Yeah! Lucky us! The entire night was restless between the on again off again air conditioning unit, and the sound of young adults filled with the libations of your local establishments screaming up and down the street.Checking out was highlight of our stay. Needless to say we will not be back, and will not recommend this location to anyone. Lucky for Marriott, I have stayed at many courtyards and know that this location yields no reflection of what to expect at others.

We thought with the name there would be a high level of service however this hotel is a blight on the brand. We arrived late in the evening to check in and had to wait 20 mins, then our keys would not work so had to return to reception, then found the sofa bed did not have linen on it (& were short 1 towel even tho booking was for 4). Upon phoning housekeeping they were more than willing to help until no one arrived so had to recontact after 1/2 hour (by this time it was midnight and everyone was very tired). Then the shower was so slippery 1 member of our family slipped over. The room was in the second tower and was so very noisy -traffic, garbage trucks at 5am, passers by, other guests...no soundproofing whatsoever. The room itself was nice and spatial. The location is brilliant, but this hotel really needs to train its staff to be more receptive to guests' needs, and maybe provide complimentary ear plugs in the room.

Very friendly staff. From front desk to house keeping to bell men. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Short walk to restaurants for all tastes and budgets. Rooms had a mini fridge, and microwave. Great value for the cost.

A comfortable hotel walking distance to the Waikiki Beach and other entertainment, shopping and dining outlets. No airport shuttle and some of the reception staff came across as inadequately trained and experienced in understanding the nuances of the hospitality and tourist industry. For example, it could be uncomfortable to a guest to be asked to wait on the kerb, with luggage, in anticipation of an airport shuttle (organised at Honolulu airport), when the same facility could be provided by the hotel staff. This is especially when one takes into account Hawaiian weather as frequent passing showers, light to moderate winds and express sunshine as also possible unfavourable traffic conditions. This is also an experience that a Marriott Guest would find as difficult to assimilate. This is also in contrast to the tourist or transit expectation of the famous, traditional Hawaiian courtesy and politeness and friendliness and overall amicability and good humour that makes any visit to the Hawaii Islands a soothing experience !

This Courtyard is a very nice hotel (4 star-ish) with pleasant and helpful staff but the relatively large bathroom is cursed by the smallest shower I have been forced to use since my last stay in Tokyo. My hotel rooms MUST have a comfortable bed and a decent shower. This shower fails on two counts - way too small, my 6 foot frame barely fits; and a shower head mounted about 5 feet above the floor. And this was in a Marriott Elite room. I would have dropped this hotel to 2 stars if everything else, particularly the staff, weren't so efficient and pleasant.

I spent a week in October 2016 while on business travel. Overall I had a good stay. The staff was friendly and professional. However, there was one rather major issue for me, namely the internet. As a Gold Elite, I'm entitled to fast internet access. Unfortunately the internet was essentially non-functional in my room on the 9th floor. It took me three days and a call to the independent internet provider just to figure out how to even get on the fast internet -- none of the staff knew that one has to go to a special website (internetupgrade.marriott.com) to get onto the fast internet (the instructions they gave were simply wrong). Once I had this information, I still wasn't able to use the fast internet in any practical way. Frequently my requests simply timed out before establishing the fast connection. Even when I managed to get on, I was kicked off within 5 to 10 minutes, sometimes sooner and then had to start the process over again. The only functional connections I was able to establish were from the lobby. This being 2016 there simply is no excuse for such deficient connectivity.

On a staycation i Waikiki, we stayed at the Courtyard, located conveniently in the heart of Waikiki. Down the street on Kuhio is the newly renovated International Market Place, several blocks towards the ocean (makai) is the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. The Duty free shops are also several blocks away. There is a new Nordstrom Rack further down on Kuhio and the No. 8 bus runs in front of the Marriott on Kuhio Avenue directly to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Arizona Memorial, Pearl Harbor and places in between. There is a 24 hour IHOP directly across the street. Like most Marriott, there is a market store with some sundries at the lobby of the Mairriott and a small bar with tv.We didn't sample the in house offerings as there were too many other proximate places.This Marriott has been recently refurbished. The rooms are basic, clean Marriott fare. WE had a partial ocean view which was nice, Its a bit noisy-- the trucks come early in the morning and are not quiet. The patio door was difficult to maneuver-- housekeeping came once to assist but it continued to be a problem. But overall, we had no complaints. The best part is the price-- reasonable for Waikiki and the location can't be beat.
