Housekeeping and reception service very friendly, courteous, prompt.there is valet parking-- like other hotel parking - its steep $39/day.

The Courtyard Waikiki Beach entire staff treated me with the courtesy and attention you expect from a fine hotel. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was friendly with all members of staff making me feel very welcome at all times. A special 'Thank you' to Tatiana for your true professionalism and great conversation. Please share this note with your management.Lewis DurhamLife Time Platinum Member

If I could go in a time machine......Marriott has another hotel located closer with ocean views. This is not that hotel. The total cost of this quick 3 night stay was almost the same as our stay at the Turtle Bay Resort on the North Shore. (With fees and excessive parking $39 per night) Parking is expensive but also directly outside our building. Our balcony view was of an empty lot and apartment buildings surrounding the area next to the canal. If you're going to pay decent money to stay in Waikiki, it should be on the beach or have views of it. Small but clean rooms and fun pool. Good for a quick stay off the main drag with grab and go self serve options in the small lobby. Know what you are getting for the money and check for other parking garage rates nearby for $22 daily. Young outdoor staff needs some training and oversight.

Perfect location, close to everything, short walk to the ocean. Rooms are small but nice and fully functional, lobby area and pool are modern, clean and neat. We were on the 14th floor, which you would think would be quiet...nope. One of the streets the hotel is on is a very noisy one, and it seemed like it never really died down. Motorcycles, cars, anything accelerating at all hours. So, while the noise isn't controllable by the hotel, the windows and sliding glass doors are. They are old, seriously in need of replacement (by modern hotel standards), and basically provide little to no sound insulation. So, if you are a light sleeper, don't stay here. If you aren't, do.

We flew in from Kona for a concert @ the Blaisdell Arena and stayed here 3 nights. It was perfect for our needs and such an easy walk everywhere. Maybe we lucked out on the location of our room, but noisy nights was never an issue with the AC on & windows closed.I found the staff and the ambience to be pleasant from start to finish. The refurbished room was comfortable, bed great and a very spacious balcony.When we visit Honolulu, we only need a room for sleeping as we continue to explore in and around the city returning to the hotel about 9pm for a night cap and bed. My husband is a Gold Level rewards member with Marriott and he is known to be fussy. He loved the experience too!

Now that I'ved checked out, i'm reading reviews....probably should've done the reverse. I figured "Marriott", gotta be a "safe bet". I also stayed here for business and Marriott is one of our preferred hotels, so this is where I ended up. Location is okay (though not on the beach). My room was in the main tower with a king bed (16th floor), but my parents got a room with 2 doubles and got checked in to the darkest, spookiest, dreariest room in a small outer building (reminded me of a Motel 6....do those even still exist). I took one for the team and let them have my partial ocean view with a king, boy did I regret it! The noise ALL night was ridiculous. Between people using the pool until late hours, and people entering and exiting the complex using the stairs and the side "wrought iron" gate that slams shut every time someone uses it, I got NO sleep! If you get assigned a room out there, do yourself a favor and request a room change. The room was very dark and depressing. Insufficient lighting throughout. I asked to room change the next day, and the Front Desk staff accommodated with no issues. The next room (night 2) was ok. In the main tower, but on the 3rd floor. The street noise (traffic) is prevalent all night, but at least I didnt have to deal with the wrought iron gate slamming shut all night. My parents left on day 3, so I got the room I was originally supposed to stay in for, the next two nights. 16th floor partial ocean view. Minimal traffic noise up here. Bright and cheerful room. Need more lighting in the bathroom. In both 1601 and 317, you are practically showering in the dark. There's no light inside the shower, so you are relying on the vanity lighting which is awful. Cleanliness is just average (though the housekeeping staff are super nice, and friendly), dust on the clock/nightstand, crooked lamp shades, my safe broke on day #3 and the engineer came up 3 times with different solutions, but none worked so I did without. Overall stay was okay. Nothing special about this property at all. The friendly, accommodating staff make up for the overall lack of any type of wow factor.

Great staff, very accommodating. I'll start the hotel review like this. If you are adverse to noisy nights, this is "not" the hotel for you. The noise didn't bother us, as a matter of fact we had a street view room on the 8th floor, and more than half my eleven day stay was spent with the patio door open. The beach is a little farther away than expected, but the spouse and I love walking, and it's very much within walking distance. So many places to shop and eat, within walking distance. The room was comfortable, a little smaller than expected, the shower was definitely smaller than expected, but both were very serviceable for our stay. The hotel pool was nice but cold, the sauna was very nice and warm. Bottom line, I would definitely stay here again.

This was the second stop on our multi centre honeymoon. The first thing to note, which we did not realise until we arrived, is that there are two Marriott's in Waikiki. When the travel agent told us Marriott Waikiki Beach we assumed we were on the beach but this one is not on the beach. It is still in a central location but there's about a ten minute walk to beach.We stayed in both a double room and and corner suite while we were here. The double room, although very nice and clean with a very comfy bed was tiny, with a tiny bathroom, and not sound proof at all. So we asked if we could upgrade. They upgraded us for free as it was our honeymoon but claimed they did not know it was our honeymoon until we told them even though the travel agent put it on the booking and the previous hotel on our trip knew. Unfortunately there were no suites available that day so we had to wait until out third night of four to upgrade.The corner suite was very nice, sound was not a problem due to the layout of the suite and the bed was again very comfy. The bathroom was slightly bigger than the last but still tiny. Only a shower no bath.There is a pool and a jaccuzi which were nice, we spent a few hours sunbathing with cocktails. Another thing to note is that it is illegal to drink alcohol on the beach in Hawaii so if you're picturing yourself sipping a cocktail on a sunlounger on the seafront, stop in a hotel on the seafront as there's no beach bars etc.

If you want a good night's rest, avoid this hotel at all costs! My fault for not reading reviews prior to staying here. But since this was a work trip and my Company's preferred hotel is the Marriott chain, I didn't bother. Never again! My family and I stayed on the 5th floor facing the main street (Kuhio St, ,I believe), and it was SOOOOO loud every night. Constant noise from down below - motorcycles whizzing by, cars/trucks barrelling down the street, and a random guy ranting and raving outside at 3am one night. Needless to say, I did not get one iota of sleep in during my 2 nights here. We also stayed right next to the elevators - as another reviewer said, it sounded like a freight train running through the room, it was soooo loud. It really bears repeating - DO NOT stay in any of the rooms ending in 11 or 7. Those are the ones next to the elevator shafts. So loud and annoying.Other than that, the staff was fine - check-in went smoothly/quickly and housekeeping was efficient. The rooms are so-so; not particularly fancy; just OK. But these "pros" cannot undo two nights of the worst sleep I have ever had in my life. It just put me in the worst mood every morning.

Come to Oahu almost every year for last 25 yrs. Its a business vacation.We usually stay further down Waikiki toward Diamondhead.This time we opted for this property.Stay was ok but the rooms seemed a bit small. Would not recommend rooms on the street side due to loud traffic.Staff was very nice.Had noise issue with children on same floor and was moved to much better room.

A little noisy, even on the 17th floor, partly because of nearby construction, and partly because the windows are not sound-proofed. No real view to speak of, although if you go out on the balcony, technically you have a view of the ocean. It would've been nice if there were electrical outlets by the nightstands, without having to pull the bed away from the wall. The clock was 2+ hours off, and although I left a note for the maid to please fix it for two days, the clock never got corrected and the note finally just disappeared. On the plus side, the hotel is just a few minutes walk from Waikiki beach, and significantly less expensive than being right on the beach.

Great Hotel. Although not a 5 star place (because of it's age the room are smaller, etc.) it has is a 5 star in service and staff. Have stayed here approx. 10 times over the last 10 years and it's always great service! Frankly, the staff is some of the best I've ever seen -- they are friendly, cooperative, attentive and make you feel like you are valuable to them and they are very happy you are there. While it's a few blocks from the main "strip" and beach, it's still very convenient.

Stayed for 4 nights, staff was very friendly and helpful. Location is 10 mins walk away from waikiki very centrally located .totally worth it.i highly recommend this hotel based on the price and location. Mcdonald and ABC stores are right around the corner

While the rooms were clean and the staff was friendly, this isn't a great place to stay especially if you go to bed at a "normal " time. Lots of street noise everywhere. Several options within walking distance to eat or shop for your trinkets. I doubt I'll stay there again.

Stayed here 1 night because our flight from Auckland NZ arrived too late to catch a flight to Kona. Very small room. breakfast included on outside patio. certainly would not reccomend for a visit to Honolulu although the prices were low.

I couldn't believe my eyes and EARS when I pulled up at this "supposed" Courtyard! It looked like an old Motel 6 with some green paint thrown on to give it a "supposed" tropical look but this place is anything but. It has two sad looking buildings that feel very separated from Hawaii, like it belongs in another neighborhood. They think throwing a few palm trees around a very small, uncomfortable looking pool will make it paradise-like. But imagine trying to relax there with cars honking all day and a busy, surrounding parking lot with valet attendants talking loud, yeah good luck with that. I should've seen the signs when they told me my original room wasn't ready and mind you, this is close to 5 p.m.. Then they told me a "supposed" similar style room was available in their back building which was newly refurbished (yeah, right), but on a lower floor. Now I'm VERY sensitive to street noise and I told him that but he assured me the room was soundproofed but it was an outright LIE!! The hotel is centrally located, surrounded by extremely busy streets, and it was the WORST night of sleep I've had in years!! When I complained to the front desk around 2 in the morning, there was no apology, just a robotic "I'll send some earplugs" as if they're used to hearing this complaint so "here ya go"....believe me the earplugs did nothing to silence the noise. That's how loud the traffic is outside. When I complained again the next morning, they offered me some bonus points and free breakfast as consolation but I'm mad at myself for accepting this now. I should've just got a full refund for the horrible night. After one night, I was outta there!!It is unacceptable that Marriott would associate the name with this place. I've stayed at many Courtyards around the world and for this to be located in Hawaii, which is supposed to be paradise on earth, the name deserves better! No wonder why it's poorly rated here on Tripadvisor, I should've read the reviews before I stayed. Do yourself a HUGE favor, stay somewhere else!

Nice enough place but if you're a light sleeper ask for a high room as noise from the street is pretty intense at times! Close to everything, most of the hotel staff and helpful and friendly. Bus stops are right out front so easy to navigate and get around.

I've stayed in many Courtyard properties, and this property does not meet Courtyard standards. If you are expecting a Courtyard experience, you will be disappointed. While it is centrally located between the canal and the beach, it is an old property that needs a complete refurbishment. There was paint peeling and burned out light bulbs in the hallways, my bath window was rusted so that it didn't shut, the slider lock was broken and used an old "pin" to lock, the partition on the baloney was flimsy, there was a electrical power strip under my bed that looked of questionable safety, the coffee pot was larger than the supplied coffee packs so the coffee was weak, and parking was $39/night. Top this off with very loud road noise, and it was an overall bad experience. Fortunately, I had only booked one night.

Central location close to beach, bars and shopping. Service excellent from the moment we arrived through checkout.The area around the hotel is a hive of activity and knowing that, we had a room in the block across from the main lobby/building. I would suggest a room in this block if you like quieter evenings and mornings. The main block has the main pool, bars with great food and service, computer area and gift shop. The block we had a room in has a self-serve laundry and a little heated, salt water pool. The towels are available from the main pool. Room smart and well equipped with usual furniture and safe. Though the bathroom was small, we loved the large balcony with chairs and table. From there we were able to enjoy a glass of wine in the afternoon sun while watching the activities in a couple of rooftop pools across from us. There were coffee/tea items as well as a fridge and microwave too.As well as within easy walking distance of the beach, restaurants, bars and shopping, there is an ABC within steps of the lobby and a Ross Dress for Less a couple of blocks away.The location is perfect and is within walking distance of the beach, entertainment, coffee shops, bars and restaurants, shopping etc. and the hotel service excellent.

A great location on the corner of Lewers and Royal Hawaiian, the hotel was ideal for proximity to the shops, and beach. Very shaded pool area, tiny bar area, Internet cafe, coffee shop and Italian restaurant on site. Large rooms with small lanai, with kitchenette. Very friendly and helpful reception staff, maintenance staff, and waiters/servers at the restaurant. I'd have no hesitation in staying again!

This is not a great place to stay. Not too close to Waikiki Beach; no room service; cafe run by a separate business nearby - mediocre. The first night we had a room impacted by renovation works, couldn't access the balcony. The second night, we were impacted my a noisy mob of basketballers in the adjacent room. Management tried to quiet them but to little effect. So, little sleep. The rooms themselves were Ok. Don't think I would stay there again.

Small ,very clean ,frienly staf ,centric location ,nice pool ,small lobby ,for us was perfect .large room with good air condition, has parking over night $37.00 to much for me ,but we use the Trolley stop in from ,many restaurant around waking distant to the beach

1st night next elevator and my mom was down the hall. Talked to Courtney the next morning and got moved to back tower and my mom (88) right next door. Everyday was a great day. There is no view but your only two blocks away.

I booked a Jr. Suite recently for just a night since it was the Waikiki Hoolaulea...we are locals so the good thing was that we got a Kamaaaina discount (with our Hawaii drivers license)...good thing since one night is 500.00 (steep!) but with the discount it dropped down to $356.00 but with all the fees taxes etc...Oh parking is only Valet 39.00 a day...good thing was only 1 night...the room was decent but for Marriott standards it was kinda disappointing....they did have a Happy hour...(that helped drinks were 1/2 off)....the staff very nice and friendly...

Pretty expensive parking - rooms were kind of small, and desk refused "guaranteed" late checkout. Also had to call them on their "best rate guarantee" which they did make good on.Was a decent option - but those couple hang ups kept me from giving a 4 star. Would try something else next time in town for sure.

Up front: The location is not on the beach, most rooms don't have an ocean view. It is about .25 mi from the beach, which is an easy walk.The things that I love the most is the staff; they are AWESOME. It is also nice to see the same people year on year, always smiling and welcoming.The main parts of the hotel have been recently renovated, and most of the rooms are fresh and clean.

Older facility but clean. Pool is in the shade ad rooms have no view. Single room is very small. Would suggest closer to the beach for much better facilities. If price conscious then consider but remember the drawbacks

As a lifetime gold and platinum member, I have traveled worldwide and always found hotels under the Marriott brand to offer consistent quality. This hotel was the exception. I was in room 905. It faced a busy thoroughfare with a bus stop under my sliding doors. The carpeting both in the room and halls was filthy. The grout in the tiny bathroom was dirty. The bathroom door had paint peeling off the bottom. The biggest insult was being charged $499 for the first night- a huge ripoff! I gave up trying to get help at the desk. There was only one person working. Finally, I reached my wits end and demanded that I be allowed to check out early with no penalty. I moved to another hotel. One can tell that little investment has been made here. I assume that this hotel is not directly owned by Marriott. If I were them, I yank the franchise from whomever had it.This is a real disgrace to the Marriott name. I will never suggest that any of my colleagues stay here.

I feel this hotel did not live up to the Marriot Courtyard name. The hotel needs some repairs. The outside exterior of the building is peeling. My issue was mainly with the bathroom. The toilet set was badly in need of replacement. I cannot understand how a hotel cannot afford to may a minor replacement of the toilet seat. The showerhead was very low. I am 6 feet and it was for someone about 5 feet 8 inches. There were a couple of good points - (1) The location is great (2) I enjoyed the bar area.

Rooms next to elevator are impossible to sleep in due to terrible elevator noise. Sounds like a freight train all night long. Avoid rooms ending in 07 and 11. I was on the 14th floor but I assume they all have the same problem. This will absolutely ruin your trip.

This was a great hotel just a few minutes walk to the beach and Waikiki shops. We had a suite which was a great size as we spent over a week there. The staff were all very friendly. The rooms clean and the bathrooms a good size. Would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Pretty standard hotel, with all the usual amenities the rooms could do with a bit more sound proofing but otherwise were comfortable and all fine, reasonable location not too far from the beach, very good service.

I was pleasantly surprised by this Courtyard Waikiki Beach. The lobby was very welcoming and the staff efficient. They have a bar area as well as coffee shop. The rooms were nice and very clean. The bathroom room sink and shower area is a bit small but overall size of the bathroom was nice. The hotel is situated in a nice area close to many of Waikiki's attractions. The only thing - the front of the hotel and valet are on different streets - just pay attention to that if you have a rental car.

Cute little hotel about 3 blocks from the beach. Rooms are decent (a little muggy-but that comes with the salt air). Relaxing pool area, bar with happy hour. Conveniently located. Parking is $40 per night which is a little steep, but considering the area you don't have much choice. Shuttle is $14 OW from the airport.

After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, we were looking forward to staying at the Courtyard, but we were somewhat disappointed overall. Possibly we are naïve, but the room price that was quoted on their website was for the first night only. The nights thereafter were more expensive, which we didn't discover until checkout. Also, the room amenities were not replenished every day. No coffee for several days, no shampoo for two days, no notepad after the first day. We didn't like the coffee, had brought our own shampoo, used scraps of paper to write on. Nothing that was earth-shattering or a deal-breaker, but it did seem kind of chincy and not up to Marriott standards. On a brighter note, the staff at the front desk and the concierge could not have been nicer, which made a big difference to us.

The Courtyard is a hidden gem in Waikiki. Just a block off the main drag, the hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki. What's best is you don't have to deal with the congestion of Kalakaua Avenue traffic. I stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms which was lovely. The bar downstairs is intimate and has a nice vibe. The pool feels quiet and secluded despite being amongst nearby high rises. I walked to several great new restaurants nearby at the International Marketplace (3 blocks) and shopped at the Royal Hawaiian Center (1-2 blocks). The beach is also just on the other side of the Royal Hawaiian Center making it an easy walk even with beach toys. I highly recommend the Courtyard Waikiki Beach. Great rates, great rooms, great service.

If you plan on staying in your room, then maybe not a great hotel...the rooms are barely enough for two people with luggage. Space is tight. With that said, who is staying in their room in Hawaii? Not me! What I like: The rooms were clean, location is smack in the middle of Waikiki so walking to shops, restaurants etc. The hotel is clean, the air conditioner worked really well, something you may take for granted. I have found that some hotels in waikiki don't have good air conditioners. The wifi is free, but I chose to upgrade so I don't know how good the free wifi is. I also like the fact that the business center computers and printer downstairs are free to use. They have a restaurant, coffee shop and spa on the lobby level. Drawbacks: No call downs for your car, but my experience wasn't too bad for valet parking and rooms along Kuhio Ave are a little noisey with traffic and people leaving bars, but quiet down after 2am.. Other drawbacks: the resort fee and the parking fee are a little pricey. If I had the option, I would not hesitate to book a room here again, I would gladly do so.

I cannot believe Mariott is willing to put their name on this hotel. It is aging and dated with unclean rooms, gross bed linens and dark dingy bathrooms: and that is the "deluxe" room. There is a main tower and then a separate tower across the street. The separate tower is accessed via an elevator off a dark parking lot down a dark poorly lit corridor. I was seriously afraid to go to my room each night. Just despicable. Who cares that the front desk staff were nice. I just can't believe people actually stay here. I never will again.

Unless you are a dwarf limit your stay here to 3 nights or under. It just gets depressing after that to stay in such a tiny place, especially if you are paying $39 a night for valet parking! It's very cramped, has no restaurants and far better can be found for the same price nearby. This should not be a Marriott as the name lends it a value it does not have.

In this price point, let me assure you...this place is amazing. And that is what my review is based on. The category this hotel falls into. It would not be fair to compare it to a luxury hotel that charges 2-3 times the price, that simple.Pros:Close to pretty much everything...like walking distance to the beach, unlimited shopping (from the very high end, to the silly touristy souvenir shops), restaurant options from 3.99 breakfast 1/2 block away to $7-15 downstairs in the lobby area, all different types of restaurants, bars, clubs...Nice pool with a lovely water fallAmazingly friendly and attentive front desk workersValet...expensive, but fast and courteousClean roomsnon intrusive cleaning ladies Extremely affordable. $149 a night...seriously...you can't beat that, and not get a yucky place.yelp.com/biz/castle-hoke…Cons:Rooms are very small...but you are in Hawaii! How much time do you want to spend in your room?Bathroom is silly smallNo views....but...it's $149 a night...so...freakin...what. If you want a view, pay up and get one

We stayed here two nights after a cruise around the islands. Just to be able to see Pearl Harbor. The room was ok, except the shower door didn't close all the way, the door to the room had a 1/2 inch space so you could see thru and light all night. The lights were burned out at the bed side. They need to do a lot of repairs on each room.

my stay here at the courtyard was an awesome experience. A beautiful venue and a staff filled with aloha. You will not regret your stay here at the courtyard Marriott, my wife and I loved it and we cannot wait for our next stay here again

I was surprised at the size of the room when I opened the door. TINY! Decor was fine but there was no place to move. The bathroom was extremely small. A big person would have an issue manipulating themselves in the shower.Only there for two nights so, this was do-able. The location is great - close to the beach. The bartender in the lobby bar - so slow. Not friendly. Perhaps the worst martini I've had. Couldn't drink it.Front desk personnel was friendly. And the room was clean. Bed was a bit firm for my taste but again for a brief 2-night stay; it worked. Had a lanai but really no special view. Given the big hotels right on the beach, I don't think the ocean is viewable from this property.

I had a company party and decided to stay at the Courtyard by Marriot for the night. I have nothing but good things to say. Check in was a breeze, the pool was perfect, the lounge chairs were very comfortable, valet gave great customer service, everyone was very friendly, and I have no complaints about my room. I stayed in the junior suite and I loved it. The bed was very comfy. The pillows are so fluffy and the sheets are clean. Usually I don't use the shampoo or conditioner that the hotel leaves in the rooms but who could go wrong with Paul Mitchell? Check out was really easy as well. You're able to do express checkout which means you dial out from the phone in the room and leave keys. That's it! I had a great experience!

Not an outstanding Courtyard property. Hard to keep the room cool. Valet was very good and nice young men. Rooms were average but did have a frig and microwave. Typical lobby very nice but as usual property goes down hill when you get to your floor. Average at best.

Do not stay here. The hotel valet parking is forced upon you. The cars get damaged...........badly. They lie & falsify paperwork. The hotel refuse to do anything about it claiming that the valet parking is provided by an outside company, but you have to pay the hotel for the parking - very convenient - no responsibility but they take take take your money & they damage your car.Breakfast facilities are also poor..........non-existent in fact.The bar closes when it chooses to, as does the front door meaning you have to walk around the back of the hotel to get in...........painful.The rooms that overlook the street are extremely noisy.The bolt on tower block around the back is poor. The family rooms are small rooms with extra beds thrown in there.The rooms also smell..........they need to replace their AC units.DEFINITELY TRY ELSEWHERE................VERY DISSAPPOINTED

First I must mention Ray, our concierge on the first leg of our trip. We stayed here 3 nights on arrival and 2 before departure. Checking in, our suite was on the second floor, but having read in Trip Advisor about the noise, asked if we could get a higher floor, and Ray was able to accommodate us. His demeanor is commendable, a fine host! There we had a view and the Suite was perfect, it was in the main building. Our second stay, the concierge Dylan was also helpful, yet not able to acquire a different Suite for us so we were assigned to a Tower Suite second floor, and the second night, we got a second room because the Suite just wasn't big enough for the three of us. Dylan did her best with what was available, for which we were grateful. Interestingly, our very first night there housekeeping forgot to clean our room. Fortunately we were able to get them in before they left for the day. If you don't need to stay right on the beach (I do not, this is only a couple blocks away, and I do not stay in Honolulu long, I save my time for the Big Island) and want reasonable accommodations in the big city, by all means this is a good bet. Overall: good staff, good cafe in lobby, reasonable amenities, and basically clean. Good value in Waikiki.

I had a very nice 1 bedroom suite conveniently located near the beach and shopping. I would definitely stay there again. Only next time I hope to enjoy the pool. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.

Staff were very helpful and friendly. Hotel was immaculately clean and always smelt of fresh frangipani!Location was so close to Waikiki Beach could walk there with in 10 minutes.Shopping was really close, just a few streets away - Victoria's Secret, H & M, forever 21 etc.The pool and spa were also very clean.

Nice location if you have to be in Waikiki. Close to transportation, restaurants and not too far from the beach. Nice, accommodating staff. The coffee joint in the lobby is good, but steer clear of the bar unless you like cheap booze. Try to get an upper level room, if possible, as the street noise can be pretty loud.

The staff are amazing, all so kind and helpful, very polite. I really could not fault the staff if I even tried. Entering the hotel, it is a very nice place. I didnt have a long wait for my room as I requested an early check in, unfortunatley on arrival to my room on the 7th floor with a balcony overlooking the pool, i was greeted with about 4 staff members in there, I was informed there was an issue with the room and that they would relocate me to another nice room. The room really did look quite nice. I was escorted down to the reception by the wonderful staff member who made polite conversation with me and apologised for the issue. soon enough staff had found me a room on the second floor to which i was escorted up to, on first glance the room looked decent and as I hadn't slept in over 24 hours I entered the room on acceptance. unfortunately on opening the curtains I was eye level with all the buses passing by on the street and greeted by a lot of noise, the bathroom was clean but small and dark. Still acceptable but far from the room I was originally given on the 7th floor. By the time night time arrived, we regretted our decision. This room was subjected to so much noise from the street below and we were even lucky enough to wake up in early hours of the morning to hear a man being beaten up outside our room, we could hear the fist hitting his face and a lot of yelling. The second night was very much the same.Id recommend this hotel based on the wonderful staff, how clean the hotel is and how beautiful the place is, but I would never stay here again if I were to be placed on the second floor overlooking the street, especially after previously staying in a higher floor overlooking the pool where it was nice and peaceful and room much more beautiful.

Have to say was very disappointed with how small the standard room is. Not sure if this is the norm in Hawaii though. At least the bed is very comfortable though I wish hotels would just have king beds as standard instead of these tiny double or Queens. Road noise is really bad if you are on the street side so beware. Pool is also quite small but nice. Only issue is only 10 loungers to fight over. There is enough room so how about a few more management. 2 families camped out can hog them all. On a positive note good position with bus stop outside the door and an ihop across the street.

Although renovations had just been completed, making the room clean and up to date, it's apparent that the design was to make as small of a room as possible and still qualify as a suite with King size bed. The bathroom is a puzzle. A good third of the bathroom space is un-used yet the shower stall is almost a torture chamber for medium to large sized people. It's also dark with no lighting. The room is fine otherwise. The view is not great but a short walk to the beach and you have the killer veiw of Waikiki with Diamond Head. Other than this I would say the staff is very courteous and professional including the valet parkers and I would recommend the hotel as it is located nicely for walking around Waikiki.

I was in town for a week for the Honolulu marathon. I read the reviews and was hoping to get a remodeled room, and I did.This is a awesome location. It's centrally located in Waikiki, walking distance to the beach, and right outside the bus stop.I saved a ton of money on cab fare, using the bus in combination with google maps public transportation feature. I ended up getting a newly remodeled suite that had its own living room. The upgrade was great, new furniture and great decor. I also had a open concept shower for the handicapped. So I didn't experience the smaller showers people keep mentioning on this site.Staff was super friendly and helped me with recommendations.My only knock on this property was during the day, construction was LOUD. Which was fine, I was out and about all day anyway.But once the remodel is finished, this place would be hard to beat.

The Courtyard was just as expected from most of the reviews. It was clean, a good location and perfect for a couple of nights. We are a family of 4. I wanted something for us to spend our first night after traveling from Florida...11 hours. We went to the Disney Aulani resort the next night but didn't want to spend so much the first night in the event of serious jet lag or a delayed flight. This was exactly what we needed.

Larissa provided the best customer service I've ever had at a hotel! She answered all of my questions (I had a lot!), was super friendly and represented Marriott well. I can't say enough good things about her!The room was perfect and very clean. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was clean and well-stocked with plenty of towels.The fitness area is also clean and hardly ever crowded. The pool's waterfall is very relaxing!I will definitely stay here again next time in in Waikiki! Thank you again, Larissa!!

Our room was larger than some and overlooked the beach. Coffee shop in courtyard was reasonable. Wish they could offer more affordable dinner option other than high priced pick on siteBeach was disappointing. Waikiki beach wasn't clean and many residents unfortunately are calling it their home - didn't feel out possessions were safe

Stayed here while i was with my husband on a Buisness trip. It is centrally located & a lot of shops/resturants are easy to get to with in walking distance. That being said, i would not classify this as a hotel for a family vacation. The rooms were too small and cramped. Ammenities were decent but not 'vacation' quality in my book!

We had a 1 bedroom deluxe with 2 double beds. Room was very small barely enough room to walk around the beds. We were on the street side of the hotel. Outside traffic was extremely noisy. We tried to move across the hall to get away from the noise but there were no more rooms available. Rooms were very dated and in need of remodel. Staff was friendly, butt we really didn't ask much of them. Pool was sufficient but not large. Overall I don't think I would stay here again. We were only there for 3 nights, as we were going on to Maui after visiting Pearl Harbor. Parking was Ridiculous! Mandatory valet parking at $25.00 per day. The valet people were very prompt and courteous though.

A very decent hotel, centrally located to shops, beach is a short walk from the hotelRooms are small but clean and decentStaff was very friendly and helpfulPool and pool area was very cleanBar was amazing Bus stop at your doorstep to take you around

Staff was very friendly. We were about a 10 min walk to the beach. The beds were comfortable rooms clean. Fridge in room was great, microwave would be nice. Valet parking only $39/day. Bus 19 & 20 from the airport bring you directly to hotel for $2.50, but the ride was very long 1 hour and crowded.

My family of 4 stayed in a one bedroom suite. The room itself was fine for us, the fold out sofa could have a thicker mattress but the main bed was very comfortable.The room was clean and large enough for our requirements, however I requested a high floor as I knew all one bed suites faced the street. We were given a suite on the third floor opposite rivals bar (excellent if you enjoy a 3am wake up to drunken fights and police sirens) management seriously need to look at double glazed doors to block the noise, I could hear the bell and commentary of the trolley as it went past. Staff were friendly, although some need re training on the policy of informing guests that their credit card will be charged after 7 days (we stayed for 10 nights and after 7 nights they automatically charged us even though I told them at check in that I wanted to pay cash on check out) however this was sorted out promptly by a supervisor.Location of the hotel is great, short walk to the beach, ABC store on next corner, bus stop at the front door.If you are looking for a good value for money place to stay with no resort fees, this place is for you.Just be sure to ask for a room away from the main road.

Don't expect a Marriott. Expect an overpriced 2 star motel. No complimentary water. Film and filth on the windows and hair left behind in the shower. Laminate furniture of Ikea quality or less... No room service and lousy check in by a trainee... I stayed here thinking in error I was staying at the OTHER Marriott. Rude awakening. Avoid.

We spent 4 days in Honolulu. Because of price/value balance, this hotel was amazing. It was soo near to any attraction point in Honolulu. It takes 2-3 min to walk to Waikiki Beach. There is an IHop just across the street.The only thing that is negative was hotel's street could be full of drunk people at midnight, when they sing or shout or laugh it could be really difficult to sleep.But other than that I love this hotel. I will surely recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

This hotel did not live up to the Marriott name. My room was not ready at the 3 o'clock check in. Took my cell phone number and said they would call when room was ready. Suggested I go out and see the sights or hang out at the bar, but offered no free drinks. Then when my room was finally ready, I had a sleepless night due to all the alarms that kept going off. Horrible sleep experience all nights I was there, constant car alarms going off and waking you up. The room itself look modern and clean, except the shower. I found hairs and dirt in the shower like it had not been cleaned. Also, sticky film on one of the shelves in the refrigerator. No exhaust fan in the bathroom, had to open window if you didn't want the mirror to fog. No safety feature in elevator anyone could just go up to your floor. Other members of my family stayed at the Marriott Resort, they had excellent customer service, cleanliness and promptness. Even gave them a Hawaiian luggage tag as a parting gift. You had to insert your room key for the elevator to work as well.

There is a pantry by the front desk if you want to buy food or snacks. It is very busy here, the front desk gets a little crowded (maybe a remodel?). The beach, restaurants, food stores and liquor stores are all in close walking distance. There is no airport shuttle. The staff is knowledgeable and deal with many tourists from around the world. Many of the staff are bilingual and some trilingual.

Just got back from a 5 day stay at this hotel, really warm and welcoming front desk staff. The rooms are a bit small but they are updated and very clean. Located right in the heart of Waikiki so no car was needed. Used Uber to get around. The hotel had a nice pool and hot tub if you didn't want or had time for the beach.They also allow you to take the pool towels to the beach, but remember they are not beach towels and are not big. I will be returning to this hotel for another stay. Thank you to the front desk staff (Tahana,Heidy and Liane for the Aloha welcome.

This hotel does not live up to the Marriott standard. As a loyal Marriott client, I was deeply disappointed in the room. The shower had very little hot water. The room I had was accessible only by stairs which is difficult when you have suitcases. The room was run down and motel like. If we were not so tired from our trip, I would have left the hotel the same day we checked in. Instead, we checked out the next day instead of staying the 5 nights that our reservation was for. Don't stay here!

For business travelers, this hotel ranks the best in Waikiki area for me. I have stayed at most of major hotels in the area. If you are a frequent business traveler, you know many of them are understandably full of tourists which means less service and slow response to your requests, right? This courtyard is different. They are pro at responding your requests. For instance, we, 4 people at 4 rooms, needed to extend our stay twice both on the same day we were supposed to check out. Although I thought I needed to find a new hotel, people at reception not only made new reservation but also went extra miles to make sure that we did not need to move our room! I especially need to thank Tatiana and Heidi at reception. They are super!

I'm a Marriott gold member and have stayed at this property 3 times in the last 6 months. Why do I keep staying here? Because I'm a business traveler and have to stay on budget. Oahu sadly lacks any business class hotels. Plus, I like the points.However, if I were on vacation or even using Marriott rewards to stay here, I wouldn't recomend it. Its an old hotel that was marginally updated and rebranded a Courtyard. The standard rooms are tiny and the bathrooms are even smaller. If you are a larger person, you may not even fit it the shower stall. Seriously.The rooms that over look Kuhio are very noisy.Do you like icy drinks? Well, get ready for a walk because the only ice machine is on the 2nd floor, out an exit door onto an unused, decrepit lanai. Oh, don't forget your room card, because without it, NO ICE FOR YOU!The staff is friendly enough, but one of the FD people kept refering to Bali. Go to Bali. Take a right past the bar at Bali. Hmmmm, could you mean VALET?And be aware that there is NO street parking available in Waikiki. The Courtyard charges $37 per night parking. So, my friend, think you scored a deal of the room price? Think again.I know that they offered free wifi, but not sure if its because of being a Gold member or not.On the positive side, its a quick walk to Waikiki beach and shopping area. Lots of resturaunts and shopping for those so inclined. So, like with most things in life, you get what you pay for. If you're looking for a tropical oasis, keep looking.

Our visit didn't start well.. We had booked for 6 nights but weren't able to get an upgrade. Our room was very small with barely enough room to walk around the bed, and a one person at a time bathroom and a caravan style shower. All was bearable but in the early hours of the morning, we had continual door banging around us as other guests moved from room to room. We tried to call reception and the concierge a few times but there was no answer. That morning, when we mentioned our concerns to the front desk, they immediately offered a breakfast voucher. We decided to upgrade to a bigger room with 2 double beds, microwave, sink and a safe for an extra US$25 per night. It was worth every cent, as we got the 17th floor, quieter and roomier. The hotel is an easy 15 minute walk to Waikiki beach with lots of shopping and restaurants in easy access. There is also the Pink line bus at the front door which provides a US$2 ride to all major resorts and the mega Ala Moana shopping venue. Front desk staff were helpful and courteous. The pool is small, bit there is also a larger mainly under used pool at the adjoining Marriott tower. There is an Expedia tour desk onsite. Wifi was free and excellent.
